text_A: When I was involved in a traffic accident.
label: fear

text_A: When I lost the person who meant the most to me.
label: sadness

text_A: The time I knocked a deer down - the sight of the animal's á injuries and helplessness.  The realization that the animal was á so badly hurt that it had to be put down, and when the animal á screamed at the moment of death.
label: disgust

text_A: When I did not speak the truth.
label: shame

text_A: When I got a letter offering me the Summer job that I had applied á for.
label: joy

text_A: When I was talking to HIM at a party for the first time in a long while and a friend came and interrupted us and HE left.
label: anger

text_A: When I saw all the very drunk kids (13-14 years old) in town on á Walpurgis night.
label: disgust

text_A: When I could not remember what to say about a presentation task á at an accounts meeting.
label: shame

text_A: When my uncle and my neighbour came home under police escort.
label: guilt

text_A: Every time I imagine that someone I love or I could contact a á serious illness, even death.
label: fear

text_A: When I had been obviously unjustly treated and had no possibility á of elucidating this.
label: anger

text_A: At a gathering I found myself involuntarily sitting next to two á people who expressed opinions that I considered very low and á discriminating.
label: disgust

text_A: After my girlfriend had taken her exam we went to her parent's á place.
label: joy

text_A: When, for the first time I realized the meaning of death.
label: fear

text_A: When I recently thought about the hard work it takes to study, and  á how one wants to try something else.  When I read a theoretical á book in English that I did not understand.
label: sadness

text_A: When I found a bristle in the liver paste tube.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was tired and unmotivated, I shouted at my girlfriend and á and brought up negative sides of her character which are actually á not so important.
label: shame

text_A: When I think that I do not study enough.  After the weekend I á think that I should have been able to have accomplished á something during that time.
label: guilt

text_A: When I pass an examination which I did not think I did well.
label: joy

text_A: When one has arranged to meet someone and that person arrives á late, in the meantime one starts thinking about all that could á have gone wrong e.g a traffic accident.
label: fear

text_A: When one is unjustly accused of something one has not done.
label: anger

text_A: When one finds out that someone you know is not at all like one á had thought, for instance friends who steal and things like that, á quite unwarranted.
label: disgust

text_A: When one has been unjust, stupid towards someone else.
label: shame

text_A: When one has neglected or been unjust to a good friend.
label: guilt

text_A: Passing an exam I did not expect to pass.
label: joy

text_A: When I climbed up a tree to pick apples.  The angle of the ladder á I was on did not enable me to get high enough.  This implied á that the ladder was not very stable.
label: fear

text_A: [ Same as in anger.]
label: sadness

text_A: Friends who torture animals.
label: disgust

text_A: [ Same as above - friends who torture animals.]
label: shame

text_A: When my 2 year old son climbed up and sat on the 7th floor á balcony with his legs hanging out.  He was holding on tightly to á the upper railing of the balcony but he could have easily lost á his balance when he sat down.
label: fear

text_A: When I nearly walked on a blindworm and then saw it crawl away.
label: disgust

text_A: When I saw my 18 year old son grab an oxygen mask as he had á breathing difficulties.  I had a bad conscience because I had not á stopped smoking.  Medication for the dilation of his breathing á tubes also caused a sense of guilt in me.
label: shame

text_A: Unjust accusations directed at me and my way of acting, by á someone close to me.
label: anger

text_A: Failing an examination.
label: sadness

text_A: When, as an adult I have been caught lying or behaving badly.
label: shame

text_A: When I am in an environment or with a person much worse off than á me, I realize how privileged I am.
label: guilt

text_A: When, as a child, I was nearly knocked down by a car.
label: fear

text_A: When I feel lonely, perhaps because I have to study a lot and I á am shut up in my appartment.  Nothing happens in particular á because there is no time for anything else.
label: sadness

text_A: When one lets friends down
label: guilt

text_A: When I was not accepted as a student in finance and accounting.
label: sadness

text_A: My elder brother and I have not always had a good relationship á and I feel ashamed of myself as I do not call him to talk to him á nowadays.
label: shame

text_A: Passed an exam by 2 points.
label: joy

text_A: In a cottage in a large forest, I was alone for a while in the á dark.
label: fear

text_A: When I spoke to Jan-Erik Wikstr÷m on the telephone.
label: anger

text_A: I saw a cripple in rags with small children in Italy.  He was á probably an imposter.
label: disgust

text_A: I told a friend that I was going to a party and he would not á enjoy himself if he came along.  He understood  that he would not á have fitted in and there was something in that.
label: shame

text_A: I was the reason behind the break-up of my friend's relationship á with his girlfriend.  She finished with him.
label: guilt

text_A: I passed an exam that I was absolutely certain that I had failed.
label: joy

text_A: On the way back from Denmark with a friend on a small yatch, á there was a storm and my friend was blown overboard;  I was very á scared till I managed to get him back onboard.
label: fear

text_A: I found some worms in the food and I had obviously eaten some.
label: disgust

text_A: I hapened to overhear something which I was not meant to hear.
label: guilt

text_A: When I am out in the dark and a suspicious looking character á comes towards me.
label: fear

text_A: At work, when an elderly man complained unjustifiably about me and á distrusted me.
label: anger

text_A: When my friend and I were discussing the good looks of a guy we á realized that he had been listening.
label: shame

text_A: When I complained about a colleague to the manager and he told á her that someone had complained; this colleague came to me á believing that I liked her.
label: guilt

text_A: On the way home one Friday night in the heavy rain the car á acquaplanned.  I lost contact with the road surface for a few á seconds.
label: fear

text_A: I do not help out enough at home.
label: guilt

text_A: When I flew from Athens to Copenhagen after a holiday.  The plane á was caught in a storm and it began to shake and I thouhght that á we were going to crash.
label: fear

text_A: It was when I read a newspaper article on the future and they á foresaw that we would be eating frog-burgers by the year 2000.  á An illustration showed a frog between two pieces of bread.
label: disgust

text_A: When I dropped a bottle in the state liquor store and everyboby á started laughing.
label: shame

text_A: When I was young - 14, I pinched from a store and was caught.  á The store then contacted my parents.
label: guilt

text_A: Marriage crises.  Boredom.
label: sadness

text_A: When someone makes advances that one does not want.
label: disgust

text_A: The discovery that one has only thought of oneself.
label: shame

text_A: When I spanked a child in anger and later regretted it terribly.
label: guilt

text_A: When my boyfriend went away for a month long holiday without me.
label: anger

text_A: Last year when I worked during the Summer holidays and studied á at the same time for an examination I had to repeat; my boyfriend á went to Greece for a holiday for a month.
label: sadness

text_A: When a dog is left whining outside a shop.
label: disgust

text_A: When I promised to help a friend over a weekend and did not keep á the promise.
label: shame

text_A: When I realized that I had three more examinations to take.
label: guilt

text_A: The day I was told that I had been accepted as a student of á economics.
label: joy

text_A: While taking a short cut through the Vasa park, I was surrounded á by three people who tried to steal my money.  I was scared and á was saved only by the appearance of other people.
label: fear

text_A: At the begining of a new course one is afraid of encountering á problems one can not manage.  Thoughts revolve around failing á the subject and the consequences it would have for the future.
label: sadness

text_A: While walking in town I noticed how the police harrassed a man á who was under the influence of alcohol.  They terrified him with á the thought of arrest by driving close behind him on a pedestrian á street.  My disgust was directed at the gestures and the facial á expressions of the policemen; they seemed to be enjoying á themselves.
label: disgust

text_A: When my boyfriend revealed that he knew that I had discovered á things of an important nature about him, I felt ashamed as I had á not mentioned it earlier.
label: shame

text_A: When I am dishonest to a friend to whom I am very close.  I á feel guilty because I know that he gives a different version of á the truth and I have not corrected these mistakes, and he is á aware that I know that they are wrong.
label: guilt

text_A: When I found out that I had passed the last two exams by a á margin of three marks.
label: joy

text_A: When my father was ill and was waiting for the results of his tests.
label: fear

text_A: When I got caught in the pouring rain last Thursday and did not á have a raincoat on me.
label: anger

text_A: When I failed an exam.
label: sadness

text_A: When I gave birth to my son and saw that he was alive and that I á had managed it well.  He was born a month too early with a á malfunctioning lung.  This happened a year ago.
label: joy

text_A: When I found out that my father had lung cancer and they did not á know how long he would live.
label: fear

text_A: When I was weeding the garden I found a lizard in my hand.
label: disgust

text_A: When I met a friend whom I had not seen for a long time and á heard all about her troubles, I thought that I should have got á in touch with her earlier.
label: shame

text_A: I got angry at my mother for something trivial.  We were in a á bad mood because my father was very ill and I knew that my mother á really needed support.  I had reacted wrongly.
label: guilt

text_A: New year's eve 1983/1984, I met my girlfriend.  We stood on the á steps outside her parents home and I kissed her for the á first time.
label: joy

text_A: When I was stopped by plain clothes policemen because the car I á was driving had overturned on the Avenue.  I had been driving too á fast, and I was afraid when I was stopped, questionned and then á toild to go.  The situation ended happily since there were no á consequences.
label: fear

text_A: The editor changed the heading of an article that I had written.  á He considered the heading to be derogatory towards the person I had written á about.
label: anger

text_A: A close acquaintance of the family died of lung cancer.  á Although it was expected, I still felt depressed.
label: sadness

text_A: When I saw a picture, in the Gothenburg Post, of a totally á demolished car with two fatally injured passengers.  The car was á so badly damaged that they couldn't get the bodies out at the á scene of the accident.
label: disgust

text_A: When I got the loan for my studies.
label: joy

text_A: On the T.V I saw a news feature on South Africa.  A policeman      á attacked a group of black people with a whip.
label: anger

text_A: The thought of having to read a boring book of 400 pages in á English.
label: sadness

text_A: Grovelling people.
label: disgust

text_A: I experience feelings of guilt because I do not study enough.
label: guilt

text_A: Observing someone in the cafeteria noisily gulping in his food, á having extremely bad manners.
label: disgust

text_A: I guess I have often been ashamed after having talked badly of á other people.
label: shame

text_A: When my sister had the still born child, she was emotionally very á deep down, and it took her a long time to recover.
label: fear

text_A: When my boyfriend openly let me down, preferring another girl.
label: sadness

text_A: I felt some disgust for my boyfriend for a time, after he had á left me.
label: disgust

text_A: Can't think of any.
label: shame

text_A: I wandered by mistake into the safety zone of a shooting range, á and was shot at.
label: fear

text_A: Being treated unfairly.
label: anger

text_A: Little contact with my father before he died.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was accepted as a student at the college, not having á thought it possible.
label: joy

text_A: When I was the first to arrive at the scene after an accident, á and found that a close school friend had been killed.
label: fear

text_A: When my grandmother died.
label: sadness

text_A: Not applicable.
label: disgust

text_A: I went to a lecture and once again it had been cancelled, this á was the second time.  One had a negative attitude towards the á lecturer.á
label: anger

text_A: In the tram there was a fat, sickly looking woman in front of me á who was asking for directions in a thick voice.  When she got up to á go a disgusting smell of urine came from her.  I felt that I á would choke.
label: disgust

text_A: When we were at home, my husband and I, he made a remark about á something I had done, in a perfectly friendly manner.  My deed á had been unjust and I knew that my husband was right, therefore my á sense of shame.
label: shame

text_A: I made a remark to my sister concerning her attitude to men, the á way she talked and I compared her to an acquaintance of mine.  á Later, the same evening, my sister looked sad.  I felt guilty á about her sadness.
label: guilt

text_A: I had a summer job in Sweden, and my boyfriend came to meet me on á my birthday.
label: joy

text_A: I went to practice in Sweden during summer, and I was afraid that á I would not do well.
label: fear

text_A: My grandmother died suddenly last summer.
label: sadness

text_A: My superior at the summer job swindled customers as much as he á could, and once put me in a difficult situation after which I á could not but detest him.
label: disgust

text_A: Our association had Polish visitors and when they were going back á by boat I did not go to see them off (I am the chairman of the á association).
label: guilt

text_A: I was told quite unexpectedly that one wanted me to become the á vice-chairman of our student organisation.  I was really á surprised and joy was the first emotion I felt, though behind it á there was worry - how shall I succeed ?
label: joy

text_A: Our tutorial group was soon to be divided, and we got a list of á names of freshmen, out of which five were to be in my group.  We á read the names and then each group went its own way to a seminar á room.  I wondered how I would cope with the new situation and if á I would succeed as a group leader.
label: fear

text_A: At the underground station, a drunkard came to speak to me.  He á tried to ask me something but I did not answer so he began to á speak about me with his companion.  I detested this dirty á growling man.
label: disgust

text_A: [ I sometimes quarrel with my mother because she blames me, á though I have not in any way been connected to some events.]
label: anger

text_A: My little brother was arrested by the police at the railway station after á he had drunk some beer.
label: shame

text_A: I met a dear friend of mine after a long time.  I expressed my feelings á in our own usual way, by mutual scolding and abusing (with á complete understanding) and by touching, patting and taking the á hand of the other person, etc...
label: joy

text_A: I felt fear of the purest kind after a car accident.  The á incident and images of horror kept coming back to my mind.  I á wondered what could have happened to my sister, my friend and me, á though nothing very serious actually happened.
label: fear

text_A: Two boys whom I know were telling me, in an indecent manner, how á they had teased a young and shy girl I know.  They had despised á her conviction, scorned and touched her.  I got very angry and á did not try to conceal it and gave it back to them.
label: anger

text_A: My sweetheart left me, or rather we decided to break it off by á mutual consent.  The consequences were - unrestrained weeping, á feelings of loneliness, hopelessness and disconsolation.  I felt á that I should find a friend, to talk to joyfully and to forget.
label: sadness

text_A: After having quarelled unnecessarily and without any reason, and á having been stupidly cross in every way.
label: shame

text_A: Forced to fill in a questionnaire.
label: guilt

text_A: When my dog ran out on thin ice last spring.
label: fear

text_A: When my tennis match was interrupted because a kid cycled right á into the court.
label: anger

text_A: [ No response.]
label: sadness

text_A: Risk of being involved in a fight after a party.
label: fear

text_A: [ Normally I do not feel disgusted.]
label: disgust

label: joy

text_A: When I was deputy manager during the Summer, certain deputies á took liberties, more than what was normal.
label: anger

text_A: When I realized that my girlfriend, whom I like, and I were going á to separate.
label: sadness

text_A: I reached the bus stop and realized that I had forgotten my bus á pass.
label: anger

text_A: [ Can not think of any situation.]
label: disgust

label: shame

text_A: [ Can not remember.]
label: disgust

label: guilt

text_A: I was driving and a deer suddenly appeared in front of the á car when there was a lot of traffic behind me.
label: fear

text_A: [ No response.]
label: sadness

label: joy

label: anger

label: joy

label: joy

text_A: The inability to read a book at college.
label: sadness

text_A: I drink wine too often.
label: shame

text_A: I worked at a lawyer's office during Summer and I got a very á good reference from him.
label: joy

text_A: I had been watching a triller a dark night in the country and I á had to go the outside toilet on my own.
label: fear

text_A: When I began to read a thick book, which I had a limited time to á read.  Also when I have a lot of work to do and I cannot keep up.
label: sadness

text_A: Someone vomited on the street.
label: disgust

text_A: I can not think of any incident when I have felt very ashamed.  á There are small incidents that I am ashamed of, for instance, á not sending money to the children in Ethiopia.
label: shame

text_A: I had lunch with my ex-boyfriend and did not mention it to my á fiancee.  I felt guilty despite the fact that I felt nothing for á my ex-boyfriend.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was finally qualified for my profession.
label: joy

text_A: Someone attacked me with a knife.
label: fear

text_A: Someone drove into my car and then denied that it had happened.
label: anger

text_A: When I was told that my friend's wife had cancer.
label: sadness

text_A: When I saw a dog which had been knocked down by a car.
label: disgust

text_A: When I boxed my child's ears.
label: shame

text_A: When I was fined for speeding.
label: guilt

text_A: I stopped working (had a boring job).
label: joy

text_A: Quarrel in the family.
label: anger

text_A: When I am alone in a room with no contact with anyone - á loneliness drains me.
label: sadness

text_A: Emptied a bucket of water in a hospital.
label: shame

text_A: When I feigned sick leave from work.
label: guilt

text_A: When I get a hug from someone I love.
label: joy

text_A: I was driving very fast on a small road and I met an oncoming car á in a right handed bend.  The other driver was on his own side of á the road and I had to skid out of it to avoid a collision.  It á was dark.
label: fear

text_A: After an operation I had to stay in bed for a long time.
label: sadness

text_A: I was forced to stay in the canteen and eat the food that I had á not asked for but got it anyway.
label: disgust

text_A: When I did not buy what I had promised to.
label: shame

text_A: By mistake I took a book from the library which was not supposed á to be loaned out.
label: guilt

text_A: My 2 year old daughter disappeared in a moment of inattention; I á was responsible for her.
label: fear

text_A: A colleague asked me for some advice and as he did not have á enough confidence in me he asked a third person.
label: anger

text_A: I wanted to be pregnant and did not succeed, so I was depressed    á at every menstruation.
label: sadness

text_A: In a warm bus full of people, someone vomited and the whole bus á stank.
label: disgust

text_A: I complained about a colleague's behaviour as she goes back on á her word, is often absent and is irresponsible.  I found out that á she was an alcoholic and was trying to fight againt her á addiction.
label: shame

text_A: I spoke to my mother on the phone.  She had skin cancer and was á waiting to be operated.  I forgot to ask her the date of the á operation and just before finishing our conversation she gave me á the date in passing.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was at a party I met an old friend from an adult á education course.  We had not met for 2 years but had both thought á a lot about each other.  A wonderful experience.á
label: joy

text_A: When I was cycling through the park late one night, two people á jumped out of the woods and tried to stop me.  There were á shouting something at the same time.
label: fear

text_A: When close relatives tried to dissuade me from studying á Psychology because of its low status.
label: anger

text_A: I had a long discussion on politics with an acquaintance.  He á was more knowledgeable than me and I failed to explain my point á of view and was misunderstood so I felt depressed and left.
label: sadness

text_A: When I read a newspaper article on a young girl who had been á raped and assaulted one night by several men when she was unconscious.
label: disgust

text_A: When I recently got an appartment in central Gottenburg.
label: joy

text_A: When I saw a large spider crawling up the wall.
label: fear

text_A: My employer took too many aspirins for a bad back and also drank á an enormous amount of spirit.  This was dangerous  and he did á not understand that he had done anything wrong.
label: anger

text_A: When I left New York, and all my family and my friends behind me.
label: sadness

text_A: When I slept with a guy because my best friend wanted me to.  á He had never had intercourse with anyone and had a terrible á complex about it.
label: disgust

text_A: When I dated a close girlfriend's boyfriend a few times. He told á me that it was over between them and I accepted it.  When she á found out she finished our friendship.
label: shame

text_A: I feel sad about an event I can not influence.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was in a little fishing boat and we ran into hard weather á in the open sea.
label: fear

text_A: I felt sad and depressed when I heard that our cat had died.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was working as a nurse in a mental hospital, a patient ate á up the contents of another patient's spitoon.
label: disgust

text_A: At primary school, when I vomited in front of others in the middle  á of a lesson.
label: shame

text_A: I arrived an hour late for an important meeting ( I had á misunderstood the time).
label: guilt

text_A: When I was acceptted as a student of psychology.
label: joy

text_A: At a certain person's lack of cleanliness, at home and á personally.
label: disgust

text_A: When I made the same mistake that I had accused someone else of, and á this was obvious to a third pereson.
label: shame

text_A: When I lost something that was valuable to my sister.
label: guilt

text_A: My parents attitude towards each other when they should become á reconciled, despite my father's long-time addiction.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was caught stealing money from my father.
label: shame

text_A: I stole a coconut cake from a reception table and when I put á in my mouth I realized that the host was watching me.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was reprimanded by the manager of the hotel where I á worked during Autumn 1984.
label: fear

text_A: When I was about to clean the draining board and saw it looked á underneath the sink (I live in a students hostel).
label: disgust

text_A: As the only person in my family into academics, I ought to have á looked after my younger (and only) sister better, with respect to á her education and life experiences.
label: guilt

text_A: Slept in a chapel and in the middle of the night I realized that á there was someeone else in the chapel.  I never discovered who á it was and why he was there.
label: fear

text_A: When we were in high school a few guys sometimes provoked a á friend of mine.  They called her a pig and then grunted.  This á irritated most of the girls.  Once, one of the girls got angry at á my friend and said something nasty and this made me terribly á angry.
label: anger

text_A: A mother who shouts at her child for nothing.
label: disgust

text_A: When I complained to my mother about how untidy the kitchen á loooked, she boxed my ears ( this had never happened before).
label: shame

text_A: As I could not be home before midnight I called home at 11.30 and á asked them to leave the door open so that I could get in.  I á actually woke up the whole family by calling them so late.  My á mother could not go back to sleep, besides she had a conference   á the next day and really needed to sleep.
label: guilt

text_A: When I got through the first day here at the department.
label: joy

text_A: When my boyfriend sat up half the night playing computer games á with a friend.
label: anger

text_A: When I had to leave my mother and my sister after a week's visit.
label: sadness

text_A: When I saw a big spider from very close.
label: disgust

text_A: When I asked a friend to return the money that I had loaned her á and then remembered that she had repayed me in several ways.
label: shame

text_A: When one of my parents insinuates something about the other á (they are divorced).
label: guilt

text_A: When i was asked to be a child's godmother.
label: joy

text_A: On the way down a ski slope which was difficult and steep.
label: fear

text_A: When I was left alone one week-end without being prepared for á it.
label: sadness

text_A: The first time that I saw a surgeon cut off a leg and put it in a á black rubbish bag.
label: disgust

text_A: When I demand too much from my friends.
label: guilt

text_A: When I applied for a job which I thought I had a good chance of á getting, I was not even granted an interview and did not get the á job.
label: sadness

text_A: When I as a child of 9 or 10 I was playing doctor with the á neighbours boys their mother caught us.
label: shame

text_A: When I argue with my mother about the way she treats her two á children differently.
label: sadness

text_A: Spit and vomit.
label: disgust

text_A: Spots on the seat covers of my husband's car.
label: shame

text_A: Not speaking to my sister-in-law due to lack of interest in a á relationship on my side.
label: guilt

text_A: When I recently managed to get my first consulting assignment á \myself\" i.e on my own initiative."
label: joy

text_A: I was within a hair's breadth of knocking down a drunkard who á suddenly ran into the street.  The fear came later when I     á realized what could have happened.
label: fear

text_A: A study visit to a chicken factory : the butchery, the smell, á the environment and the noise.
label: disgust

text_A: Confession to my parents about my involvement in a moped theft.
label: shame

text_A: [ No answer as I see very little difference between shame and á guilt.  Therefore see answer for \shame\".]"
label: guilt

text_A: When the result of a project work was treated nonchalantly á intead of being criticized by the teacher.
label: sadness

text_A: When programmes on violence or pornography are shown on T.V.
label: disgust

text_A: When I talked maliciously about a colleague at work to someone á else.  Immediately afterwards I felt ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: When I decided to take a week s holiday without consulting the á family first.
label: guilt

text_A: After my girl and I talked things over our relationship changed á and became positive.  A diificult time turned into pleasant one.
label: joy

text_A: When my half brother became seriously ill with cancer and died á later.
label: sadness

text_A: A film were a woman was attacked and raped.  One did not see the á worst but it had the desired effect - very strong.
label: disgust

text_A: I made a comment and it was interpreted completely differently á from what I had meant.  When I said it I realized how my mother á had understood it.
label: shame

text_A: I had promised to visit my girlfriend but for different reasons á could not make it.  I rang up later to tell her that I could not á come.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was offered a high position of trust, which I later á accepted.
label: joy

text_A: I had the window open and the door was shut so that the kitten á would not go out.  My partner came in and started talking about á something and I forgot about the window and suddenly I saw the á kitten hanging from the window frame. I was rigid with fright á till I got hold of her.
label: fear

text_A: When I was told that I had not been successful in getting the job I á had been expecting.  I was sure that I was sufficiently á qualified.
label: sadness

text_A: When my cat vomited and a worm came out which was still alive.  I á was forced to wipe it up.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was a child it was found out that I had taken off my á clothes outdoors.  It was summer and my friend and I were out á in the woods.  It had felt exciting at that time.  My parents á discovered that my trousers were back to front and I felt á ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: When I stole money from my mother and she asked me later if I was á responsible.  I never admitted it.
label: guilt

text_A: [ Cycling in the spring sunshine gives me such delight.  á Happiness is to be healthy, my wonderful finance.  Simply being á here on earth.]
label: joy

text_A: When my relationship with my family is very poor I often fear á being excluded from the group, a fear which is stronger in á situations when an argument is on hand.
label: fear

text_A: Recently when my sister, who is four years younger than me and á very spoiled, shouted at my mother for no apparent reason .  The á heart-broken expression on my mother's face made me feel very á angry.
label: anger

text_A: Disgust is a feeling that I have never experienced with peoplie á but , on the other hand, it has been with repulsive animals, i;e á snakes on T.V.
label: disgust

text_A: When relatives have acted strangely, and unfriendly towards me.
label: shame

text_A: On a boat trip to Denmark, 14 of us had a lot of fun and we á spent SEK 10 each on one armed bandits and against all odds we á won the jackpot of SEK 1000.
label: joy

text_A: A rainy day, I was cycling downhill and a car door suddenly á opened and while trying to avoid it the back wheels of my bike á got caught in the tram tracks.  I somersaulted but had no á injuries.
label: fear

text_A: My girlfriend who had spent 6 months abroad broke off our á relationship by letter.
label: sadness

text_A: At the police centre a man between 40-50 was brought in.  He was á very drunk and in all likelihood had not slept indoors for a long á time and had relieved himself in his trousers.
label: disgust

text_A: A customer at the shop where I worked came in and asked if the á goods that he had ordered had arrived.  I had totally á forgotten about this order and I tried to offer weak excuses.
label: shame

text_A: When I was at the end-of-term party last week and had fun - was á happy and sang and drank only soft drinks.  It is possible to á have a good time without alcohol.
label: joy

text_A: Last Summer I was walking along the beach in a bikini and an á awful man came cycling after me.  He was shouting and I ran as á fast as my legs could carry me.
label: fear

text_A: In a course I thought that I deserved good marks but I only got á ordinary marks with no justification as to why I was given these á marks.
label: anger

text_A: I had some sort of a stomach virus last week and  I vomited in á college in the morning, then in the cake shop, three times during á the trip home and again when I got home.
label: disgust

text_A: When I felt that my love was returned.
label: joy

text_A: When I was convinced that someonne had broken into my flat and I á woke up and heard sounds that frightened me.
label: fear

text_A: When as an 8 year old, I wet myself in school.
label: shame

text_A: When as a 7 year old, I stole money from my mother.
label: guilt

text_A: When I recently got a very positive answer from a clinic telling á me that they would willingly assist and collect data for me for a á clinical pilot study.
label: joy

text_A: Every time I meet a certain dog that has once bitten me.
label: fear

text_A: When after a lot of provocation my child threw a plate on the á floor.
label: anger

text_A: When I tried to explain to my child as to why there were á magazines wiith naked girls on them at the kiosk.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was forced to decline the invitation to my mother's 70th á birthday because of my work committments in another area.
label: guilt

text_A: A late Saturday night I found myself locked in the central á underground station of Stockholm with a group of 50 hard rockers á who were drunk and equipped with various kinds of chains, etc.
label: fear

text_A: When I was forced to call the telephone company about a bill á concerning a disconnected phone belonging to my landlord.  The á bill was four months overdue and in the meanwhile he had been á using my phone, he seemed to have no intention of having his own á phone reconnected.
label: anger

text_A: Whenever I read or think about the way people treat animals and á nature.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was 13 years old I wrote passionate love letters to my á boyfriend and I later found out that his sister had read them.
label: shame

text_A: When my 6 month old son is happy and well.
label: joy

text_A: A four year girl ran away from her father straight in front of my á car.  I was forced to use the emergency brakes.
label: fear

text_A: [ After an examine I had been satisfied with.]
label: anger

text_A: About Sweden's arms exports.
label: shame

text_A: When my husband and I spent a night by ourselves in a house which á was in an area on the outskirts of a large town with which we were  á not familiar.  We  heard strange noises outside the house and the  á house had glass walls so the whole thing was even more á frightening.
label: fear

text_A: Jealous of my husband's old girlfriend.  We met her with her á husband and there was a lot of reminiscing.
label: anger

text_A: When my daughter had problems with her friends and I could see á her predicament from the window.  She was given a the cold á shoulder.
label: sadness

text_A: When friends found out that I had been lying about where I had á been on a particular occasion.
label: shame

text_A: Exchange of points of view with my sister on a family matter.
label: anger

text_A: Treatment to become pregnant with a negative result.
label: sadness

text_A: When I gave birth to a child and saw that it was normal when it á was put against my breast.
label: joy

text_A: When I first heard that Tage Dannielsson had died.
label: sadness

text_A: On the train a drunk person touched my baby and I reacted very á disapprovingly.  I felt ashamed later as the person had not been á aggressive though he could have been.
label: shame

text_A: I get irritated with my son when he screams or is sick all over á his clean clothes.
label: guilt

text_A: A gang of screaming and drunk youths \captured\" a tram."
label: fear

text_A: An unjust refree decision at a sports event when I was the team á leader.
label: anger

text_A: When my girlfriend left me.
label: sadness

text_A: I was dominated by a certain person and even though I knew it I á could not change my own reactions.
label: disgust

text_A: Yesterday, when the final whistle blew at the final match between á OIS and IFK and it was certain that OIS had won the Swedish á title.
label: joy

text_A: A drummer who had borrowed my drums destroyed both the drumskin á and the sticks.  He did not repair them nor did he tell me about á it.
label: anger

text_A: A friend unjustly put the blame on me to relieve his conscience á and also spread lies for the same purpose.
label: disgust

text_A: My behaviour at a recent party.  I passed out early, luckily.
label: shame

text_A: When I was face to face with my deceived friend after sleeping á with his wife.
label: guilt

text_A: When I dived among sharks and the brightly coloured fish on the á outer reef of Tvavni, Fidgi.
label: joy

text_A: When I could not do anything because of a bad back.
label: sadness

text_A: When I discovered that the house we had hired in Tonga was full á of cockroaches.
label: disgust

text_A: When I passed the driving test three weeks ago and got my á licence.
label: joy

label: anger

label: sadness

label: shame

text_A: During the Christmas holidays, I met some of my old friends, á after not having seen them for six months.
label: joy

text_A: We were driving a car of a friend of mine when we turned in the á wrong direction towards an unknown district, and nearly drove á down a precipice.
label: fear

text_A: When our religion teacher presented shocking sectarian thoughts á and doom's day as official teaching.
label: anger

text_A: My grandfather died, when I was an exchange student in the USA.
label: sadness

text_A: In the underground's escalator, a youngish bum asked me for á money.  Although I did not give him anything, the fellow told me á that I was really good-looking.  A man who was in front of me á also turned to look at me.
label: joy

text_A: I was afraid of moving away from home and moving to Helsinki for á my studies.
label: fear

text_A: I ate a Runeberg's cake, though I knew that I would immediately á put on a kilo.
label: guilt

text_A: Once I had to go home on foot at 5 a.m. I had to pass through a á forest and I was going alone.
label: fear

text_A: When I went home by train from Sicilia, I was molested by a man.
label: disgust

text_A: I lied to someone and some time later this person found out that á I had not told him the truth.
label: shame

text_A: I had to decline an appointment which had been very important for á the other person. For this reason we even got into trouble.
label: guilt

text_A: A friend's father had died, I was to come and see this friend á although I did not know his family.
label: fear

text_A: A friend's boy-friend treated her very badly, let her serve him, á provoked her and just utilized her.
label: disgust

text_A: I had lied to a person because I had thought that I could not á tell him the truth. When he found out he was not angry but á understanding. We talked the whole thing over.
label: shame

text_A: After having considered it for hours I was able to overcome my á scruples and to call a friend with whom I had fallen in love. I á realized that my decision was right - and was very glad.
label: joy

text_A: I moved to a flat. A friend who had lived there before, had left á the flat in a terrible mess. I was very angry about that á sloppiness and impudence.
label: anger

text_A: My father had a complicated operation. A long time before and á also a long time after that, we did not know how he would get á over it. During all that time I felt very sad.
label: sadness

text_A: It was in a tramway-carriage: A stranger insulted a girl just á because she blew her nose. I detested his behaviour.
label: disgust

text_A: Quite recently I realized that I had had some erroneous views á about life. For instance, I had always lived for other people, á had forgotten my own person and suppressed my own feelings. I was á ashamed because I had not been concious of that until I had a á conversation about it with a person.
label: shame

text_A: I had a quarrel with near persons. I said many ill-considered á things and I regretted it when it was to late.
label: guilt

text_A: I was riding with a friend in his car. At a speed of 120 km/h on á the snow-covered motorway I would have liked to get out.
label: fear

text_A: Meeting a male friend with whose wife I was having an affair.
label: guilt

text_A: Climbing a mountain to see a view, towards the top we suddenly á came across a ledge with a nearly sheer drop on either side, á which I had to cross.
label: fear

text_A: A friend suggested in a round-about way that the reason we were á late for something was because of me, and that I'm often late. I á know this was partly true, but felt it unjustified that á particular time and I felt I couldn't do  anything about it á anyway (i.e. being late).
label: anger

text_A: Talking to a very good friend who had just had a very bad á experience which was changing his whole way of looking at life á etc.
label: sadness

text_A: I came across a group of people with the same basic ideas/beliefs á who were all fighting and going against what they would say was á good.
label: disgust

text_A: I was working in a job in which I could not work quickly enough, á and was told that my work was not up to standard.
label: shame

text_A: I had wasted some time instead of doing something I needed to do á to give to a friend. (Also in the time I wasted I had done some á things I did not consider morally right).
label: guilt

text_A: When my brother was very late in arriving home from work.
label: fear

text_A: During a movie in which I saw the effect of white settlers in á Africa.
label: disgust

text_A: When I got a bad result for one of my assignments.
label: shame

text_A: Leaving a friend of mine alone at a dance - I felt I should have á kept her company.
label: guilt

text_A: At my father's treatment of my mother, at his disregard for her, á and not being committed to her.
label: anger

text_A: For the above: guilt at not living up to my own moral á expectation, guilt for not being the type of person my patents á wanted, guilt for just about bloody everything, just realising á that I have failed drastically in my own eyes.
label: guilt

text_A: I was rock-climbing and absailing & felt OK, but suddenly as I á was going over the cliff I was hit by fear - I couldn't go on á absailing down the cliff and had to be actually hauled back up á it.
label: fear

text_A: I told my boy friend not to park in a certain place because the á car would ger towed away - he didn't listen and it was towed away. á At that stage, our finances were below the poverty line & it á cost us $10.00 - all the money we had to get us through that week á (including rent).
label: anger

text_A: My sister won a scholarship to Norway and it was particularly as á she walked across the tarmac to get on the plane and she looked á back at us.
label: sadness

text_A: I work part-time as a shop-assistant and a customer spoke to me á very loudly about an Indian man & white woman with children - how á horrible that was and would I want to have little dark children.
label: disgust

text_A: I received a wedding invitation from an ex-flatmate, enclosed was á a small note that overcame a lot of the differences that had á arisen between us due to the circumstances in which she left the á flat.
label: joy

text_A: Getting a terrible exam mark, which I couldn't understand the á reason for, and trying to see a lecturer or tutor, but being á given the runaround.
label: anger

text_A: Watching an old lady running up the street to catch her bus and á miss it, it reminded me of my own mother and how dreadful it á would be to be her in the same situation.
label: sadness

text_A: When I am travelling by car and have to meet an oncoming car á while overtaking.
label: fear

text_A: When a close relative is treated badly.
label: anger

text_A: When I saw all the starving people in Ethiopia on T.V.  It felt á awful to see such suffering.
label: disgust

label: fear

label: anger

text_A: When the guy I was in love with told me that he had met someone á else and that we would not meet again for a year.  Although we á did not have a steady relatioship, we were having an affair.

Eventually they decided on one date and I á stayed at home despite the fact that I had other things to do.  á They did not come, nor did they call and they still have not got á in touch with me.

text_A: A letter from my boyfriend began in such a way that I thought he á was going to end our relationship. I was afraid of reading the á rest.
label: fear

text_A: A woman I know is slowly dying from cancer. Observing this á process makes me sad.
label: sadness

text_A: My father died after two very painful weeks in bed. I felt á relieved, and was ashamed of that.
label: shame

text_A: We had a day off from school. Instead of helping my mother with á her job, I stayed in bed all day.
label: guilt

text_A: Fearing the use of power or reprimands when I belong to the á minority.
label: fear

text_A: A close friend first said he accepted an agreement, but later á used that agreement as a reason for attacking me.
label: anger

text_A: When realizing that my girlfriend and myself in fact had started á the process of breaking up.
label: sadness

text_A: Political and military trnsgressions around the world, generally á speaking. This cannot be described through this questionaire.
label: disgust

text_A: Was accused of having hidden intentions in a situation when I á believed I was acting honestly and fairly.
label: shame

text_A: When my aunt took her own life, I felt guity for not á understanding that she needed support.
label: guilt

text_A: Doesn't apply.
label: fear

text_A: Having to go back home form the U.S. after having been there for á ten weeks to visit my brother and his family.
label: sadness

text_A: Falling off a cliff in the mountains.
label: fear

text_A: When the gear broke on my car.
label: sadness

text_A: Can't remember having had this feeling.
label: disgust

text_A: Can't remember that feeling.
label: shame

text_A: I forgot to lock the outside door at my Land Lady's place.
label: guilt

text_A: Going home alone through the forest after a girl guide (scout ?) á meeting.
label: fear

text_A: Having been unjustly punished, I feel disgust towards the person á responsible.
label: disgust

text_A: Doing something wrong at home, and then letting my (normally) á more rampant brother take the blame.
label: guilt

text_A: Having passed the exam required to be an authorized Radio/TV á dealer.
label: joy

text_A: Climbing a mountain where the rocks were very loose. When we á realized the danger, we were very high up, but still had a long á climb ahead.
label: fear

text_A: Being a spokesman for the union, I got into a quarrel with a á colleague who had been acting disloyally over a sustained period á of time.
label: anger

text_A: When my grandfather died, with whom I had a very close á relationship.
label: sadness

text_A: Reading about executions and massacres which happened during á World War II, I felt disgust towards those who did it.
label: disgust

text_A: I woke up at the house of someone I knew, not remembering very á much about what had been said or done during the party on the á previous night.
label: shame

text_A: Borrowing a car, and then having a minor accident (breaking a á headlight).
label: guilt

text_A: When I realized that we are living on borrowed time, and that the á nuclear holocaust appears to come closer every day.
label: fear

text_A: Death in the close family.
label: sadness

text_A: When people manipulate others through appearing better than what á they really are.
label: disgust

text_A: Feeling helpless, not being able to accomplish what I really á wanted to do.
label: guilt

text_A: I came home and discovered that someone had broken in. Then I á realized that they probably were still there.
label: fear

text_A: I was accused of having drunk a bottle of liquor and then á refilling with water.
label: anger

text_A: Quarreling with my father, when he made false assertions.
label: disgust

text_A: Winning the local soccer championships this year was a great joy.
label: joy

text_A: When colliding with my car. I myself was to blame.
label: anger

text_A: Not succeeding in a cross-country skiing competition, which I á intended to win.
label: sadness

text_A: Can't remember any episode of disgust.
label: disgust

text_A: Getting the top price in the football pools.
label: joy

text_A: Was threatened with a knife ... in the military by soldiers form á another unit. The reason was girls.
label: fear

text_A: When my mother treats me as a 10-year old boy.
label: anger

text_A: Outside a night club, a grown man was sitting on top of a younger á woman, beating her up.
label: disgust

text_A: My father was a member of the public Alcohol and Drugs Board, á when I was picked up by the police for being drunk in a public á place.
label: shame

text_A: When being illoyal (disloyal) to people close to me. Had such an á episode with my sister, who should have received my support and á attention.
label: guilt

text_A: Having agreed to share the taxi expenses, three people in the á back of the car just ran off, leaving the person up front with á the entire bill.
label: anger

text_A: Death of a close friend.
label: sadness

text_A: Can't remember any such feelings now.
label: disgust

text_A: Almost crashing my car, something which could have led to great á problems.
label: fear

text_A: Talking to a pensioned and bitter \street order\" policeman."
label: sadness

text_A: The sadistinc exacution of a student in the USA.
label: disgust

text_A: Forgetting an important appointment.
label: shame

text_A: Not keeping a promise of delivering materials of great importance á to the receiver.
label: guilt

text_A: Receiving personal criticisms early in the morning.
label: anger

text_A: Not getting a job.
label: sadness

text_A: Seeing a pornographic film when looking for a place to live.
label: disgust

text_A: When unjustified hurting other people.
label: shame

text_A: The negative feelings towards me displayed by my á \parents-in-law\"."
label: guilt

text_A: Reunion with my wife after a legal separation.
label: joy

text_A: The house was on fire, and I was saved by the dog. I am afraid of á the fire, verging on panic.
label: fear

text_A: My father dying.
label: sadness

text_A: Maltreatment of children.
label: disgust

text_A: I lost my driver's licence because of speeding.
label: shame

text_A: I feel disgust towards those who are responsible for the death of á others.
label: disgust

text_A: Talking about a person's unattractiveness, not realizing that the á person was listening.
label: shame

text_A: I often feel guilty, and it has to do with other people, e.g. if á I haven't visited my older relatives for a while.
label: guilt

text_A: When the contract about my shop was signed.
label: joy

text_A: Being very close to having an auto accident, almost driving off á the road.
label: fear

text_A: My sweatheart were away on a trip, and then she got problems.
label: sadness

text_A: Forgot to do some shopping that I had promised to do.
label: shame

text_A: I crashed my father's car.
label: guilt

text_A: Receiving a letter form a girl that means a lot to me á emotionally.
label: joy

text_A: Being slandered by friends.
label: anger

text_A: Love problems.
label: sadness

text_A: Does not apply.
label: disgust

text_A: Having finally to admit I was wrong, after having denied it for a á long time.
label: shame

text_A: Being aggressive against members of my family.
label: guilt

text_A: I won the country ski championship.
label: joy

text_A: I was scared in the dark when I was a little boy.
label: fear

text_A: Angry when our team (small boys) lost the county championship á football final.
label: anger

text_A: My grandfather's death.
label: sadness

text_A: A teacher gave me lower grades than I was entitled to, and was á hoping for.
label: disgust

text_A: Not helping parents enough at home and at the farm - this has á happened many times.
label: guilt

text_A: When the bank let me borrow some money this winter, after my á grant was spent.
label: joy

text_A: When a girlfriend left me.
label: sadness

text_A: Fighting with my father while drunk.
label: shame

text_A: I am a school teacher. At a teacher-parent meeting I received a á good deal of positive feed-back on my work both from the parents á and through them from the pupils.
label: joy

text_A: As a child, when I was at home alone, I felt in an indefinate á manner afraid of the death of my father and mother.
label: fear

text_A: I had a discussion with my mother concerning my sister's divorce, á we disagreed strongly.
label: anger

text_A: As a ten-year-old I was at the funeral of my grand-father.  It was more á the ceremonies held in the church and not really the death of my á grand-father which made me sad.
label: sadness

text_A: I had a discussion with my wife about an over-weight acquaintance of á our's, about her eating habits and the scars caused by her á pregnancy.
label: disgust

text_A: When I confessed to my girl-friend (now my wife) that I had á betrayed her with another woman.
label: shame

text_A: The same as in \shame\"."
label: guilt

text_A: [ A successful lesson.]
label: joy

text_A: [ I was thinking about death.]
label: fear

text_A: When I am at home alone.
label: sadness

text_A: A saturday night a bus full of drunken people.
label: disgust

text_A: A conflict with a pupil and there were probatory teachers á present.
label: shame

text_A: Selling the appartment after my divorce.
label: guilt

text_A: When in an economic crisis I got an unexpected sum of money.
label: joy

text_A: [ When I was treated unfairly, regardless of my motives or deeds.]
label: anger

text_A: When I noticed obvious marks of old age (in a negative sense) on á a close relative of mine.
label: sadness

text_A: As a child, when I saw an \unesthetic\" sight."
label: disgust

text_A: On a social occasion, I noticed that I reacted on the basis of my á autonomous nerve system (I could not help it).
label: shame

text_A: I was coming home from an exam and I supposed that I had á passed it so I ran to a restaurant for a beer.
label: joy

text_A: I had been drinking with a pal and I later (1 o' clock) had a date  á with my fiancee.  We were going to a Spanish lesson and I was á afraid that she would smell that I had been drinking.
label: fear

text_A: I had drunk a couple of beers and my fiancee got angry at me.
label: sadness

text_A: We got into a fight with some chaps in front of our family house. á The value of the property destroyed was approximately 15 000 FIM. á I felt ashamed when my parents came to know about this.
label: shame

text_A: While dancing in a restaurant last week.
label: joy

text_A: I was on the Inter Rail in Naples alone. After an evening in a á restaurant I was going back to the hotel when a prostitute á approached me to sell herself. I refused but as I carried on á walking I felt that I was being followed by someone.
label: fear

text_A: I was on my way back from the Inter Rail, on board the ferry from á Stockholm when my father called me at 7 o'clock to tell me that my á uncle had died and that I would be seeing him off on his final á journey within four days.
label: sadness

text_A: My girlfriend gave me some feed-back and I understood that it á meant that our relationship was about to turn even closer.
label: joy

text_A: While in the army, I was treated unfairly by my superiors.  I was á held responsible for a deed of which I was innocent.
label: anger

text_A: In the army, an acquaintance of mine tended to use his position á to advance his own interests.
label: disgust

text_A: When I lied to my girlfriend, telling her that I had passed an á exam, when I actually did not even take it.
label: shame

text_A: When I spoke ill of a fellow worker in the absence of this á person.
label: guilt

text_A: When I look at people around and know that people who are stupid á look stupid.
label: joy

text_A: When stupid people push me during rush time in the city.
label: anger

text_A: When I saw hundreds of snakes twisting over one another in a á movie.
label: disgust

text_A: I saw a skid-row (chronical) alcoholic and I was ashamed of the á people with a high standard of living.
label: shame

text_A: [ Being close to another person.]
label: joy

text_A: Loneliness, being uncertain of myself in the Autumn.
label: sadness

text_A: A rich man expressing disgust towards an alcoholic.
label: disgust

text_A: [ The same as in shame.]
label: guilt

text_A: I went to a doctor with a complaint. The doctor told me that I á was completely healthy.
label: joy

text_A: I had an implicit agreement with my sister about meeting her, á however she had not understood the situation the same way so she á did not turn up.
label: anger

text_A: I realized that the girl I loved had to leave me.
label: sadness

text_A: In the bus I was sitting next to a colleage who was drunk and á behaved in keeping with his state.
label: disgust

text_A: I had promised to help out with domestic chores and I forgot á about it.
label: shame

text_A: I returned home late from a party last night and I felt afraid á trying to anticipate the reaction of my father.
label: fear

text_A: When I learned that my brother had spoilt an LP of mine.
label: anger

text_A: When I came to know that a girl I was fond of already had a á boyfriend.
label: sadness

text_A: I made a major mistake while learning how to use a computer programme á and the teacher criticized me.
label: shame

text_A: I shot the decisive goal in an ice-hockey match.
label: joy

text_A: When I got lost in New York city a late friday night with a á friend of mine.
label: fear

text_A: After having quarelled with a relative of mine about politics.
label: anger

text_A: The death of my grandmother.
label: sadness

text_A: I slandered a person behind his back and he got to know about it.
label: shame

text_A: I had quarelled with a friend of mine and I later realized that á it was also my fault.
label: guilt

text_A: I passed an exam which I was not sure at all to pass.  I rejoyced á at the result because the possibility of continuing my studies á depended on it.
label: joy

text_A: In the traffic with a car, I nearly got crushed between a bus and á a tram.  The attention of other drivers saved me at the last moment.
label: fear

text_A: My father had a heart attack when I was not at home (I was still á living with them).  He recovered relatively well although he had á to retire (which implied relief from the stress of a small scale á enterprise).
label: sadness

text_A: At my grandmother's detestable and selfish conduct towards my á elder sister, although her behavior was due to senility and lack of á understanding.
label: disgust

text_A: I had asked the Salvation Army to take away a piece of furniture á of mine, but I forgot to cancel the agreement (a friend of mine á took it) and I thereby caused the Salvation Army people some á unnecessary work.
label: guilt

text_A: On the cliff by the sea, the silence and the sudden voice of a á bird.(swans of the bay)
label: joy

text_A: A dark night when I had to go to the outdoor lavatory.
label: fear

text_A: The long lasting illness of my grand-mother, and the changes in á family relationships caused by it.
label: sadness

text_A: When I got home from my job, I found a letter from the university á telling me that I had been admitted to begin my studies.
label: joy

text_A: While watching TV (a war movie), I felt a strong fear of death, á threat and fear of loosing people close to me.
label: fear

text_A: I was angry with a friend of mine who behaved in an affected á manner.
label: anger

text_A: My parents inherited an appartment and this made them behave in a á peculiar manner.
label: disgust

text_A: I unexpectedly met a girl with whom I have always got along well. á ( I had not seen her for several months.)
label: joy

text_A: When my father was very drunk and raging at home.
label: fear

text_A: When I did not find the rack used for beating up rugs, in the á yard.
label: anger

text_A: I felt disgusted at the environment while getting back to my á student lodging. I did not see anything in the suburb which had á been planned by taking people's comfort into account.
label: disgust

text_A: I got 100 FIM too much when I changed money at the bank.  They á soon called me at my job and the situation was embarrasing for á me.
label: guilt

text_A: I had an appointment downtown, and the person in question was á half an hour late.
label: anger

text_A: The death of my grandmother.
label: sadness

text_A: In the army, I had been in hospital for two weeks and as soon as á I returned to the company, a sergeant ordered me to fetch a load á on the tractor trailer.
label: disgust

text_A: While at primary school, I did not let a friend ring a bell á although he would have liked to do it.  Afterwards I felt bad.
label: guilt

text_A: I got a fairly large amount of my taxes back.
label: joy

text_A: I was coming home in a taxi with a fellow worker of mine.  He was á criticizing my earlier conduct towards him, which to my mind was á unfounded.  When I reached home, I ran out of the taxi and á slammed the door.
label: anger

text_A: I was travelling in a local train when a drunkard, smelling á terribly, entered the same carriage and started eating fish that á was stinking.
label: disgust

text_A: A person close to me mistook my good intentions for bad, and á therefore associated unpleasant traits to me.
label: anger

text_A: [ A person close to me told me that his positive regard depended á on my conduct.]
label: sadness

text_A: When an untidy and heavyly drunk person made endeavours to á approach me.
label: disgust

text_A: As a little girl, I was sick in the middle of a school day and I á vomitted in the basin of the classroom.
label: shame

text_A: I lost my self-control and raised my voice at a child.
label: guilt

text_A: My superior blamed me for some neglects at work in front of á others.  In fact, the task in question was not supposed to be á done by me.
label: anger

text_A: When a friend of mine got drunk and started to blame and scorn my á other friends and me.
label: disgust

text_A: My joy was the joy of meeting again.  My husband came home after á having been away for weeks (for work).  I was on the railway á station to meet him.
label: joy

text_A: The male friend of my mother (a widow) moved in to live with us.  á I did not like the man.
label: disgust

text_A: My mother, sister and I were thinking about old times, our á childhood, and we had a very happy time.
label: joy

text_A: A young, close relative of mine died, leaving behind a baby a few á months old.
label: sadness

text_A: A series about Freud was shown on TV.  In it, a tampon had been á set in the nose of a woman, and forgotten there.  After great á pain it was taken off (close-up picture), the woman was bleeding á from the nose and the mouth.
label: disgust

text_A: I had promised to lend something to my mother-in-law and I forgot á it a couple of times.  When she asked me about it the third time, á I was ashamed at my absent-mindedness.
label: shame

text_A: I started a new branch of studies after having failed a former á one.  When I got back my exam papers I was very happy to know á that I almost had full marks.
label: joy

text_A: I was diving below the ice, in a cave, at a depth of 26 metres.  á Visibility was almost zero and the oxygen level decreased á threateningly.  There were three of us divers on one safety rope.
label: fear

text_A: My mother carried on using mental pressure concerning something á which was serious and a real burden to me.
label: anger

text_A: A friend of mine was drunk and having an argument on the street á with a woman, appparently his girlfriend.  I was walking on the á other side of the street and thought that I was not supposed to á interfere.  Later I heard that he had shot himself that evening.
label: guilt

text_A: My girlfriend sent me a letter with a shiny picture in it.
label: joy

text_A: My girlfriend gave me the mitten (left me).
label: sadness

text_A: Watching a violent movie.
label: disgust

text_A: The morning after a wild party.
label: shame

text_A: My grandmother was about to die, and it had the effect that at á night, after having read a book, and once in bed, in perfect á darkness, the fear arose that I too may suddenly die.
label: fear

text_A: When we decided, my boyfriend and I, that we would separate, I á realized that he would have wanted to continue our relationship á and the coming separation hurt him.
label: sadness

text_A: When an acquaintance of mine told me about the way his parents á treated their sons in an unequal manner.  The most successful of á them got continuous encouragement, and the youngest was not á encouraged and was rejected.
label: disgust

text_A: I was talking to a friend of mine about our parents and á education.  I said something and then realized that I did not á know my friend's parents, their motives and education.  I felt á ashamed at having talked about something I did not know anything á about.
label: shame

text_A: My mother told me that the enveloppes that I had been tearing (I á had torn the stamps away) in good faith had been the first-day á enveloppes which my father had collected as a young man.
label: guilt

text_A: I am not especially good at English, and after the high school á graduation exam in English I tensely waited for the result the á whole day.  In the evening, when I heard that I had done á excellently, I became very happy and the anxiety vanished.  My á family was at home.
label: joy

text_A: I feared that I was pregnant.  It was not planned and I would á have been compelled to have an abortion, which I would not have á liked at all.  Fortunately, after a week's anxiety, I got to know á that I was not pregnant.
label: fear

text_A: A member of a religious sect tried to convert me, using really á evil tricks to persuade me.  After he had left, I was anxious and á angry for a long time. After the event, I was alone.
label: anger

text_A: I thought I would be able to use the mangle of the house, and so á I did not want any help.  However, I blocked it and I had to get á the janitor to help me out.  He reproached me for not having á followed the instructions
label: shame

text_A: I promised my friends that I would take care of something, but I á kept forgetting about it.  When they asked me about it, I á promised to do it immediately.  However, I got started only after á a couple of months.  I felt that I had betrayed my friends.
label: guilt

text_A: My father had once again told me that I should be careful and try to á seek admission to other places also apart from the faculty of á Social Sciences at the university of Helsinki.  I was not at all á interested in any other place and had no time to study for other á entrance exams.
label: anger

text_A: I would have liked to go out to chat with some acquaintances, but á I realized that I was not wanted.  I felt hurt, disappointed, á lonely and deserted.
label: sadness

text_A: When an acquaintance (he was drunk) of my room-mate vomitted on the kitchen á carpet.  It was past mid-night and my room-mate had just moved in, á this acquaintance had helped her move in.á
label: disgust

text_A: I was carried away while talking about my visits abroad and I á tended to boast a little, till I realized that the listener was á amused.
label: shame

text_A: When I got 21/30 points in an exam of statistics. The result was á unexpected and it made me realize that statistics do not á surpass my abilities, as I have sometimes thought.
label: joy

text_A: When a big angry dog put its snout on my arm and had I made one á movement it would have bitten me.
label: fear

text_A: When my friend told me that he would come and meet me in a á moment.
label: joy

text_A: My father had been drinking and I feared him when we went to bed á at night.
label: fear

text_A: My friends promised me that they would definitely call me to tell á me if they were visiting me or not.
label: anger

text_A: A close friend of mine had not contacted me for a long time.
label: sadness

text_A: A friend of mine came to see me when he was quite drunk.
label: disgust

text_A: When I felt that an exam, which I had feared, was an easy one and á went well.
label: joy

text_A: I was afraid when my dog ran out through a crack in the fence á when  a train was coming.
label: fear

text_A: When a friend of mine was drawn into a fight because of the á stupid gang he belonged to. I felt angry with him and his á friends. They could not think about anything sensible, but would á fool around without taking into consideration the feelings of á other persons.á
label: anger

text_A: When I was on holiday with my former boyfriend, he hit me and á behaved in a very evil and ugly manner in front of the hotel á personnel.
label: shame

text_A: When as a child I stole, from a friend of mine, the ring she had á got in an easter egg.
label: guilt

text_A: When I got home from a pleasant trip abroad, I got to know that I á had been accepted at university.
label: joy

text_A: At school, I had acted against the will of the group, and the á next day they promised to take revenge on me.
label: fear

text_A: I got to know about the death of a close friend.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was watching a movie with many violent episodes.  They á accurately showed the cutting of corpses, etc...
label: disgust

text_A: When I was caught telling a white lie.  At that time, I was not á allowed to stay outdoors after 8 p.m.  One day when I was late, I á made up a story that our neighbour had invited me to his place, á though I had actually forgotten about the time while playing with á my pals.
label: shame

text_A: When I was pressing figures on the curtain cloth. I had bought á the cloth after months of hindrances.
label: joy

text_A: Estrangement from my best woman friend.  We have been going á different ways for quite some time now, but the break was total á when she got married as her husband is unreasonably jealous of me.
label: sadness

text_A: Again, a quarrel had come up in our difficult relationship.  My á life-partner threw all the books off the shelf.  I am sure that it á disturbed our neighbours since this happened late in the night.
label: shame

text_A: A lonely, neurotic, shy girl lives nearby. She has expressed a á wish to meet me, I have however avoided her (turned down an á invitation) as the crisis my partner is going through uses up all á my empathy.
label: guilt

text_A: Begining the week-end with my girlfriend : cozyness, beer and á wine.
label: joy

text_A: The fear about my future : work, making ends meet and health. á Coping.
label: fear

text_A: A friend of mine ridiculed me, telling me that I would never á accomplish anything. I felt that he had interfered with my life.
label: anger

text_A: I felt sad at having to leave my girlfriend after constant problems á and failed attempts at reconciliation.  My sadness was caused by á the irreversibility of the decision.
label: sadness

text_A: A man spat on the wall of a house.
label: disgust

text_A: In an express bus I sat on a seat meant for senior citizens and á invalids.
label: shame

text_A: While reading Olli Jalonen's new book, the distant, cold and á selfish relationships between people (in the book) made me feel á disgusted.
label: disgust

text_A: When I approached a person of the opposite sex and was rejected.
label: shame

text_A: When I noticed that my little sister was sulking, because I could á not meet her because of a misunderstanding.
label: guilt

text_A: My grandfather had lung-cancer and was being nursed at á home.  I felt fear when I was alone with him and he almost choked á on mucus secretions.
label: fear

text_A: A very drunk person.
label: disgust

text_A: While trying to get my little brother over a ditch, he fell on á his head and started crying.  I was scared of having caused him á permanent injury.
label: guilt

text_A: [ A chat on the telephone with a friend.]
label: joy

text_A: [ For example, unfair pushing in a bus.]
label: anger

text_A: [ When some people act very important in any situation.]
label: disgust

text_A: [ Generally, when I am late in attending to matters (for example á paying bills).]
label: shame

text_A: I was travelling back home by boat with two friends of mine after á a lovely holiday trip.  The night and the sea were dark, and the á wind was blowing.  I feared that death was there on the boat, I á somehow felt sure about it.  I feared being left alone.
label: fear

text_A: I was at home, filling my tax report.  Nobody had time to help á me.  I would have liked to do it quickly so that I could go and á meet a friend of mine who had just returned from hospital.  I got á angry as both my brother and my father refused to give me their calculator á as I had not asked for it nicely.  I could not leave as I á had to wait for help and the tax report had to be done.
label: anger

text_A: When I moved away from home.
label: guilt

text_A: The inflammation of the ear of my child got cured and the doctor á said that the ear was completely all right.
label: joy

text_A: The housing council asked the city to cut 40 linden trees so that á the inhabitants of the lower floors would have a view to the sea.
label: anger

text_A: My child, unexpectedly started acting in a restless and á disturbing way at school.  In addition his performance at school á weakened.
label: sadness

text_A: On a trip abroad, a lady-like member of our group turned out to á be an alcoholic.  She spoilt many days of my holidays because of á her behaviour and paranoia.
label: disgust

text_A: I failed an exam which I thought I would certainly pass.
label: shame

text_A: When a student of mine (at music) performed and played remarkably well.
label: joy

text_A: My boy-friend came home late one night without having told me á about it before.
label: anger

text_A: The breaking up of a long lasting relationship.
label: sadness

text_A: When I think that I have been too stict or narrow minded towards á my students.
label: guilt

text_A: While cycling in the country, I came across a large herd of á cows.
label: fear

text_A: When I heard about the advances an acquaintance of mine had made á to my friends, who did not approve of them.
label: disgust

text_A: When after having had sexual intercourse with a friend, I thought á that he had told about it to a friend of his.
label: shame

text_A: At night, I walk home past a forest.  Once, somebody got stabbed á in the forest.  I imagine someone attacking me and I hurry up.
label: fear

text_A: I told evil lies about a close friend of mine.  I was evil in á order to sound jolly, to charm a person whom I wanted to impress. á  I sold my friend, I was despicable.
label: shame

text_A: [ During inter-rail-trip, after troubles, I met my little á sister.]
label: joy

text_A: Traveling as the only female in a railway carriage in the middle á of the night in Italy.
label: fear

text_A: When our dog died.
label: sadness

text_A: I was dishonest to my boyfriend concerning something that is á important to our relationship.
label: shame

text_A: A parking fine.
label: guilt

text_A: After having at last finished my master's thesis, I felt great á joy and relief.  I had been haunted by the thesis during the á whole of my studies.
label: joy

text_A: While preparing my master's thesis, I was scared that I would not á accomplish anything as the subject was rather difficult.
label: fear

text_A: After the first of May, I detested my fiance's friends, who had á piled on to our party and spoilt it completely.
label: disgust

text_A: After our sad first of May party, I felt ashamed because the á friends who had been invited had to suffer.  We, the organizers á of the party, did not drive the intruders away.
label: shame

text_A: I was camping with a friend of mine and we spent the night in the á forest.  I could not fall off to sleep and could clearly hear á noises from outside (steps ?) approaching our tent.
label: fear

text_A: Being away from a very close friend, I was away from Finland á for a year as an exchange student.
label: sadness

text_A: While playing I urinated on grandma's floor and did not go to the á lavatory.  My cousin told grandma and she came.
label: shame

text_A: While having a discussion with a colleague of mine, I realized that her á conception of man and work were similar to mine.
label: joy

text_A: I could not meet my love, after having waited for a month, due to á illness.
label: sadness

text_A: My love and me rented a room in a hotel one evening.  We stayed á there a few hours and when leaving the hotel, I felt ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: [ I had, by being silent, disapproved my love and made him á unhappy.  He had not been able to keep his promise.  I thus was á thinking about my own conduct towards another person.]
label: guilt

text_A: They had returned much less of my taxes than I had expected.
label: anger

text_A: In the morning, the cat of my landlady had vomited on the floor, á near the staircase I take to go to the bathroom.
label: disgust

text_A: The cat of my landlady escaped through the window which I had á left open.
label: guilt

text_A: I got a letter from my best friend, whom I had not heard from for á a long time (a good letter).
label: joy

text_A: Someone knocked on the door when I was alone at home (though á there was a door bell).  I looked through the peep hole but it á had been covered.  I called my sister but she could not help me á as she was hundreds of kilometres away.
label: fear

text_A: My parents put pressure on me to buy clothes, when I would not á have liked to do so.
label: anger

text_A: I told some acquaintances of mine something that I regretted á later.
label: shame

text_A: [ I speak harshly to my parents though they only mean my own á good.]
label: guilt

text_A: While cycling in the country a dog started running beside me, á growling and barking, and trying to bite my foot.
label: fear

text_A: When I had to move away from home to study, and I knew that I á would not be coming back home for a long time.
label: sadness

text_A: When I noticed two spiders running on the floor in different á directions.
label: disgust

text_A: When I realized that I had been wrong about a person close to me, á because of pre-set ideas and prejudices.
label: shame

text_A: When I reproached my friend because I was myself low-spirited and á disappointed.
label: guilt

text_A: [ In an aeroplane.]
label: fear

text_A: I was angry at my boyfriend who had promised to come to see me á but did not because he spent the evening with his pals.
label: anger

text_A: The breaking up of a relationship.  We decided that the á relationship could not carry on, so it was no surprise to me. á And anyhow, I had known it would happen sooner or later.
label: sadness

text_A: The disgust I feel towards a certain person.
label: disgust

text_A: After an event in which I felt that I had acted unfairly.
label: shame

text_A: At my job, I got disproportionately angry with a child.  My á reaction was not as it should have been.
label: guilt

text_A: I went to see the entrance examination results at university.  I á rejoyced at my success.
label: joy
