text_A: I borrowed a car which was supposed to be used for a long journey á a few hours later, and one of the tyres burst in the middle of á the town and I did not know what to do.
label: fear

text_A: A man tried to have sexual intercourse with me, though I had á communicated my unwillingness.  Later on, I felt disgust at that á person as well as myself because I had partly submitted.
label: disgust

text_A: I am going steady with a boy, but I had sexual intercourse with á another one, and I felt guilty about it afterwards.
label: guilt

text_A: A good report card (a scholarship) in primary school.
label: joy

text_A: I was walking home with a friend at night along a quiet street.  á Something started rustling in the bush : it was an exhibitionist.
label: fear

text_A: When my grandmother died of cancer.
label: sadness

text_A: [ Sometimes I have by accident said to another person something á in which it is easy to read a negative attitude.]
label: shame

text_A: For the sheer pleasure of it, I quarelled with my boyfriend who was trying  á to be especially kind to me.
label: guilt

text_A: When I made the acquaintance of a certain person.
label: joy

text_A: When abroad, while driving a car along a dark, winding road.
label: fear

text_A: When my sister took my things without having asked for my permission á first.
label: anger

text_A: When my grandfather died.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was working, I got treated in a way which I felt was not á democratic.
label: disgust

text_A: While working as a domestic helper, one day I had not cleaned up á very well and they made a remark about it.
label: shame

text_A: When I went to a job interview, I met a person who was very nice, á and his attitude made me glad.
label: joy

text_A: My episode of fright happened when I came to study.  I had to á stand in front of my still unknown fellow students and talk about á myself.  My hands shook, I flushed and became tongue-tied.
label: fear

text_A: I was in a restaurant with my boyfriend when I saw my best female á friend after not seeing her for two weeks.  We rejoyced, hugged á and had a long talk.
label: joy

text_A: One evening, while going to meet a friend of mine, I had to cross á a meadow by a dark road.  There were bushes on the other side of á the road.  The weather was damp and a bit foggy.  I heard steps á behind me and kept speeding up my steps all the time.
label: fear

text_A: My brother told me that a person (whom I know) had insulted him.  á I am very fond of my brother, and as he himself can not get angry á or hurt, my protectiveness was aroused and I got angry.
label: anger

text_A: My guinea-pig had been ill for a couple of days.  One evening, á when I came home I enquired as to how it was doing.  My mother's á expression told me that it had died.  My knees refused to support á me and I began to weep convulsively.
label: sadness

text_A: I had been away all night without having told my parents about á it.  In the morning when I came home, my mother looked tired.  á She said that she had been awake all night because of me and that á she was angry and disappointed.
label: shame

text_A: I saw a man who had had a heart-attack and who was being á treated for it.  I feared that my own father could have been á there.
label: fear

text_A: When I saw a big man hit another one, and nobody did anything.
label: anger

text_A: When my sister left to go home, in Sweden, after the Christmas á Holidays.
label: sadness

text_A: Without my permission, my son had made popcorn after coming back á from school.  The consequences were a spoilt kettle and chaos in á the kitchen but what could have happened with the hot grease ?
label: anger

text_A: One of my fellow students used questionable and unfair means to á advance her studies faster than others.  I detested her.
label: disgust

text_A: My friend told me in a fairly loud voice the blunders she á committed last night.
label: shame

text_A: I stopped my car in front of a pedestrian crossing as a child was á crossing the street.  The car driving in the next lane did not á stop and the child got hurt.  Had I not stopped ...
label: guilt

text_A: After my vacations, one day after a lecture it occured to me to á buy a rose for my mother.  We went together to a pub and my á mother told me that she would be getting married next Spring.  I á did not known about it and so was all the more glad.
label: joy

text_A: While travelling in a bus, there were three people sitting behind á me (two men and a woman).  They were drunk and the conversation á was unbelievable (about fucking, fellatio, etc...).  They tried á to get others to take part in the conversation.  I loathed it and á felt like crying.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was seven years old, I stole a chewing-gum from a big á glass bowl on the counter of a nearby shop, and I got caught.
label: shame

text_A: I had been away from home for a long time and when I came home I á was delighted.  It was wonderful to see familiar, dear people and á I was rejoycing in advance.  I had been feeling very lonely.
label: joy

text_A: I awoke at night and did not remember dreaming about antthing in á particular.  I just felt oppressing fear, it was dark and all the á others were sleeping.
label: fear

text_A: One winter day I, unwillingly, was outdoors with my younger á brother (10 years younger than me).  I lost my temper on him and á wanted to throw my brother down the snow bank we were on.  I á pushed him but not as hard as I had wanted to. We were alone the á two of us.
label: anger

text_A: I was on my way home by bus.  A man who had drunk a fair amount of á alcohol started talking, trying to hug and pat a woman sitting á next to him.  Fortunately it was not me.
label: disgust

text_A: When, after a long time, I saw a girl with whom I was in love.
label: joy

text_A: When I was walking on a fairly out-of-the-way street.
label: fear

text_A: A friend of mine had promised to arrange me some tickets for a á concert which I considered important.  He could not get them the á way he thought he would, so he gave up the whole thing.
label: anger

text_A: I was sad when I saw that a beautiful girl was not attainable.
label: sadness

text_A: I heard somebody talk about studies in a highly enthusiastic á \student-like\" way."
label: disgust

text_A: While attending some affairs, which were taking some time, with á a bank officer, I felt that my clothes and appearance were out of place, too á raggy.
label: shame

text_A: One evening I went out with some friends of mine, although I was á supposed to stay at home with my little sister who is 11.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was in the army, a room mate of mine came back from á furlough and threatened another fellow with a knife.
label: fear

text_A: I worked for seven months in a factory, and made friends with a á fellow worker.  Later, I visited my former fellow workers and was á told that, while in the army, my friend had shot himself.
label: sadness

text_A: While doing some calculation exercises, I neglected a part of it, á though I had marked it as done.  By chance, I was asked to á demonstrate this very part on the blackboard.
label: guilt

text_A: I read in the newspaper that the Student Lodging Fund was going á to build new appartments for refugees (in my opinion this is the á state's affair).  This is when only a fractoin of the students á can find an appartment.
label: anger

text_A: I lead a rather secure life.  The only thing I can remember is a á song from the nineteenth century which is against alcohol.  Both á the melody and the word (although naive) effected my emotions.
label: sadness

text_A: Yesterday in the elevator a man started smoking, this is á something I just can not tolerate.
label: disgust

text_A: [ Generally when I am shopping I feel like I were guilty of all á the thefts through the year (I have never stolen).]
label: guilt

text_A: When my favourite football team made a goal and was about to á win the Cup of England.
label: joy

text_A: I was less than 10 years old when our neighbour's dog chased me á to the roof of a small shed and there seemed to be no hope of á getting away from there.
label: fear

text_A: When I heard about the death of Frantois Truffaut, the French motion  á picture director, on the radio.  I had planned to go and see his á last film.
label: sadness

text_A: I had misbehaved at a party and did not wish to meet the person á in question later.
label: shame

text_A: While playing a ball game, I made a mistake and we lost the game.
label: guilt

text_A: I had a dream in which I was an African elephant.
label: fear

text_A: When my car froze, and I could not start it.
label: sadness

text_A: When I saw our computer teacher.
label: disgust

text_A: My mother had not come home at midnight.  She had forgotten to á tell me about it.  I was very young and all alone at home.
label: fear

text_A: When my grandmother died of cancer.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was still a child, I saw a horror film on TV in which á there was a rotten human skull.
label: disgust

text_A: As a small boy, I took a coin from an empty taxi cab.  My mother á saw it and told the driver about it.  I even knew the driver.
label: shame

text_A: New Year's Eve party in the country, I hardly knew a person; my á partner spent most of the time at the bar. I had little á opportunity to get to know people because our table was separated á and my boyfriend's parents were present.
label: anger

text_A: Father said: If you are pregnant, you will have to procure á abortion. I was filled with disgust against my father.
label: disgust

text_A: I had an intimate relation with my boyfriend, but unfortunately á we had sexual problems; therefore I deceived him, but I was á ashamed when I told my friend about it.
label: shame

text_A: I work at a commercial house from 7 to 10 a.m. On a very cold day á in winter I was late - and let a fellow worker stand in the cold á for half an hour.
label: guilt

text_A: At the weekend I wanted to be absent from school because of a á sports event, but my teacher refused to give me the day off á because he didn't like me.
label: anger

text_A: A gigantic spider climbed over my face and what is more - in my á own flat.
label: disgust

text_A: I was very fat and felt absolutely unwell. I was afraid of á leaving the house and getting to know new people.
label: shame

text_A: I was said to be responsible for my mother getting ill and á growing thin. I did not realize that it really was my fault until á several weeks later.
label: guilt

text_A: I won a car in a prize-competition. The moment I was informed á about it, I felt joy.
label: joy

text_A: My sister had to undergo a very complicated operation, her á eyesight was at stake.
label: fear

text_A: I had a quarrel with my parents; I was convinced to be right.
label: anger

text_A: Scuffle in a carriage of the underground in Vienna, three drunk á men thrashed a man in a wheel chair - I watched the scene from á another carriage.
label: disgust

text_A: I put an end to a friendship with a girl - I had only pretended á love and affection to be able to sleep with her.
label: shame

text_A: A young girl tried to put an end to her life because of lover's á grief; not until she was in hospital I heard that I had been the á reason for her action.
label: guilt

text_A: In order to be admitted to my final examination, I had to pass á two examinations. As I had not studied very much, I resigned á myself to be left behind. Nevertheless I succeeded in these á examinations.
label: joy

text_A: A friend of mine, who had repeated a year at school once before, á did not pass the final examination and had to take it again half á a year later.
label: sadness

text_A: Eco-activists demonstrated against a project to build a power station á at the Danube in the middle of a lowland forest (Hainburg) and á the government decided to delay it for another year. When my á father heard about it, he said that we needed another Hitler.
label: disgust

text_A: I was supposed to fetch some friends at the bus stop, but I did á not do it because my father was in a bad mood and I was afraid á that he would grumble.
label: guilt

text_A: My boyfriend returned after a long absence.
label: joy

text_A: I wanted to see a friend, I had been looking forward to it and á had certain expectations, but he did not pay any attention to me, á played cards with other people.
label: anger

text_A: In broad daylight I saw an untidy old man pissing and playing á with his penis in the middle of the town.
label: disgust

text_A: Somebody who knows me very well discovered that I had told him a á lie.
label: shame

text_A: Recently a good friend only called me when he needed something. á He never said \please\" or \"thank you\" or any other kind word."
label: anger

text_A: In our flat the bath-tub is in the kitchen. At the beginning I á had very intensive feelings of shame when I had a bath and people á were in the kitchen.
label: shame

text_A: I had to take care of the plants of a friend of mine for several á weeks. I watered them, but let them stand in a cold room so that á two of them perished.
label: guilt

text_A: When I met a good friend after a long time. We had had a quarrel á but after two weeks I was really glad to see him again.
label: joy

text_A: When we stayed in Vienna with our class, my friend and I behaved á incorrectly. Our teacher threatened us with exclusion from á school.
label: fear

text_A: When I lost my driving license because I had been driving while á under the influence of alcool.
label: anger

text_A: My mother's death.
label: sadness

text_A: I think I felt ashamed for the first time when I entered a night á club.
label: shame

text_A: During the Christmas holidays, I went to see my parents and á stayed with them for two weeks. After two or three days, we had á the same conflicts we had had ten years before when I had lived á with them. They were glad when I left.
label: sadness

text_A: Old man in hospital, hollow-cheeked, only one half of his nose á and glass-eye, rattling breath.
label: disgust

text_A: When my father came into the bathroom and saw me standing there á naked.
label: shame

text_A: I live with my boyfriend, we have a close relationship, I fell in á love with another man.
label: guilt

text_A: When I met my girlfriend - I had not counted on that.
label: joy

text_A: One night I had a feeling that somebody was stealing my car, á but I was too frightened to go and see.
label: fear

text_A: When we rearranged furniture in our flat and got stuck in a á chair.
label: anger

text_A: Several weeks ago, I had problems with friends, I felt disgusted á by a friend.
label: disgust

text_A: When quarreling with friends.
label: guilt

text_A: In Southern Tyrol, I was gathering apples, it was a fine day, I á was not thinking about anything, I felt an overwhelming joy.
label: joy

text_A: My girlfriend and I slept in a lonely hut (we had drunk alcool). á Suddenly some soil fell on us, then some water. Although we tried á hard, we could not find out the cause.
label: fear

text_A: I helped my little sister (13 years) learning mathematics. á Obviously she did not want to understand what I explained and á started to cry. I grew angry.
label: anger

text_A: When my girlfriend told me that she wanted to leave me.
label: sadness

text_A: When I went to a sauna with my father for the first time (I was á 16). When I entered the sauna naked, I felt ashamed for a short á time.
label: shame

text_A: A friend I had missed very much came to see me unexpectedly.
label: joy

text_A: On my way through lonely streets I met with a huge stray dog. It á stopped at some distance and looked at me. I tried to ignore it á but I was very frightened.
label: fear

text_A: A friend of mine tried to persuade me to go at her place to act á as a model because she felt too tired. It was a quarter of an á hour before the appointed time, I had just lied down and did not á want to go because it was too late anyway. She said that I only á was talking about looking for work, but if it was possible I á would not accept it. I was angry about this unjust judgment.
label: anger

text_A: After I had lived with my boyfriend in a foreign country for half á a year, I saw that it was impossible for me to stay with him (for á economic reasons). We separated although I loved him.
label: sadness

text_A: In a certain book I read about cruelties and violence in prison á and souteneur circles; I felt especially disgusted when I read á detailed descriptions of physical and mental torture of less á powerful people.
label: disgust

text_A: It was on St. Claus Day when I was five years old. St. Claus and á his Devil Servant came to see me. St. Claus' Devil Servant á rattled with his chain and bowled terribly. I was so frightened á that my parents had to ask him to leave.
label: fear

text_A: When I was eight years old my father was run over by a car. When á I saw his body I was sad beyond words.
label: sadness

text_A: A friend prepared a soup with chicken heads and invited me to eat á it. I saw the eyes staring at me and the tongues hanging out of á the bills. I was so disgusted that I felt nausea and had to leave á the room.
label: disgust

text_A: When I had to go to the gynecologist and to sit on that special á chair, I felt ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: I was afraid of a certain examination although I was relatively á well prepared.
label: fear

text_A: I had to call somebody between 12 and 12:30. As I had no á possibility to call him at this time, I did not do it until 3 á p.m.
label: guilt

text_A: I went home all alone from a restaurant. It was dark, I went very á fast. Behind me, there were some drunk men who shouted at me. By á chance, I met some friends who accompanied me.
label: fear

text_A: A friend who shares the room with me, opened the window in the á morning and left the room the whole day. When I came home in the á evening, the room was so cold that I couldn't stay there.
label: anger

text_A: When my aunt, whom I had loved very much, died. When I heard á about her death, I was not as touched as at the funeral. I really á became conscious of her death at that moment.
label: sadness

text_A: A friend told me how he managed to win the sympathy of as many á people as possible. He said he first listened to what they said á and then he tried to only say things they would like to hear. á He would never express his own opinion. I felt really disgusted á when he told that.
label: disgust

text_A: I arrived in Vienna in the middle of the night. I asked for some á silly information - as I realized myself afterwards - and the inquiry  á clerk reacted in a very arrogant manner.
label: anger

text_A: I had to leave my girlfriend for 4 weeks because of my studies. á This happens frequently. The last 24 hours before my departure á are always very depressing.
label: sadness

text_A: When I stayed in the house of friends, I washed my face and á wanted to dry it with a towel. This towel seemed to have been á used over a long time already. It smelled indefinably awful.
label: disgust

text_A: I wanted to clear up a misunderstanding with a friend that I had á caused. A third person meddled in our conversation, turned my á efforts to ridicule so that I did not succeed in what I had á intended.
label: anger

text_A: One night I did not come home without telling my parents and I á did not want to speak about it afterwards. My mother cried. I had á a bad conscience and felt guilty.
label: guilt

text_A: After 3 weeks I saw my girlfriend again.
label: joy

text_A: When the grandmother of my friend died in a hospital. My friend á was crying and I was sad, too.
label: sadness

text_A: I saw a physically handicapped young man whose spittle ran out of á his mouth while speaking.
label: disgust

text_A: My girlfriend's results in school had become worse because I á prevented her from learning (we often went out etc.).
label: guilt

text_A: When I was a child, I heard the floor cracking and I thought á there was a burglar in our house; I hid under the blanket and á trembled.
label: fear

text_A: During a lecture, a colleague who did not know anything about the á subject, got on my nerves asking silly questions.
label: anger

text_A: During the military service, I lost a part of an equipment; I á accused another person and he was rebuked and punished.
label: guilt

text_A: At a choral concert I appeared as a solist. The concert5 was very á good, I forgot all the hard work that had been done before. There á remained only an undescribable joy and a feeling of warmth, á security etc.
label: joy

text_A: Several years ago my brother died in an accident. When I heard á about it, I was very sad. It took years until I resigned myself á to it.
label: sadness

text_A: I read a book about the situation in South-Africa, about the á terrible violations of human rights. I was disgusted with the á white population.
label: disgust

text_A: My P.T. instructor also works as a masseur. He wanted to massage á me, therefore I had to undress. For the first few times this was á not easy for me; I got gradually used to it.
label: shame

text_A: Some time ago I took the driving test. I did answer the á theoretical questions very well, but I failed the practical á driving test. It was my fault because I had not enough practice.
label: guilt

text_A: After an exhausting day I came home and wanted to take a bath to á relax. My father wanted to take a bath first and when he had á finished after an hour, there was no hot water left for me.
label: anger

text_A: A drunk man attacked his wife and wanted to humiliate her by á insulting her. Then he turned violent and started to beat her in á front of her child. She left it happen without saying a word in á order not to make things worse. I watched the scene and tried to á calm the man, but without success. Just because he was stronger á we had to comply. From that day I detested him.
label: disgust

text_A: For a medical check-up, we - boys and girls - had to take off our á clothes with the exception of our underwear. Then we had to go á into another classroom where older pupils were sitting and á staring at us.
label: shame

text_A: I allowed my little brother to clean the bathroom in his own way. á My mother came and saw the floor overflowed with water, slapped á my brother in the face and told him to go to bed immediately.
label: guilt

text_A: One day I did not feel very well and I wanted to talk to á somebody. A friend invited me for dinner and I was very glad.
label: joy

text_A: I was driving my car and it was very misty. It was in the night á and I was alone in my car. I felt totally insecure, nervous and á overstrained.
label: fear

text_A: My mother treated me unjustly as if I was a little child. I said á mean things. I was unable to defend myself adequately.
label: anger

text_A: I took the tram without paying. There were many people around me á when I was caught by a controller. I felt ashamed but also angry.
label: shame

text_A: I behaved in a nasty manner towards a friend, I said things which á I could have said in a more friendly way. After that I felt á guilty.
label: guilt

text_A: A friend of mine often had difficulties with her parents. Once á she had a child she had a better relationship with them.
label: joy

text_A: It happened in a tram: some older people started to grumble about á the young people just because I had not immediately left my seat á to them.
label: anger

text_A: A friend was assaulted by a young man on her way home.
label: disgust

text_A: During my holidays I had a boyfriend who turned away from me á outwardly. Therefore I danced with another man and raised certain á hopes in him. After a while I had to explain to him the á circumstances
label: guilt

text_A: I received a letter and a Christmas present from a person I had á not seen for two years.
label: joy

text_A: I was at home alone and my mother had asked me to heat the house. á I put too much fuel into the stove. It began to glow and there á was a noise in the whole house as if it was going to explode.
label: fear

text_A: At the end of my holiday job I got less money than was due to me á and nobody mentioned anything about that.
label: anger

text_A: At school a classmate who was a very good pupil had to help á another boy who performed less well. He told him on purpose the á wrong things so that he had to repeat a year.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was a child I played my mother a nasty trick to make her á feel hurt.
label: shame

text_A: I share my small flat with my friend. On her birthday we could á not see each other until evening because we had to stay at the á University all day. In the evening I left a lecture before it á finished to be able to buy flowers for her. When I was at home á she called me to tell me that she would stay the night with her á boyfriend.
label: anger

text_A: When I was younger I often saw my father come home drunk (he had á big problems at that time). Once he woke me up in the middle of á the night and shouted at me.
label: disgust

text_A: After a weekend at a seminar I saw my husband again. I hurried á home hoping he would be there. We embraced - I enjoyed feeling á his body.
label: joy

text_A: One evening I stayed at home all alone. As we lived on the ground á floor, I was often afraid of burglers.
label: fear

text_A: When I was ten years old a classmate laughed at me because I had á told him that my father had retired.
label: shame

text_A: I felt guilty because I had not accomplished a thing as well as I á had wanted to.
label: guilt

text_A: A party with friends on New Year's Eve.
label: joy

text_A: I met again a very good friend after a year and realized that á there had grown a certain distance between us.
label: sadness

text_A: When I listened to a conversation of friends talking about the á power of money.
label: disgust

text_A: When my grandmother died - at her funeral.
label: sadness

text_A: I read about a monk who had been murdered and put into a barrel á which was filled with blood of pigs.
label: disgust

text_A: I went for a walk with a very close friend; we were talking about á our problems, I told her lies.
label: shame

text_A: I had to tell a collegue the time for an appointment with another á collegue. I told her the wrong time - it was obviously my fault.
label: guilt

text_A: I went to buy a bicycle with my father. When I wanted to pay, my á father took his purse and payed.
label: joy

text_A: My mother had fallen down from a ladder when she had been á gathering cherries. Her back was hurt. Just when I arrived, I saw á people of the life-saving service giving her medical care.
label: fear

text_A: At a weekend's seminar my trousers suddenly burst, therefore I was á prevented from participating in several activities.
label: shame

text_A: Before Christmas I got to know a girl but our relationshop could á not consolidate before the holiday. Therefore it was a big á surprise to get a carefully hand-made present from her. - Our á relationship grew closer.
label: joy

text_A: When I was a child, I fell into a cellar (when playing) and could á be freed only with big difficulties.
label: fear

text_A: When my grandmother died. I had a very deep relation to her (I á lived with her for several years).
label: sadness

text_A: When I went to the sauna for the first time and there were men á and women.
label: shame

text_A: When I shoplifted a pair of earrings from Coles and my Mum caught á me with them in my bag.
label: guilt

text_A: When my mother was tremendous on the phone and we talked for á hours. She was in a good mood.
label: joy

text_A: When I saw a good male friend unexpectedly after a year, as I've á just returned from overseas. I was feeling tired, looking a mess, á and nervous.
label: fear

text_A: When I wanted to talk to someone I liked and whom I have been á told likes me (by his brother and even by himself) however he á avoids any confrontation, and is vague.
label: anger

text_A: After having left the company of someone who gave me a lot of á support and made me laugh, found myself alone for days on end.
label: sadness

text_A: When a boy had continued to use foul language and swearing in á front of a group of my friends.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was about seven or eight I was caught having stolen a á doll's dress from my next-door neighbour.
label: shame

text_A: Feeling guilt after greed, buying chocolate and pigging out to á the point of feeling sick, especially as I am fat.
label: guilt

text_A: When planning to marry.
label: joy

text_A: No really strong such emotion. Just falling off to sleep when I á caught sight of a 5 cm diameter spider crawling onto the pillow á beside me.
label: fear

text_A: My feelings towards would-be in-laws for their participation in á recent broken relationship.
label: anger

text_A: Recent break-up of seriors long-term relationship, helped along á by would-be  in-laws.
label: sadness

text_A: After failing a second attempt at Med 4, following a number of á difficult personal circumstances.
label: shame

text_A: Failure to complete medical course as a result of failing fourth á year twice.
label: guilt

text_A: When Wayne and Sue (close friends) were announced our guardians á at ther wedding.
label: joy

text_A: When boyfriend lied to me.
label: anger

text_A: On boat trip - saw mother giving young child (aprox 6-7 years) á cigarettes.
label: disgust

text_A: Getting a part-time job.
label: joy

text_A: When my grandfather was sick, and died I felt more sad, though, á when he was sick.
label: sadness

text_A: People spitting in railway stations.
label: disgust

text_A: Falling over.
label: shame

text_A: At school, a couple of years ago, a so-called acquaintance told lies á about me to a teacher I was told about it by friends who overheard á the conversation.
label: anger

text_A: My grandfather died. He lived almost as a recluse not caring for á himself as well as he should - Dad and we all helped as much as á we could, but it didn't save him from himself. It was an á unexpected death. His second de facto wife was lucky she wasn't á jailed.
label: sadness

text_A: In my penultimate job I was responsible of a sections with á several employers, after several years of dedication I was á dismissed by a new chef, saying that I was incompetent.
label: sadness

text_A: I assisted to a scene where the police attacked a person that á didn't have his documents. The savagery was too much, and the á attacked person bleeded to much.
label: disgust

text_A: When I get something that seemed very hard like getting a job, a á boyfriend, etc. A specific sutuations, was when I started to date á a boy whom I liked for a long time.
label: joy

text_A: When I had to assume a position which I didn't expect.
label: fear

text_A: The acts of brutal violence in generally disgusts me. Fights, á phisical aggrssion, etc.
label: disgust

text_A: I felt ashamed when in a certain occasion I had to read a text á and didn't stop stuttering.
label: shame

text_A: The loss of the woman who loved me most till today.
label: sadness

text_A: When I succeed in writing something I felt and doing it I felt á well and very happy for being able to express to myself something á that was suffocating me.
label: joy

text_A: When I heard about the death of somebody I liked very much and I á was not present either to see the person or to try to share my á emotions with other friends.
label: sadness

text_A: When I saw a woman subjugated by money and not being able to hide á how she hated herself for not having the will power to get out of á such a situation because it was convenient, according to what she á told me.
label: disgust

text_A: I forgot to water the flowers in our flat and was rebuked by my á friends who share the flat with me.
label: guilt

text_A: After my final examination at school I was glad that the á examination was over and that I had passed it.
label: joy

text_A: I was angry with a person who behaved terribly at a ball á offending her relatives.
label: anger

text_A: My brother caught a spider and let his frog eat it.
label: disgust

text_A: Once I spoke without thinking very much - it was quite a á nonsense.
label: shame

text_A: For about one year I had a rather bad relation with my father. á Last Christmas Eve he invited me to stay withhim and I was very á glad about it. It was a fine evening.
label: joy

text_A: I live outside Graz - so I have to go by bus. One day I went home á from the bus stop alone. It was dark, I had to go through a á forest and there was a dark figure behind me. I was very á frightened.
label: fear

text_A: I have a horror of spiders and snakes. On a walk through the wood á I saw the body of a slow-worm (without the head).
label: disgust

text_A: I came home from a party rather drunk. I said things I would á never have said normally. Next morning I was terribly ashamed á about what I had said.
label: shame

text_A: An accident happened to my little cousin because I had not taken á enough care of her. She fell on the floor and her hands were á hurt.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was a child, I had a terrible nightmare with St. Nicholas' á Devil Servant. I asked my mother if he really existed and she á said yes. The following nights I could not sleep and a á light had to be left turned on.
label: fear

text_A: As I usually do not start learning until a short time before an á examination,, I once made up my mind to try to work for a longer á time. But once again I did not do it - and got a bad mark.
label: anger

text_A: I went out with my sister, her boyfriend and his friend. I did á not like this young man. But suddenly he overcame me and kissed á me. He was very strong so that I could not defend myself.
label: disgust

text_A: During the oral part of my final examination I made a mistake in á speaking so that all the teachers laughed at me.
label: shame

text_A: There was a time when I did not get on well with my sister. I á always grumbled at her and said bad things about her to my á mother. So my mother always scolded her.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was on a cave excursion with friends, I suddenly lost them á and was afraid of losing my way in the cave.
label: fear

text_A: When my grandmother died; I had a stronger relation to her than á to my mother.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was molested by an old drunk man.
label: disgust

text_A: When I had a Latin examination in school.
label: shame

text_A: When I had drunk too much and nearly got an alcohol poisoning.
label: guilt

text_A: When my grandparents moved to another part of the town.
label: sadness

text_A: At the butcher's I saw an animal which had just been slaughtered; á blood was dripping on the floor.
label: disgust

text_A: In school I was very bad in running long distances and my á class-mates laughed at me for this reason.
label: shame

text_A: I had to take care of my little brother. When I met a friend I á did not pay attention to him for a certain time and he was hurt á while he was playing.
label: guilt

text_A: When we still attended school, my brother and I usually went to á see our aunt and to show her our term's report. She rewarded us á with money. Although my reports were as good as my brother's, he á got more money.
label: anger

text_A: My friend was pregnant, but lost her child during the second á month. I went to see her at hospital - she was crying. I felt á very sorry for her.
label: sadness

text_A: I had to take care of a neighbour's child. I did not look after á it all the time and the child fell down and was hurt. I felt á guilty.
label: guilt

text_A: A very good friend of mine had been away for three months. When á we met again, we ran up to each other and embraced.
label: joy

text_A: I put my head into the pullover of a girl to see her breasts. The á girl looked at me so that I felt ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: My uncle had promised to buy me a bicycle. As time went by and I á had not received it yet, I asked my father to buy it for me. á Later I heard that my uncle had wanted to offer me the bicycle on á my birthday two weeks later.
label: guilt

text_A: Several days after my final examination at school, I was sitting á in an airplane on my way to Greece. I enjoyed that moment very á much.
label: joy

text_A: One night I was lying in my bed awake but I had my eyes closed. I á saw figures with terrible faces and black frocks bending over me á and touching me. I opened my eyes but I could still see them. I á had the feeling that somebody was in the room. It was terrible. á Only when I turned on the light I was able to go to sleep.
label: fear

text_A: Our dog had to be shot because he had killed a roe. I liked him á very much and so I could not resign myself to that. I hated the á hunter who shot him.
label: sadness

text_A: I had to go to the doctor's because of a veneral disease. I told á the doctor that I must have been infected by my boy-friend. This á was not true, but I was ashamed to tell the truth.
label: shame

text_A: When we were playing, I hurt my little sister, but towards my á mother I did not admit that it was my fault.
label: guilt

text_A: My neighbour was not able to set his car in motion because it had á snowed heavily. I helped him - he was thankful and invited me.
label: joy

text_A: I was skiing with friends and they wanted to ski-jump. I did not á want to be left behind, so I braced myself and followed them.
label: fear

text_A: At an examination I got a bad mark just because of a small á mistake. When I went to the lector and wanted to talk about that, á he did not listen to me but sent me away.
label: anger

text_A: My cut was run over by a car. After searching for a long time I á found her lying in a kerb. I was rather shocked and angry with á the driver.
label: sadness

text_A: At a cross-country race I wanted to take a short-cut (which is á not allowed). I was caught and disqualified. All my friends had á observed that.
label: shame

text_A: During a discussion I reacted very aggressively and so I made it á impossible to continue discussing.
label: guilt

text_A: On my birthday I got a present that I had desired for a long á time.
label: joy

text_A: When I am discussing something with a person and I realize that á the other person is thinking over her own argumentations instead á of listening, I become angry.
label: anger

text_A: I studied medicine for several semesters. I was always disgusted á when we had the dissecting-course. I cannot understand why some á persons like this course.
label: disgust

text_A: Some time ago we had a tournament in our tennis-club. For á tactical reasons I was chosen to play against a much weaker á player than I am. Although it would have been enough simply to á win the game, I defeated him extremely. This would not have been á necessary.
label: shame

text_A: I had a discussion with my girl-friend. After some time we á started to quarrel and at least - to get the upper hand - I said á that she was not as important to me as she might believe. Some á time later I apologized for that.
label: guilt

text_A: On New Year's Eve I went in a disco with friends. I amused myself á and got to know many other people.
label: joy

text_A: I had to go to the dentist's. When he touched my tooth with his á drill, I was terribly aftaid of the pain I would feel any moment.
label: fear

text_A: My sister, whom I like very much, asked me for a favour which I á refused her for some flimsy reason. Some time later I felt sorry á for that and something like sadness.
label: sadness

text_A: On my way to a concert I went with a man who tried to molest me. á At that moment I did not care much but now the impression fills á me with disgust.
label: disgust

text_A: I asked my friend to come with me to a disco because I wanted to á be with a person I know well. But when I amused myself with á others I let my friend sit alone, although I had asked her to á come.
label: shame

text_A: I called my little sister to make her pick up her toy from the á floor. When she still refused after I had asked her for the á fourth time, we began to quarrel. At last the whole family was á involved in this quarrel and trouble was brewing.
label: guilt

text_A: I had a singing-lesson, but I was not very good. The last á exercise was singing scales. I did that very well and my teacher á seemed satisfied.
label: joy

text_A: Years ago on Christmas Eve I felt very sad because I realized for á the first time how I missed my father who had died at Christmas á Years ago.
label: sadness

text_A: On my 18th birthday I passed the driving-test. I was glad because á I had had to study very much, because I had been lucky and á because - as a proof that it was really difficult - not everybody á had passed the test.
label: joy

text_A: At about midnight I had to go by bike through Graz alone. On the á whole it was a distance of several kilometers. A car followed me á through the streets. Only when I went into a one-way street the á car disappeared. The rest of my way home I was very afraid.
label: fear

text_A: I had cared for a horse for 2 years. One day it was sold and I á cried for several days because I was so sad.
label: sadness

text_A: A friend of mine was telling jokes which I felt to be very á disgusting, especially because I was eating.
label: disgust

text_A: At a carneval-party I smooched with a man - some days later I was á rather ashamed for that.
label: shame

text_A: By fun I had a tussle with my sister. Suddenly I obviously hurt á her unintentionally - and she ran out of the room, crying.
label: guilt

text_A: During my first week in Graz I met a girl who I had got to know á in the train from Amsterdam to Graz. Although I had considered á her very sympathetic, we had seperated without changing our á adresses.
label: joy

text_A: Several years ago I stayed with friends in the mountains for one á week. We lived in a hut and had to cook for ourselves. One day my á friend did not succeed in preparing spaghetti. That dinner was á terrible - nevertheless we all ate rather much and had an á improper and unsavoury conversation.
label: disgust

text_A: When I still went to primary-school, I went on a ski-trip with my á family. After skiing we went to a restaurant for lunch. Suddenly á my father said that he had forgotten something in the car. He á gave me the key and asked me to go and get it. I had difficulties á with the key which was already bent. I asked my mother to help á me. When she tried to turn the key it broke. We had no second á key. My mother was blamed for all that and I did not say a word.
label: guilt

text_A: I had not studied very much for my final examination at school, á so I had to take an additional examination in French. The oral á examination was not very hard for me - the more I was glad when I á heard that I had passed it.
label: joy

text_A: When I was 8 years old my tonsils had to be operated on. This is á not a complicated operation, but just before it started I was á very afraid so that I will never forget it.
label: fear

text_A: I had been together with my boy-friend for two and a half years, á when he got to know another girl and not even tried to conceal á that from me. I drew my conclusions and left him - I also felt a á bit guilty for what had happened.
label: guilt

text_A: My boy-friend told me that he would take me to the training of á the life-saving dogs.
label: joy

text_A: A man treated his dog very badly - he insulted and beated him á until the dog kept lying on the floor with his tail drawn in.
label: anger

text_A: On TV I saw a report about church in Amerika. A priest was shown á who was performing miracles in front of the camera - I felt á disgusted.
label: disgust

text_A: To be able to prepare myself better for an important examination, á I did not spend the nitht with my girl-friend but in the á students' hostel. I had not done that for months. The day when I á had the examn, somebody knocked at my door at seven o'clock in á the morning. My girl-friend who likes sleeping late, had come to á be able to be with me.
label: joy

text_A: My son's mother told me that she wanted to move to Vienna and á take the child with her. This means a rather long distance for á me. My whole family was sad and dumbfounded so that my own á feelings were intensified.
label: sadness

text_A: I spent an evening with my girl-friend. When we wanted to go to á bed I was totally drunk. Next morning I felt rather ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: After a long time I saw my boy-friend again.
label: joy

text_A: My first public appearance in front of a rathe big audience.
label: fear

text_A: I was angry about how the government acted concerning Hainburg, á especially when I saw a discussion about it on TV.
label: anger

text_A: Death of my father; he died of laryngeal cancer.
label: sadness

text_A: When I bought new skis; I was ashamed to tell the assistant that á I am not good at skiing and therefor bought racing skis.
label: shame

text_A: Before an examination: I had the fealing that I had not learned á enough.
label: fear

text_A: I was sitting in a restaurant with friends. They asked me á something which they thought I should know. Actually I know it, á but at that time I was not able to remember it.
label: shame

text_A: I had an appointment with a friend. I promised him to meet with á him, but at last I did not without having informed him.
label: guilt

text_A: A friend of mine told other people that I was a slattern (because á of an occurence that had happened some time ago). When I heard á about that I was very angry.
label: anger

text_A: When I was 6 or 7 years old, I pulled down the trousers of a á friend because I wanted to know what she looked like. My mother á watched that and (as a punishment) sent me into the house. We á never spoke about that; I think it was as embarassing for her as á it was for me.
label: shame

text_A: When I told my boy-friend, who loved me very much, that I wanted á to put an end to our relationship. a long time before I told him á that and also a long time after that I felt guilty, because I had á hurt him so much.
label: guilt

text_A: Unexpectedly I met some persons who I like very much. á Spontaneously they invited me and integrated me within their á group, although it was late in the evening.
label: joy

text_A: A friend of mine uses butter instead of oil when he is cooking. I á am always angry about that, because it is an unnecessary luxury. á Recently we both were cooking and he wanted to use butter again. á When I had already put the oil into the pan, he poured it out á again and put the butter into the pan.
label: anger

text_A: After some friends had come to see me. They had stayed for á several days and we had got on very well. When they had left, I á had a feeling of emptyness.
label: sadness

text_A: I had a quarrel with a friend who lived with me in the same flat. á He moved out. Before he went he invited me and some friends for a á drink. At last he was totally drunk and smelled disgusting. á Besides, he told lies about us and behaved as if he was to be á pitied.
label: disgust

text_A: I went to see a friend. There were other people, too, and á everybody brought some present. I was the onlyone who brought á nothing. My friend was very hospitable and did not show anything á - although I knew how he felt.
label: shame

text_A: I had a quarrel with my fiancT. When he admitted his fault, á everything was allright. It was then for the first time that he á surprised me with coffee and cake and a bunch of flowers.
label: joy

text_A: After my boy-friend had beaten me for the first time, I always á trembled when somebody knocked on my door or when I heard steps á coming nearer.
label: fear

text_A: I had to give up my love, because it did not work out well.
label: sadness

text_A: I spied on my fiancT and was terribly jealous. Later I saw that á there was no reason for that.
label: guilt

text_A: My sister had a daughter. I saw the baby for the first time á through a pane of glass and she looked at me.
label: joy

text_A: My mother, my sister and I were sitting in the sitting room and á watching a film on TV. My father came home drunk and told us to á turn off. When we did not do that he switched off the fuse and á started shouting. We were sitting in the dark and I was afraid á that he would do us a harm.
label: fear

text_A: When I was 9 years old, I got a cat, but after 3 days he died. I á was very sad, because I had nursed him and taken him to the á veterinary's - but in vain. Although I had had him only for a á short time I had liked him very much.
label: sadness

text_A: When my grandmother was about 80 years old, she lived with us for á several years. I saw her illness. I did not even want to breath á the air that smelled of her presence.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was a child, I was sometimes forced to eat things that á disgusted me.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was 12 years old, some friends of our family had come to á watch TV. I lay on the floor and moved my pelvis. When the other á people had gone, my mother told me that it had looked as if I had á wanted to make sex.
label: shame

text_A: When I shirked the gymnastic lesson I met the director of our á school who asked me what I was doing.
label: guilt

text_A: I have a very big family. At my grandmother's funeral we all met á and everybody pretended mourning. In reality it was like a á fashion-show: everybody wanted to show himself.
label: anger

text_A: Often a dog which is treated very badly by his owner comes to us.
label: sadness

text_A: When I heard that I had passed my final examination at school á (with success).
label: joy

text_A: When my mother kept me in leading-strings.
label: anger

text_A: When I made a fool at an examination.
label: shame

text_A: When I had wrongly explained someone an important exemple for an á examination.
label: guilt

text_A: Last year I went to see friends in Yugoslavia - two girls with á whom I get along very well.
label: joy

text_A: Before I went to the urologist's I was afraid for several á reasons: because it was for the first time, because the medical á check-up might be painful, because of the uncertainty and because á someone had informed me about it.
label: fear

text_A: My girl-friend did not understand me; I was angry with myself á because I had problems when we seperated - I could not resign á myself to it.
label: anger

text_A: A friend who was 22 years old died.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was in the army, we got a certain dish for dinner that I á do not like at all. We were not obliged to eat, but I was very á hungry.
label: disgust

text_A: A friend who was 22 years old, died of leukemia; I had not known á that he was so ill and therefore had not cared.
label: guilt

text_A: When we got a young dog.
label: joy

text_A: I had an accident with damage to the car body.
label: anger

text_A: When I was a child, I had a medical check-up. I had to undress á myself and was examined by several doctors.
label: shame

text_A: When I heard that a good friend, who had been abroad for a long á time, would come and see me.
label: joy

text_A: I heard friends grumbling at me in an adjoining room, although á they had behaved in a friendly way when I was present.
label: anger

text_A: When my brother died.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was a child: I had told my mother a lie and she found it á out.
label: shame

text_A: My father had been alone for a long time because my mother and á sister were on holiday. I had not seen him for a long time and á when I finally called him I realized that he had been very sad á about that.
label: guilt

text_A: I unexpectedly got a present from my father.
label: joy

text_A: When I had to go through lonely streets in the middle of the á night.
label: fear

text_A: A relative, whom I like very much, left for the United States.
label: sadness

text_A: Some persons, who are important for me, came to see me and I had á not washed the dishes.
label: shame

text_A: I was looking after my cousin's little daughter; she fell down, á was slightly injured and cried vociferously.
label: guilt

text_A: I met again a very good friend whom I had not seen for a long á time.
label: joy

text_A: I got lost in a foreign town. I did not know the language of that á country and it took me hours to meet my friends again.
label: fear

text_A: A friend had promised to get me a book which was very important á for my work, but she forgot it.
label: anger

text_A: My dog, whom I had had for eleven years, died. I watched his á soporification.
label: sadness

text_A: My friend came to see me after she had stayed abroad. I waited at á the station.
label: joy

text_A: After a motor accident (I was the frong-seat-passenger) I spit á blood.
label: fear

text_A: At an office an application that I had made was turned down á because of a scrupulous interpretation of the rules.
label: anger

text_A: My uncle died - I felt sad at the funeral.
label: sadness

text_A: I saw a drunk man tottering behind his wife and insulting her á awfully.
label: disgust

text_A: I spread abroad an intimate secret.
label: guilt

text_A: I bought a Christmas present for my girl-friend. On my way home I á was really glad about having found such a suitable thing.
label: joy

text_A: I was angry when I watched a ski-race. All the Austrian skiers á dropped out.
label: anger

text_A: On my way home in the middle of the night I saw a drunk man and a á woman who were quarreling, beating each other, shouting and so á on. I felt disgusted especially because they treated each other á in such a degrading way.
label: disgust

label: shame

label: joy

text_A: When I wanted to go into a house, there was suddenly a big dog á standing beside me. It was hardly moving, but I did not know how á it would react later on.

label: sadness

label: joy

label: anger

text_A: When my boy-friend left me and I wanted to persuade him to stay.
label: shame

All the skills I had learnt from á PY 263 were thrown out the window when his indifference to my á protestation was obvious to me.
label: anger

text_A: While walking through an old mining area, I unwittingly disturbed á a wallaby which, in its resultant flight, accidentally fell down á a deep mine shaft. On investigation it seemed uninjured, but it á was impossible for the wallaby to get out, and also for me to get á it out of the shaft. To prevent its suffering a slow death, I á shot it.
label: sadness

text_A: A colleague and I were sitting on a bench next to an old man in a á shopping centre. the old man coughed and spluttered somewhat, á then with his fingers removed the resultant phlegm and mucous á from his mouth, and transferred it onto the armrest of the á bench.

text_A: On my birthday, when a very close friend sent me a huge bouquet á of flowers.
label: joy

label: shame

label: anger

text_A: When I thought that my high school love and I had a mutual á emotion.

The direction I was á drifting in was taking me straight over a reef on which rather á large sharks were constantly being caught. (I was alone with no á one to help me).

text_A: I was enjoying the company of bird life while I was eating lunch á in a park when a group of people began throwing sticks at some of á the birds - for no reason other than the satisfaction of seeing á them being scared away.
label: anger

text_A: When I left my sister's house after staying there for a few days. á She has two little boys, and they are very warm people (the á family). At the time, I was in need of this sort of contact, and á I grew very fond of children (no, I'm not a paedophiliac).
label: sadness

text_A: When my father revealed inconsistent morals.
label: disgust

text_A: Leaving home when my mother thought I had no reason to go and á felt that I was rejecting her. She is a constantly depressed á person (a bit of a worry-wort) and I felt guilty about having á given her this additonal problem.

text_A: I'd just got the top mark in an exam.
label: joy

text_A: I was at the corner shop, which I patronise regularly I had only á a $ 50 note and I purchased about $ 3 worth of goods that I á really needed - the keeper made sarcastic remarks to others about á people using him to cash notes.

text_A: My mother died of cancer after a 4 year illness - I think the á most pregnant moment of sadness was the next morning, just as the á sun rose.

text_A: I stole 5c from my mother's purse for a choo-choo bar - I was 6.

text_A: At rejection / being ignored by a loved person held in great á esteem.

text_A: When I was admitted to the Sofia University.

text_A: When my friend (girl) went abroad for two years.
label: sadness

text_A: When I happen to witness some sadistic acts.
label: disgust

text_A: When I have a plain appearance.
label: shame

text_A: When someone is accused or punished instead of me.
label: guilt

text_A: I was admitted to the University and a niece was born to me.
label: joy

text_A: I was bitten by a dog.
label: fear

text_A: I was alone at home on New Year's Eve.
label: sadness

text_A: I was on a walk with my child when I met a drunk woman.
label: disgust

text_A: I was unaware that I had walked the streets in torn trousers.
label: shame

text_A: Once I worked as a designer. A fitter was hard hit in a damage á that occurred at the building site I had designed.
label: guilt

text_A: My admittance to the University.
label: joy

text_A: A grenade blew out next to me.
label: fear

text_A: Unrealisation of the desired profession (aviator).
label: sadness

text_A: Disgust with a subordinate.
label: disgust

text_A: I lied to a friend.
label: shame

text_A: Friend's fiancT left her for me.
label: guilt

text_A: Winning Queensland Chess Championship.
label: joy

text_A: When in a car accident where car was total wipe off (wipe out, or á write off).
label: fear

text_A: Someone smoking on Electric train (Electric trains are á non-smoking) with alcohol smell coming from person.
label: disgust

text_A: When bathing at surf beach & lost togs.
label: shame

text_A: Promising someone to do their job and then not being able to do á it due to transport troubles.
label: guilt

text_A: Receiving a very personal letter from a lady that I like, which á revealed that she was more enthusiastic about me than I had á thought possible.
label: joy

text_A: Introducing myself at a first tutorial this year at University.
label: fear

text_A: I left my home in Melbourne to come to Q'land to study and before á I hopped in the car I hugged my mother and shook hands with my á father. Sensing immediately my father's sadness, I also had a á flood of the same emotion.
label: sadness

text_A: I felt something akin to shame after a heavy night of drinking, á along with waking up with a woman I had just met whose husband á was an epileptic. I was later to know that she knew my mother.
label: shame

text_A: Being in love for the first time.
label: joy

text_A: As a child - stepping on a rusty nail - being told that I might á get tetanus.
label: fear

text_A: As a child - having a dog - it getting a disease and dying.
label: sadness

text_A: Being in a Malaysian city with my girlfriend coming out of a á picture theatre - seeing her rush up to a taxi that a very old á sick man was trying to get to. Seeing her take over the taxi.
label: disgust

text_A: As a child - being sent to the shop by mother - buying some á chocolate - getting caught by mother.
label: shame

text_A: As a child - accidentally stepping on a pet guinea-pig - it á dying.
label: guilt

text_A: When I achieved my first 6 at University after a long string of á 3's, 4's and 5's (7 is the highest mark awarded, 3 is a conceded á pass).
label: joy

text_A: When a friend didn't invite her own parents to her Graduation á ceremony.
label: disgust

text_A: Saying something quite rude, but in jest, about a photograph of á someone, but it didn't quite turn out that way.
label: shame

text_A: When I was a child, my beloved cat gave birth to four beautiful á little kittens. Before she had them, she came up to me and I á followed her out, then witnessed them being born.
label: joy

text_A: On embarking on University life. I came from a different city and á did not know anybody at the Uni. I was frightened because my well á known and loved friends, also all my security had been taken á away.
label: fear

text_A: Because I was lazy and unthoughtful I did not get into contact á with a very close friend when she shifted from the Gold Coast to á Brisbane, for a month, despite her efforts to contact me. I felt á shamed when I finally confronted her again.
label: shame

text_A: When I felt I had let my parents down, especially my mother, by á having sexual intercourse for the first time, and a few times á after that. Also, when I went on the Pill.
label: guilt

text_A: The weekend after I argued with my parents I went home again and á they couldn't have been nicer. As soon as I walked in, Mum kissed á me, then Dad, and thanked me for the birthday presents I'd left á for him, including a very sentimental birthday card.
label: joy

text_A: My flatmate was asking questions about my relationship with my á boyfriend, whether I wasn't treating him as unfairly as I claimed á he'd been treating me. As a result, I was angered, and became á defensive.
label: anger

text_A: A very close friend from Victoria visited me over the holidays. á Having enjoyed his company immensely over 10 short days, I was á overwhelmed by sadness when he left to return to Victoria.á
label: sadness

text_A: One of my flatmates and I came back to the flat Monday morning, á to find a real Mess, left by the guy we share with.
label: disgust

text_A: Joy of giving birth, and of sharing that joy with my husband. á Moments of complete happiness and feelings of so much love.
label: joy

text_A: Attempted rape by 5 guys - held my arms behind my back and á molested me, constantly threatening to beat me. Penetration did á not occur as the driver of the car stopped that.
label: fear

text_A: When my son was diagnosed as having CEREBRAL PALSY, at age 5. He á would have to endure so much labelling, stigma and discrimination, á even though his case was relatively mild.
label: sadness

text_A: I have an adopted Aboriginal sister I felt disgust due to the á racism she has been subjected to.
label: disgust

text_A: When I decided my first marriage had ended, and left with the á child. I felt overwhelmed by guilt as I was separating mother and á child.
label: guilt

text_A: My mother left my father for his best friend, and he moved to á Papua New Guinea. Despite the fact that I am closer to my father á than to anyone else in my family, I had to move in with my á mother, and say good-bye to my father, not knowing when I would á see him again.
label: sadness

text_A: I recently became sexually involved with my sister's lover. I á care for him very much, but I am ashamed of the hurt I may cause á her.
label: shame

text_A: Finding myself alone in a public toilet block with a man known to á have had great psychological disturbances.
label: fear

text_A: Viewing the results of senseless vandalism to a local primary á school.
label: disgust

text_A: Inventing a fictitious series of events, as a result of which I á ended up in a conflict with my two closest friends.
label: guilt

text_A: When I finished my exams after 12th Grade, I was worried about á getting a T.E. Score high enough for Physiotherapy. When I found á that I had been accepted I was ecstatic, or more appropriately, á could jump for joy.
label: joy

text_A: When going for my driver's licence for the third time, because á everything, it seemed, hinged on getting it. I was really nervous, á and the testing Officer made me a little afraid as well. There á were lots of things to worry about. I passed however.
label: fear

text_A: When a so-called friend let me down, when she promised to tell me á when a certain concert was occurring, and that she'd get me á tickets. I was really looking forward to it. She did nothing, á just told me out of the blue one day what a fantastic concert it á was going to be.
label: anger

text_A: When I found out how the people of Ethiopia were starving and á their government was spending millions on celebrating being in á power so many years. Then I saw all these people on TV needing á food, etc.
label: disgust

text_A: I went to visit Montrose home for crippled children to interview á a handicapped child. I interviewed two boys and it went really á well. I promised I would visit them, but never got the time. Now I á hope they've forgotten me, but I feel ashamed of letting them á down.
label: shame

text_A: I was driving my parents' car into a carpark in front of a shop á we own, and scraped the corner of the front panel on the back á corner of my father's utility. I didn't tell anyone, I lied about á the bump (later I had to confess).
label: guilt

text_A: Two years ago, somebody I like very much wanted to give up his á studies. I tried to make him understand the importance of what he á was going to do, not only of the difficulty to find a job but also á because he will decrease his culture etc. This person made the á test to the college entrance examination and to our great joy we á found out that he succeded in entering at the University.
label: joy

text_A: One night, when I got out from the University I saw two strange á people near my car. When I got near, they moved away, and then á came close again. I had a feeling that they were assaulters. á After I left I discovered that the windshield was broken.
label: fear

text_A: I don't know why suddenly I thought that what I was feeling for á my boyfriend was not really love. After almost three years being á together, this matter of fact shaked me and I felt a great sorrow á that I can call sadness.
label: sadness

text_A: Returning home in the late afternoon I saw an indecent act made á by a man with the purpose that I saw it.
label: disgust

text_A: In a school parting we agreed to go to a restaurant. á We met at school and we separated us in several cars. My car á broke and we arrived late. All those who already had arrived á stand up and applauded us when we entered two hours late. á All the restaurant attention was turned on us.
label: shame

text_A: One night I and my friends went to the cemetery. We stopped the á car in front of the wall and suddenly the grave digger appeared á over the wall looking like a ghost. I was already afraid and á almost died.
label: fear

text_A: When my grandmother died.
label: sadness

text_A: I went to a restaurant with my boyfriend for dinner. There we saw á a couple. the man of the couple was a negro and he hadn't manners á for eat.
label: disgust

text_A: When the teacher asked me to read my composition that was the á homework I stood up and invented one because I hadn't done it. A á colleague saw that in my copy book there was nothing written and á he accused me and so I was called in the director's room.
label: shame

text_A: When I took away my best friend's boyfriend.
label: guilt

text_A: Crossing a street of several ways the cars began to move and I á thought that I was going to be trampled.
label: fear

text_A: I went to the school library and asked for a book, but the á librarian told me that there wasn't such. However when an other á colleague asked for it she gave it to him.
label: anger

text_A: A teacher giving a test was called by a student by his first á name. He (the teacher) said that he didn't give him this liberty.
label: disgust

text_A: One day in the intimity with my girlfriend I had an ejaculation.
label: shame

text_A: When I answered to my mother with rudeness.
label: guilt

text_A: The situation in which I felt happiest in my life was when á I was with the person I love for the first time.
label: joy

text_A: Fear of thief.
label: fear

text_A: I feel anger when somebody forbids me to do something.
label: anger

text_A: I felt sad when I was despised by another person.
label: sadness

text_A: I felt disgust of dirty.
label: disgust

text_A: Shame of not doing something well.
label: shame

text_A: I felt guilty when I couldn't help a person.
label: guilt

text_A: When I got through the examination for my driver licence, and á when I finished I knew I had passed it.
label: joy

text_A: I was inside the car with my husband and we were assaulted with a á gun at 10 o'clock in the evening.
label: fear

text_A: I couldn't sleep, and began to remind of my childhood. We are many á sisters and at that time we were spanked a lot and I don't know á why I started to remind of the spanks they and I had had, their á shouts when this happened.
label: sadness

text_A: When I red a report in the magazine VESA about an Iranian telling á what she had lived in the prisons in Iran. I felt disgust about á that people.
label: disgust

text_A: I was in ILHA GRANDE with a wonderful sun, with wonderful people, á with a wonderful sea, with a wonderful boy.
label: joy

text_A: When I was looking for a job I felt a lot of fear but the fear á was greater when I found it.
label: fear

text_A: When I applied for the college entrance examination to FUVEST, á and I wasn't approved in the second fase.
label: sadness

text_A: I had this feeling when I met a girl, not that she was dirty but á she was to \fresh\", dump and childish."
label: disgust

text_A: I was very fat, and was ashamed of my body.
label: shame

text_A: I felt happy when my mother borrowed me the car in order to let á me go out alone for the first time.
label: joy

text_A: It happened when I lost two very intimate friends in a car á accident.
label: sadness

text_A: I felt disgust of my father when I knew he had a lover.
label: disgust

text_A: When my mother found out that I smoke maryhuana.
label: shame

text_A: When there is danger nearby.
label: fear

text_A: When I couldn't go for a trip with my friends in a holiday.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was curious about it and went to a spiritism session with a á friend. I had already been there other times (many times when I á was younger) but that day, even if I don't believe in á spiritism I was terribly afraid that something would happen to me á (sort of incorporation !).
label: fear

text_A: When they denied a job to a person that I propsed giving political á reasons that has nothing to do directly with the professional á level.
label: anger

text_A: When my friends and I were camping in a weekend, and with little á food, we met a middle age couple from a small town that invited á us to eat in their house. Their house was small, badly built with á old and dirty forniture and utensils. The problem was with pans, á and dishes, and even the food.
label: disgust

text_A: When I went to meet the family of my boyfriend in a party in his á house. His mother was eager to know me and all his friends ready á to make jokes about the situation.
label: shame

text_A: When I met another person I began to go out with him, and my á boyfriend (with marriage accorded) met us together he did a great á scandal, he broke the engagement and I began to go out with the á other, and it didn't work because my mind was all mixed up.
label: guilt

text_A: When I got a wedding ring of diamond from the boy I loved.
label: joy

text_A: When I became conscious that men don't wnat anything they don't á have a goal. They have: sex, but this isn't important.
label: sadness

text_A: When I went in a clinical hospital and saw in what conditions á people are attended there.
label: disgust

text_A: When I met again a great friend and talked a little while with á him. When I see again another I miss.
label: joy

text_A: I feel afraid of the way a great friend looks at me, and also a á little afraid of the directions that it's going.
label: fear

text_A: I felt shame when I had to talk with a person that I hadn't seen for á many years. Shame that he wouldn't recognize me or that I á wouldn't know what to say.
label: shame

text_A: When I wished secretly and lied to a friend of mine because I á didn't want her to stay in my house on the beach (as she always á does), and wouldn't stick on me.
label: guilt

text_A: When I entered University.
label: joy

text_A: I have been afraid several times. What marked me was that I á almost didn't enter University.
label: fear

text_A: I'm crazy about football. When my team lost a goal in the Paulist á championship, and so it lost the classifications.
label: anger

text_A: When my grandmother, my second mother died.
label: sadness

text_A: When a girl that I liked didn't accept my curting.
label: disgust

text_A: When I had my first sexual relation and it didn't work.
label: shame

text_A: I met a girl (22 years old), married. I liked her. I asked her á for a date and I kissed her. I discovered that she lived nearby á where I passed every day. I got amused thinking that her husband á would be ... or me . I didn't talked to her anymore.
label: disgust

text_A: About the girl (22 years, married) I felt guilty of the á relationship.
label: guilt

text_A: I felt joy when I red my name in the list of the approved in the á entrance college examination.
label: joy

text_A: I was visiting my parents in law when the house was invaded by á three strange men, and they committed an armed assault.
label: fear

text_A: To have a friend who I didn't see for months, and under the á circumstances that I met him made me feel happy, and perhaps á because it has been one of the good things that I learned with á this friend.
label: joy

text_A: The fact that I hadn't been informed about something and I had the á greatest trust in this person.
label: anger

text_A: In contact with a poor family of northeast it was offered to me a á crab to eat at my request. But the fact that this crab was á prepared antihygienically and his appearence was also á antihygienically it caused me disgust but I ate it anyway.
label: disgust

text_A: When, after a long time of searching I got my first job.
label: joy

text_A: After some time of work I was transferred to another place and in á an other quite harder job.
label: fear

text_A: When I used to go to my chief asking about any doubt about the job á and he didn't care, didn't answer me, leaving me speaking alone.
label: anger

text_A: When I knew that a person that I liked very much didn't react the á way I would like to, even that I knew about his feelings for me.
label: sadness

text_A: When I knew that a person who I didn't like, had about me other á feelings.
label: disgust

text_A: After lot of explanation, to fail in my work.
label: shame

text_A: My brother and I were at home watching a TV program when I á started to tease  him and in this joke I hurt him without á knowing the seriousness of it I went on. He got angry and gave it á back to me. At this moment I felt anger at him but knowing that á it was my fault.
label: guilt

text_A: When a person that I like very much got near to me.
label: joy

text_A: When a person is privileged in account of situations that are á unjust, and disloyal to colleagues and friends.
label: anger

text_A: When I was betrayed by a friend, and decided to stay apart form á her.
label: sadness

text_A: After a serie of facts that occurred between a colleague and me I á started to feel a certain necessity to get apart and I didn't want á to see her anymore.
label: disgust

text_A: I went to study in a public library but I didn't know it well. I á got a book and wanted to study hearing music. Then I went to a á place were I could do it, but when I passed by a door a bell rang á and a man came saying that I couldn't leave with the book.
label: shame

text_A: I broke the gutar of a colleague but as it happened in a moment á when nobody was present I could escape from the guilt.
label: guilt

text_A: I made the college entrance examinations for P.U.C. It was what I á wanted more. When the first list came out I got frustrated. I á wasn't in. When the second list came out without hopes I started á to read the newspaper and my name was thre. I was in the bus and á felt like crying so that everybody could hear me. The cry was hold, á and 1982 became forever a mask in my life.
label: joy

text_A: Once in my work it happened a fight between the person in charge and me. I á got so angry and spoke out everything I felt at the moment.
label: anger

text_A: I remember the day my father died. I was 11 years old and my á sadness was so great that until today I remember everything á about that day, from the clothes I was wearing to the reactions of people, á the despair of my mother and brother. It marked me a lot and was á the greatest sadness I felt.
label: sadness

text_A: The day I received the key of my apartment and we could enter in á it, for my fiancT and I had bought it yet in plans, and it seemed á to us that this was almost impossible to happen.
label: joy

text_A: I had a driver licence but I didn't drive for a long time, than I á started to drive again, and had to get into hard transit and á highways.
label: fear

text_A: When my boss cut off my vacations saying that in that month it á wouldn't be possible, and after some time he let another girl á take vacations that month. The anger was because of the á resentment. Resulting from our bad relationship.
label: anger

text_A: My fiancT's family was adopting a 5 years old boy. I felt á myself close to him as I never felt before. After some time his á mother demanded the care of the kid and we were obliged to send á him back.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was dreaming that I was being chased, in the upmost of á horror the door of the closed felt down synchronicaly with the á dream scare.
label: fear

text_A: When my mother slapped me in the face, I felt anger at that á moment.
label: anger

text_A: When I had to act alone a character for a public (40 people).
label: shame

text_A: When I woke up in the middle of the night because of a dream, it á wasn't a nightmare, it was an uninteligible dream in wich I woke á because of a certain end.
label: fear

text_A: When I try to get closer at a person and she misinterpreted me.
label: sadness

text_A: When I felt the smell of industries that pollute.
label: disgust

text_A: When I unjustly accused a person of my family of something she á didn't really do.
label: guilt

text_A: I was travelling in the South of Brasil, near the end of the á year. I was well settled with 3 friends. At the evening of 31 M., á somebody, also with us, took from his purse pints of all colours, á and the 4 of us, and other friends, that were at the same beach, á painted each other and we went to the beach with champagne.
label: joy

text_A: I was walking from my friend's house, a few blocks from my house, when a á car began to follow me. He waited I passed by it rotateed a little and á stopped on my way. I changed completely my way and the car went á on following me until I turned at a corner and running I hid in a á garden of a house, waiting for the car to pass by. I went back home á terribly afraid.
label: fear

text_A: One day I lent my tennis I just had washed to my sister because á she asked it. I asked her not to soil it as I had just washed it. á Next day I looked at the tennis, and it was dirty with wax. She á could not have soiled it. It was lack of consideration. I felt á very angry.
label: anger

text_A: The second time I went to the entrance exam to V.S.P. and á didn't get approved.
label: sadness

text_A: I was travelling, we were 15 person, one of them I met at the á travel and didn't like her. One night I was asleep while she and á her friends were talking too loud in the kitchen. I got up to ask for á silence and since that day I felt constant disgust for her.
label: disgust
