text_A: I had a date with a boy, but I didn't feel liked, and didn't go, á I wasn't home purposely at the time we arranged.
label: guilt

text_A: I felt afraid of losing somebody I love to another person because á I was an incomprehensive person and lots of time I fight with á this person.
label: fear

text_A: In certain occasion I have a fight with my boyfriend. During the á fight I closed the door at his face. He went away but came back á next day.
label: anger

text_A: Last year, when I took the college entrance examinations I á failed the FUVEST. It was for me the most frustrating situation á because I had studied all year long, and only thought about this.
label: sadness

text_A: In a certain occasion I saw a dog in the street eating something á so strange gooey that I wasn't able to eat lunch because I á remembered the scene all the time.
label: disgust

text_A: I had never made a malicious joke in front of my boyfriend. Last á week I did it I was funny, he loved it, and I died of shame.
label: shame

text_A: When my parents fight lots of time, when I'm the reason of the á fight, I feel guilty.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was just to be divorced.
label: fear

text_A: My mother in law slept in my bed.
label: anger

text_A: In the last year of the high school we had a huge fight between á my group and the graduation commission (two students of my á classroom) because they accused us unjustly of a gossip about á them.
label: anger

text_A: When I was 10/11 years old my father travelled very much for his á work (he passed three months away from home).
label: sadness

text_A: I saw a film where snakes were crawling everywhere. I felt them á crawling over all my body with that ... skins. The noise that á they did disturbed me very much.
label: disgust

text_A: In a play (secret friend) during the time of the high school I á had to give a present to a boy and I was very ridiculous because á of this.
label: shame

text_A: When I was a child I used to play with my cousin gushing wather á to each other in front of the door of my house. One day we á decided to gush with on a passing car. The driver stopped and á went to discuss with my mother and my aunt that were there.
label: guilt

text_A: When I got a small present form a person I like very much.
label: joy

text_A: When a friend of mine discussed with me, I felt fear of losing á her. This occurred because we had a missunderstanding between á mutual colleagues.
label: fear

text_A: When a boy tried to fool me so he would be OK trying to show me á that he is a gook boy.
label: anger

text_A: When my oldest sister discovered that her boyfriend had another á girl.
label: disgust

text_A: We where in a bar and my friend had a fight with some guys who á were in the table aside.
label: shame

text_A: When I deny something to my sister and after a while I feel sorry á and try to bypass the situation.
label: guilt

text_A: When my father died I felt myself alone and the fear possessed me. á I was a child and all my sisters and brothers (8) were young.
label: fear

text_A: I loved a person and he went away. It wasn't necessary that he á left me to reach his goals.
label: anger

text_A: A close friend travelled to another country. When I knew that he á would only come back after many years, I felt very sad.
label: sadness

text_A: When I watched a film about the problems of abandoned children á (PIXOTE).
label: disgust

text_A: The day I decided to get out of my house I saw in my brother's á eyes that they blamed me for the situaiton.
label: guilt

text_A: I had a friend who I didn't see for a long time. We had a á relationship from much union and interaction. It was more that á one year that I didn't see her. She appeared in my home and we á talked.
label: joy

text_A: I had parked in a corner, and when I was going out I didn't watch á if another car was coming and went out. The car that was coming á was obliged to stop suddenly. It didn't crash but for a little.
label: guilt

text_A: Once when I crossed the street, and was nearly trampled by a car.
label: fear

text_A: A girl entered in the division where I work and greeted everybody á but not me.
label: anger

text_A: A dear friend was removed from the division whre I work.
label: sadness

text_A: When somebody despised a friend of mine.
label: disgust

text_A: When I slapped a nephew who did something that I considered á wrong, and I was reprehended for this.
label: guilt

text_A: I wanted to go out to walk but I didn't know either where or á with whom, suddenly an invitation appeared.
label: joy

text_A: Passing (by car) over a bridge where only one car could pass. There á was a precipice on both sides, no protection grilles, and the á bridge was completely muddled.
label: fear

text_A: When my chief accused me of an error that I hadn't made.
label: anger

text_A: When a group of friends began to make critics about me.
label: shame

text_A: I felt a great joy when I knew that my father was going to sell á the apartment from GUARUSA, because in some way we were helded by á it, that means that we didn't go to any other place, because we á had the apartment.
label: joy

text_A: I felt disgust about all my friends. After having done a great á effort to organize an evening together, and didn't work out, they á put the blame on me. After this, I feel disgust towards those that á blame me.
label: disgust

text_A: I feel ashamed every time that someone makes me a positive or á negative critic.
label: shame

text_A: Yesterday I broke my sister's raio. She hears it always when she á has school examinations and now she has examinations.
label: guilt

text_A: The week before I entered to army, when we were being selected. á During 5 days I had to pass 10 hours a day waiting for the á answer, which at last was the worst. The fear of being convoked, á of hearing the fated phrase, was constant.
label: fear

text_A: When I was misleaded by a person who assured that something would á not occur, that I had no reason to prepccupy myself, and suddenly á I saw myself implicated by the fact, because of the incompetence, á and irresponsibility of that person.
label: anger

text_A: When I didn't succeed to enter at the University, I felt that the á college entrance course sistem prejudiced me, that my integrity, á and effort weren't corresponded.
label: sadness

text_A: When I had to plunge in a swamp of fetid and stagnant water.
label: disgust

text_A: When in the initial interview for the recruiting, I don't know why, á I accepted to do the test for army.
label: guilt

text_A: When my boyfriend was changing his behavior there was something á wrong, I felt sad, because it's desagreable when a relationship á is ending.
label: sadness

text_A: I felt disgust when I realized that I had eaten something fatty, á and vomited too much.
label: disgust

text_A: When I realized that my bathing suit was spotted, I had became á menstruated.
label: shame

text_A: When I saw a horror film.
label: fear

text_A: When my sister took something that belonged to me without my á permission.
label: anger

text_A: When I fell down.
label: shame

text_A: I lost a conference because I hadn't got in touch with a certain á person to inform her that I would go with her. I thought she knew á what I wanted.
label: guilt

text_A: After making an effort to enter at University I found a course á and a school of higher education which were compatible with my á experience and potentiality.
label: joy

text_A: Seeing persons spending money in a shopping center with á completely indifference to the misery reigning in our country.
label: disgust

text_A: I felt ashamed to be Brazilian and to live under a military á dictatorship that despoiled the people, when during my military á service.
label: shame

text_A: Facing the possibility of having a child when it wasn't either á desired or permitted.
label: guilt

text_A: I felt joy when I passed the worst phase in my life and á discovered how many people considered me important to them.
label: joy

text_A: I felt fear some months ago of losing the person whom I loved á when she said to me that she didn't love me.
label: fear

text_A: I felt much anger and perhaps I feel it till now, against my á girlfriend's sister who incited her to betray me just when I á needed her very much. She didn't think of anything, simply á passed over everything.
label: anger

text_A: When my dog died.
label: sadness

text_A: I felt ashamed of feeling sorry about myself when I passed á through the situation of being betrayed by my girlfriend.
label: shame

text_A: I didn't like my former fob and felt joy when I received a á telegram offering me a new one that I though better and for which á I had been waiting.
label: joy

text_A: I was in a train where a fight occurred. One person who was there á opened his handbag and took out a gun, another who fought too á looked among his things for a weapon to fight.
label: fear

text_A: I felt disgust when I saw a dead animal on the roadway.
label: disgust

text_A: I was in a bus with my school material when I fell and sat on the á lap of another passenger.
label: shame

text_A: The day that my boyfriend appeared at home with a pair of rings á for our wedding.
label: joy

text_A: One day I was near home, kissing my boyfriend in a car when my á mother appeared and asked me to go home, because she didn't know á about the event.
label: fear

text_A: A ex-boyfriend tried to prejudice me before my fiancT and his á family saying things about me that let his family worried. We had á to postpone our wedding and we were already using our wedding á rings. To be honest I didn't feel just anger, I felt hate.
label: anger

text_A: The day that the results of the college entrance examinations for á the S. Paulo University were published and I didn't find my name á on the list. Entering this University was my greatest wish, and  á the fact of not having succeded caused a great frustration, and á not only sadness.
label: sadness

text_A: The day my boyfriend saw and touched my breasts when I was á without my shirt, only with my pants.
label: shame

text_A: When I needed another job and tought that a good and known person á (my employer) could help me. He simply said that he couldn't help á me.
label: disgust

text_A: One of my pupils escaped from school to the street.
label: guilt

text_A: My grandmother is a highly authoritative person, who lives alone, á is independent, but doesn't know to live without commanding the á others. I hate this!
label: anger

text_A: I am always sad when my boyfriend goes away. He lives and studies á in an other city. We have gone steady for 2 and 1/2 years and á everything is going very well, but sometime this situation makes á me feel bad and very lonely.
label: sadness

text_A: I felt disgust when I kissed a guy that I know. I was on the outs á with my boyfriend and this person appeared but he has nothing to á do with me.
label: disgust

text_A: I felt ashamed of my body in spite of knowing that it is more or á less beautiful and also knowing that my boyfriend considers me á beautiful, but this was only in the beginning.
label: shame

text_A: I always feel guilty when I see my mother sad or fed up with á life. I really dont know the reason.
label: guilt

text_A: When I bought my car.
label: joy

text_A: When I had a serious argument with a dear person.
label: anger

text_A: I should have given a test lesson to get a job. I had no courage. á I didn't make the test.
label: fear

text_A: When my grandmother died.
label: sadness

text_A: When a friend of mine visited me and my house was in a mess.
label: shame

text_A: My daughter was a baby and was crying to be taken on my lap. I á felt very nervous and moved her away and went out. As soon as the á feeling of nervousness passed I was taken by an enormous feeling á of guilt, for having rejected my daughter.
label: guilt

text_A: I was in the dark room, it's insecure and has holes covered with á wooden sheets in the roof the establishment had already been á assaulted and could be assaulted again.
label: fear

text_A: One day I heard from a friend that the boy I loved had gone out á with her and not with me.
label: sadness

text_A: I saw a magazine with photographs of dead and maimed people whose á limbs were separated from their body like a head on one side and á the leg on the other.
label: disgust

text_A: The greatest guilt I felt and I didn't know if it was really á justified is that when I was a child I had a brother very close á to me. He  became ill, and asked me to see  him in the hospital. á I didn't go, when his situation became worse in the U.I.T. (Unity á of intensive therapy) I went and he died.
label: guilt

text_A: One of the greatest joiy was when I succeded in acquiring a á motorcycle through my own efforts.
label: joy

text_A: I'm afraid of driving on the special seat of a mororcycle, mainly á with certain colleagues who by exces of self-confidence drive á beyond limits or measure in the traffic and the main victim is á always the person who sits behind the driver.
label: fear

text_A: I felt much anger when my fahter interferred in my relations with á another person whom I liked very much, ending something that I á adored.
label: anger

text_A: One of the greatest sadness was when my grandfather died, because á I loved him very much.
label: sadness

text_A: My main disgust is against codfish because I detest even the á smell of it.
label: disgust

text_A: The only guilt I considered reasonable was my reproval at the end á of the semester at the University.
label: guilt

text_A: That someone would discover whom I really love.
label: fear

text_A: When a colleague was rude with me because she didn't understand á the subject about which I was discussing.
label: anger

text_A: For not having succeded in getting the job as a translator that I á wanted.
label: sadness

text_A: When there was a fight at home and my father threatened to throw á a chair on my brother.
label: fear

text_A: I felt anger against a person who told bad things about me in my á absence.
label: anger

text_A: After a disagreement between my parents, when I was alone with my á father and my sister, the aggression continued, when my father á tried to put me and my sister against my mother revealing facts á that had happened in the past like a talk between my father and á his mother in law where she told him that my mother was not quite á save.
label: sadness

text_A: When I provoked a fight with my mother, hurting her feelings very á much.
label: guilt

text_A: I was in the living room at home with an ex-boyfriend, it was á nearly a year that we had separated, during the talk he began to á remember our courting and gave me a long kiss.
label: joy

text_A: I was with a friend in a stationed car when, suddenly a man á appeared on my side and an other with a gun on his side the á hold-up lasted a few minutes but it was terrible. I had never á seen a gun so close.
label: fear

text_A: I was watching television. It was about midnight when a very dear á friend called saying that his father had died in an accident.
label: sadness

text_A: This feeling comes frequently when I go out at night and tell my á mother that I shall come back early. But then I get home a 5 or 6 a.m.
label: guilt

text_A: When I and the person mentioned above had a suspicion of á pregnancy.
label: fear

text_A: When I heard the bad news about the death of a close person.
label: disgust

text_A: When I tried to hide a fact from a person for irrelevant reasons á and considered such an attitude childish.
label: shame

text_A: It happens sometimes in connection with certain persons with whom á I have frequent relationships but nothing special.
label: guilt

text_A: When I entered in the University after a year of struggles.
label: joy

text_A: In the University we were convoked to a stroll like a freshman I á was still innocent about the manipulation. On seeing the goal of á the exaltation to poor character people, I felt anger on feeling á myself mass of maneuver.
label: anger

text_A: In a social situation I became interested in a woman. We talked, á we laughed, we enjoyed each other. She desappeared for a few á minutes, and a little after appeared with an other man.
label: sadness

text_A: A friend of mine travelled very far. I miss her but feel joy too á because fer life is taking the right direction as she wants. So I á feel joy for her mainly.
label: joy

text_A: When I met my mother after months of absence.
label: joy

text_A: When I felt lack of aid from close friends.
label: sadness

text_A: When I saw a fight I had a physical reaction of disgust and of á deep perturbation.
label: disgust

text_A: Walking on the street passing by an air duct, my skirt went up.
label: shame

text_A: Being disloyal with persons I loved.
label: guilt

text_A: I got a present from a great friend (a dog).
label: joy

text_A: There was a scene of shooting in front of my house, I was very á afraid. Two armed men confronting. I didn't discover the reason á of the incident.
label: fear

text_A: I didn't get the job I wanted.
label: sadness

text_A: I went to eat at my aunt's house and she served macaroni with a á horrible appearence. I felt the sensation above. The worst was á that I was practically obliged to eat.
label: disgust

text_A: When I saw my father coming out of the bathroom. He thought that á he was alone at home and came out without his clothes.
label: shame

text_A: When I misled a person: I said that I would do her a á favour and didn't.
label: guilt

text_A: When I can see my parents because now I am far from them.
label: joy

text_A: When I sit for examinations.
label: fear

text_A: Once, during a performance I did not sing the way I had to.
label: anger

text_A: When I got separated from the woman I loved.
label: sadness

text_A: When the Americans set their nucleaar missiles in Europe.
label: disgust

text_A: When I don't say the truth, when I don't do a certain thing á thanks to my laziness.
label: shame

text_A: Once I promised to do something but I didn't do it.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was admitted to the Bulgarian State Conservatoire.
label: joy

text_A: Shame I feel when I am not properly dressed.
label: shame

text_A: Getting separated from my family for a week caused me a sense of á sadness.
label: sadness

text_A: I felt joy most strongly some years ago, when I took part in a á NH Competition and I was the first.
label: joy

text_A: I feel fear when I only imagine I could lose confidence in my own á abilities and powers. A similar feeling I feel sometimes before á an exam.
label: fear

text_A: I feel sadness when I only imagine that I could lose a close á person. Some time ago I lost a man whom aI greatly respected.
label: sadness

text_A: I felt guilty because of the pain I caused to a very close á friend. But over the feeling of guilt, my conviction of being á right dominated.
label: guilt

text_A: When my nephew was born. The birth was hard, it was a big baby.
label: joy

text_A: Late one night I was pursued by gipsies who had no good á intentions.
label: fear

text_A: My brother accused me undeservedly before my parents. I was not á guilty. He was misled by his wife.
label: anger

text_A: When I left my boyfriend. I found another girl at his home but he á did nothing to relieve the situation.
label: sadness

text_A: I found a big black beetle in my coffee cup. It was alive big and á it was moving its limbs.
label: disgust

text_A: When I had to prepare and read a paper to my fellow students but á I didn't cope with the task.
label: shame

text_A: I was crossing the street together with some colleagues of mine á when I suddenly found myself almost under the wheels of a truck.
label: fear

text_A: Someone stole my ski at Vitosha and of course I was the one to be á blamed. I left them without supervision.
label: anger

text_A: A drunk man had fallen in the street and he was shouting obscene á words.
label: disgust

text_A: I had borrowed some money and I exceeded the time-limit.
label: shame

text_A: I woke up in the middle of the night of a nightmare, I was alone, á it was very quiet and very dark.
label: fear

text_A: A shop-assistant behaved rather roughly with me though she hadn't á the slightest grounds for it.
label: anger

text_A: I saw a friend of mine who had suffered a very heavy contusion á after an accident.
label: sadness

text_A: I was made a very sharp remark at a rehearsal.
label: shame

text_A: I couldn't fulfill a request of a girlfriend of mine, though I á categorically promised her and I believed there wouldn't be any á hindrance. It was partly for objective reasons but also because á I couldn't organize myself.
label: guilt

text_A: At a success of mine, at a real achievement.
label: joy

text_A: I put on a lot of weight in a few months and every time I met á someone I knew would avoid them, usually by hiding because my á self image was low and I was ashamed of what I had done to á myself.
label: shame

text_A: For the first time in my life telling someone I loved them.
label: joy

text_A: When my mother decided to clean out my room and throw out what á she thought was junk, without my knowing about it, so I returned á home to find half my stuff gone.
label: anger

text_A: When I couldn't find my dog which was missing.
label: sadness

text_A: I was disgusted with a friend's behaviour when she got absolutely á drunk so that she vomitted all over my house.
label: disgust

text_A: I was taking place in an anti nuclear protest and was shouting á protest loudly to some American sailors of the U.S. Texas á submarine. A guy came up to me and said that's your brother á screaming at, I felt shame and I realized screaming at another á person isn't good protesting. Now I'm a silent protester.
label: shame

text_A: I felt guilty after getting really angry with a friend and having á an argument. I was being stubborn and proud, and selfish, because á my friend let me down, through no fault of her own.
label: guilt

text_A: When I hurt my parents in one way or another.
label: guilt

text_A: When I nearly caused a traffic accident with my car.
label: fear

text_A: When playing a football match, there was one player who made mean á tackels, kicked at everything and did things having nothing to do á with football.
label: anger

text_A: A close friend decided to stop with his study and to go back á home.
label: sadness

text_A: We had a birthday party with 5 friends. One of us frequently used á hard drugs. On the party I discovered that the other 3 friends á also used them. While we agreed we would help the big user to á stop using it.
label: disgust

text_A: For instance when a girl is interested in me and likes me.
label: joy

text_A: I felt dusgust with a self-iterested person who ruined the life á of another by means of utterly unfair methods.
label: disgust

text_A: I didn't do an important job and it had an adverse effect on á other people.
label: shame

text_A: I felt fear when my mother was heavily ill.
label: fear

text_A: I felt anger against a colleague of mine during a rehearsal in á acting. He hadn't learnt the text of an opera act in the course of á several months and thus making difficulties for the rest of my á colleagues.
label: anger

text_A: I felt disgust with the alcohol, after I happened to see a young á man, who was dead to the world and who wallowed on the pavement. á This \sight\" I watched from the bus."
label: disgust

text_A: I felt shame and I couldn't look into my teacher's eyes, after á not attending his lectures.
label: shame

text_A: I felt it at the same time when I felt disgust.
label: fear

text_A: My living and working conditions at home were unbearable. We used á to live in a three room flat together with two more families. The á discords caused a change - one of the families moved out. The á other family stayed with us but I drifted away from my fiancT. In á fact we were two families in the flat. Then I found myself alone á in the struggle for this life because my fiancT did not stay next á to me my grief and sorrow took on large proportions. I wanted to á commit suicide but instead I threw myself against the cause of á the irritation.
label: sadness

text_A: I feel shame mixed with anger with the behavior of some á incultivated people because my fiancT is a foreigner.
label: shame

text_A: I experienced this feeling when the doctors found a nodule in one á of my mother's breasts. It turned out to be an occlusion á resulting from continious sucking but for a few days I was not in my á reason.
label: fear

text_A: I felt disgust with a man I had trusted and respected, to whose á problems I had always shown deep understanding.
label: disgust

text_A: My boyfriend made me a proposal.
label: joy

text_A: A whole crowd of us went to a folklore festival. The instructor á of the cast where my boyfriend played was traveling with us. We á decided to catch the train that leaved early in the morning á because we had business on the following day. The instructor á tried to get the upper hand and made us catch the train in spite á of everything, all the time he made me angry.
label: anger

text_A: When I quarrelled with my boyfriend.
label: sadness

text_A: I am disgusted with the fact that bad singers play at the opera á (and not only there) only because they are protegTs or lovers of á an important felow while at the same time some young and able á singers work in a quite different field of life.
label: disgust

text_A: I feel shy to show all my worth when I work for the first time á with a conductor or a producer unfamiliar to me.
label: shame

text_A: I offended my mother.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was admitted to a Language school. On the day when I was á informed by a message and my parents congratulated me.
label: joy

text_A: When my friend (girl) promised to help me go to the hospital and be á examined by good experts and she deceived me.
label: anger

text_A: When I had stayed abroad for a long time and I had remembered á about my friends and relatives. I felt sad and I wanted to see á them as soon as possible.
label: sadness

text_A: I felt it when I saw our headmaster blushed ingratiating himself á with high ranking officials.
label: disgust

text_A: When I shouted and quarrelled and for no reason I had been rude to my á mother and when my behaviour had been influenced by other outward á factors.
label: guilt

text_A: When you are satisfied with something, when you achieve something á you have striven to.
label: joy

text_A: When you are unjustly assessed at something you are sure to have á been right.
label: anger

text_A: For the loss of a close friend or relative, but you feel grief á when you are away from home, too.
label: sadness

text_A: They wanted something to happen but I didn't.
label: anger

text_A: I couldn't be with a girl on whom I was very keen.
label: sadness

text_A: My first girlfriend. I had the feeling that she was going out á with me only because of my defect.
label: shame

text_A: Having passed an exam.
label: joy

text_A: Having a car accident.
label: fear

text_A: I shared a secret with a friend and it later turned out that he á had revealed it to another person with whom I didn't get along very well.
label: anger

text_A: The loss of a very good friend.
label: sadness

text_A: Adultery with a friend's girlfriend.
label: guilt

text_A: I felt it when I sat for my exam in anatomy.
label: fear

text_A: I experience that feeling when I am unsulted without deserving á it or when someone deceives me.
label: anger

text_A: When my grandfather died.
label: sadness

text_A: When I do something unworthy.
label: shame

text_A: When I offended my parents without wanting it.
label: guilt

text_A: After each successfully passed exam I am happy.
label: joy

text_A: A friend of mine gave birth to a child. Very dangerous delivery. á I was afraid for her and for the baby.
label: fear

text_A: My brother is a soldier. He promised to come home in a furlough á but in the last moment he phoned and said that he could not come.
label: sadness

text_A: I am disgusted with liers, hypocrites, slanderers, flunkeys.
label: disgust

text_A: Recently I saw a young girl fawning on a man. And what for - á money and things. I was ashamed to be a woman.
label: shame

text_A: After the term exams I happened to meet a person that I respect á and of whom I think very highly. It was nice that although we see á each other rarely he had not forgotten me.
label: joy

text_A: I stayed for several weeks with a friend of mine before she moved á to live with her husband. One evening he came drunk and made an á awful scene, which I still remember.
label: disgust

text_A: In the past I experienced this feeling almost all the time - á wherever I went, in different sutuations. I was small and I had á to be taken to kindergarten, but me the fool didn't dare to tell á exactly where, finally as a result I was late.
label: shame

text_A: In the real sense of the word I experienced fear in my first á months in the army. During my first night of duty. The cause for á all this was a bear. I became panic sticken (may be for the first á time) and even forgot that I had a gun.
label: fear

text_A: When I was a soldier I quarrelled with my commander and may be in á revenge for this he detailed me on duty two successive nights. á Naturally he checked me up on the second night and found me á asleep for which he sent me to the cells.
label: anger

text_A: Sometimes I experience sadness for the Sports High School and for á my unrealized dreams in the sport. Anyway there I spent six years á of my life.
label: sadness

text_A: In my 20s - and was going out to dinner to celebrate a friend's á birthday. Her (older - in 30s) cousin, really wanted me to get á drunk cos I'd visited their (cousin & wife) place quite a bit, á but had always been very careful - brought up to believe in á moderation in drink (but not guilt repression etc). I mixed á drinking with smoking (which I rarely did) and got drunk and had á to leave the table to get sick in the loo, and later went home á and was sick again; have never felt so awful in my life. And I á didn't want to face or tell my other flatmates, or family.
label: shame

text_A: Can think of no time that I have felt fear.
label: fear

text_A: Teenage neighbours smashed my letterbox for the fifth time in a á couple of months. It was a deliberate action of kids who had á stayed in my home, had meals there yet took a dislike to my á daughter.
label: anger

text_A: Guy I cared for went back to Canada to live.
label: sadness

text_A: Bus driver driving roughly - old man fell off seat into aisle - á driver wouldn't stop - disgusted with her behaviour.
label: disgust

text_A: Reported neighbour to police for taking to my daughter with á baseball ball - her counsellor rang me and after long talk á convinced me the woman was o.k. I felt guilty for ringing the á police then guilty for feeling guilty about it.
label: guilt

text_A: I was in the Korean War. We were attacked with mortars, me and á companion. We stopped the jeep and ran for cover. Fortunately á neither of us was hit but we both came close to being killed.
label: fear

text_A: I've a situation of responsibility an employee who had a habit of á being late, came late again after promising to say he would be at á work in a few minutes, then arrived 3 hours later. He had been á drinking.
label: anger

text_A: Disgust at myself when I stroked a sleeping girl's private parts.
label: disgust

text_A: My son was apprehended for shoplifting at the age of 14. Because á I too had been apprehended at the same age I felt the shame of á not having been able to prevent my son from acting in the same á way.
label: shame

text_A: I removed an article of clothing belonging to my employer while á in a position of trust.
label: guilt

text_A: When we took out an 84 year old woman for the evening and had á hamburgers. She described the evening out as her happiest night á out in 20 years.
label: joy

text_A: While tramping on a narrow path two of us were confronted by a á woman with two snarling dogs, demanding we get off the property - á via a flooded river !
label: fear

text_A: A boy I look after for the probation service deliberately á offended to provoke a reaction from the police.
label: sadness

text_A: A young visitor to the house stole money from an elderly á visitor's purse. It wasn't noticed for some hours.
label: shame

text_A: I had to leave an important function early because of family á commitments. Someone else had to complete my job.
label: guilt

text_A: I was attacked, standing in a doorway, by a pack of 5 dogs, á alsatians and farm dogs with my escape route blocked by a shut á fence.
label: fear

text_A: In the house where I live there is a new flatmate. His friends á unfortunately are the dirt of society, intelligent, fashonable, á rich and bored. At a party recently they were doing things I á didn't like done in my house. I felt angry at them.
label: anger

text_A: I was driving near my girlfriend's house and I decided to keep á going because it was late and I would be back in the next few á days anyway. The next day she was killed in a road accident.
label: sadness

text_A: A good friend of mine told me in comfidence that once he had á tried to commit suicide. To meet him you wouldn't think so. I á told another friend of mine about this when she was feeling á depressed about her twin brother's suicide. I broke a bond of á confidentiality.
label: shame

text_A: When I found out that a set task (i.e. 2 essays and a test), the á thought of which had oppressed me, were not on the date I had á thought.
label: joy

text_A: When confronted and in my opinion hassled by the police.
label: fear

text_A: When you betray the trust you have been given. This is connected á with copying at a class-work at school.
label: shame

text_A: When I have forgotten to warn somebody for something, or when I á have forgotten to bring something I have been asked for.
label: guilt

text_A: When, for example, I was in my eleventh school year and I learned á I had been classed for the Bulgarian Language and Literature á National Olympiad.
label: joy

text_A: When, for example, I left for the first time my parents and I á went to live in Sofia.
label: sadness

text_A: When, for example, someone is calumnating.
label: disgust

text_A: Some time ago a close relative of mine got off cheap with the á worst.
label: joy

text_A: The last time I felt it was when I was coming home late at night.
label: fear

text_A: I haven't often felt this feeling. Once someone stole my garment.
label: anger

text_A: I lied to my best friend and I wouldn't reform what I had done.
label: shame

text_A: Realizing one's desire, an experienced feeling of satisfaction á from the realization of one's desires and aims.
label: joy

text_A: Fear of the loss of a close friend, of feeling the ground slipping á from under my feet.
label: fear

text_A: Feeling unable to preserve one's ideas and ambitions as innocent á as they are when you are young.
label: sadness

text_A: Attitude to a related family.
label: disgust

text_A: Exaggerating certain circumstances, wrong attitude and evaluation á of these circumstances.
label: shame

text_A: Low evaluation of other people's cares.
label: guilt

text_A: I won a sport contest.
label: joy

text_A: If a close relative's life is in danger.
label: fear

text_A: Getting separated from my girlfriend.
label: sadness

text_A: Encouter with a prostitute.
label: disgust

text_A: A theft committed by me.
label: shame

text_A: Lack of respect for my parents.
label: guilt

text_A: When my son was born.
label: joy

text_A: Unjust punishment of a friend of mine.
label: anger

text_A: After the loss of a close relative.
label: sadness

text_A: When somebody behaves like a scoundrel. Recently a colleague of á mine used the name of another one for his own benefit.
label: disgust

text_A: I travelled on a bus and I forgot to punch the ticket. A ticket á collector came in and I had to pay the fine. I did it with a feeling á of shame.
label: shame

text_A: I forgot to convey an important announcement.
label: guilt

text_A: Meeting a loved man.
label: joy

text_A: I felt a physical fear, if I can call it this way, today, in the bus where á I was sitting on the first seat. While turning the driver didn't á see the tram which was making a dash towards us (coming from the á side I was), and whose driver intended to cross in yellow á light.
label: fear

text_A: At an unjust, or to be more precise, at a bureaucratic treatment á of one's personality.
label: anger

text_A: When one is alone and knows that all the others are celebrating.
label: sadness

text_A: At the sight of an insect, such as the black-beetle.
label: disgust

text_A: When not fulfilling any of my obligations to a person whom I á respect.
label: shame

text_A: When something unpleasant happens to a friend or relative of á yours and you are at the bottom of it.
label: guilt

text_A: I sensed such a feeling when I understood I was admitted to the á University. I was at home, the atmosphere was still, though I á myself was full of suspense. I tried to do different things. When á the telephone rang and...! Yes, of course there were other á situations when I felt a similar feeling but I was unmindful of á them.
label: joy

text_A: This feeling I sensed quite recently. It was arisen by the á terrific thought that I might lose the man I loved !
label: fear

text_A: Such a feeling springs up in me sometimes when I have meals at a á catering establishment. It is a result either of the look of the á food or when watching the way some people eat.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was admitted to the University.
label: joy

text_A: I had to have my tonsils out. I had been making up my mind almost á for a year - I was afraid. But during the two hours in the á hospital room, while I was waiting to be called for the operation I á felt a real fear - of the pain, of what they were going to do to á me, of the unknown.
label: fear

text_A: Summer, heavy rain, storm - I was standing with my face stick to á the window: the childhood, something was going away forever this á summer, I was leaving my home, I was going to study in another á town, for the first time I was leaving my parents, friends, I had á to manage myself, a long and loved period of my life was over - I á was crying.
label: sadness

text_A: I saw in the street a man spitting.
label: disgust

text_A: I talked with a man who stammered and without controlling myself, á I started to talk imitating him.
label: shame

text_A: Always, and this happens often when I do not keep my word.
label: guilt

text_A: I felt this feeling when one day my landlord's cat had crept á under my bed and I couldn't cope with it during an hour and a á half.
label: fear

text_A: I have felt this feeling when a person whom I believe and respect, á lied to me.
label: disgust

text_A: I feel shame when sometimes, (unconsciously) I behave unethically á and without understanding the problems of the man I love.
label: shame

text_A: When I offend somebody unfairly.
label: guilt

text_A: A quarrel was followed by the decision of leaving a person close á to me. Several days later my regret was great. I was beside á myself. Quite unexpectedly he came and the conflict was calmly á solved. I was glad at the possibility to be with him.
label: joy

text_A: Unfair and unjust attitude toward a person close to me, what I á was the witness of, caused anger in me.
label: anger

text_A: The thought that I'll never sit at the school desk again, caused á a deep grief at the end of my eleventh form.
label: sadness

text_A: At a moment of affect I offended a person very close to me. He á had given me ground for that but it was a trifling in comparison á with the way I insulted him. A moment later I felt a sense of á guilt.
label: guilt

text_A: The doctors from Belogradchik town determined a wrong diagnosis á to my son. A month later, after some complex examinations at ISUL á (A medical institute in Sofia), the diagnosis was categorically rejected.
label: anger

text_A: My son lives with my parents in the country and I feel this á feeling always when leaving for Sofia, but the last time it was á quite strong.
label: sadness

text_A: My son drank four pills of diazepam every two hours instead of á amidophen.
label: guilt

text_A: I am a sportwoman as well. I felt joy when after an year of á practice, at a contest, I covered the norms for \a master of sports\"."
label: joy

text_A: I felt fear once, when the car in which I travelled directed á towards the precipice along the road.
label: fear

text_A: When I left a man in whom I really believed.
label: sadness

text_A: Disgust with drunk people.
label: disgust

text_A: When I had had the possibility to act or to do certain activity á better but I had not done it because of reluctance or á carelessness.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was admitted to the University.
label: joy

text_A: When I broke my leg I felt fear.
label: fear

text_A: At an unjust insult or injure.
label: sadness

text_A: When I promise to do something but I don't fulfill it.
label: shame

text_A: When I don't fulfill my obligations.
label: guilt

text_A: When my affairs with the girl I love settled positively.
label: joy

text_A: When I am alone and listen to a song which I like very much and á which I had listened before together with friends.
label: sadness

text_A: I counterfeited a mark in the school register during the lesson á in gymnastics. I felt this feeling two days later when I stood á face to face with my teacher, whom I highly appreciated and á respected.
label: shame

text_A: In a fit of temper I told things that were unjust and they á greatly hurt my mother though she didn't show it.
label: guilt

text_A: I was alone in my room at the boarding house when at 12 o'clock á someone knocked violently on the door.
label: fear

text_A: A friend of mine promised to come with me to the cinema but he á didn't come.
label: anger

text_A: I felt sadness when I remembered my former boyfriend with whom I á got separated an year ago and when comparing him with my present á one with whom things are not much of a success.
label: sadness

text_A: Recently in the tram, a man ran his fingers over my girlfriend á then over me.
label: disgust

text_A: Bulgaria won a football match against France.
label: joy

text_A: I was going to knock down a pedestrian with my car.
label: fear

text_A: A man was unfair to a girlfriend of mine.
label: disgust

text_A: I didn't offer my seat to a pregnant woman in the bus.
label: shame

text_A: About a month ago the Regional Council refused to pay my wife the á due maternity benefit, because of bureaucratic reasons.
label: anger

text_A: Some months ago my wife gave birth to twin sisters. She had no á idea of looking after babies and she felt quite oppressed. The á fact that I couldn't help her caused grief to me.
label: sadness

text_A: I feel disgust with some people when I see what they are capable á of, including lack of any dignity, when trying to find a seat in á the tram.
label: disgust

text_A: The period when I was pregnant and when I gave birth to my son. á I can say those were the happiest months in my life.
label: joy

text_A: A fear from the loss of a close friend as a result of his á behavior.
label: fear

text_A: From the fact that my husband and I are not in good terms.
label: sadness

text_A: I was disgusted from a quarrel between two married people, in á which the children were involved as accusers of one of the á parents.
label: disgust

text_A: When I don't succeed to fulfill a promise.
label: shame

text_A: When I am not able to fulfill any request of my son - can't take á him out to ride his byke, because I am tired.
label: guilt

text_A: I felt joy when I saw my daughter after a separation of twenty á days.
label: joy

text_A: I felt fear when I sat for one of my exams. Though my fear was á not quite justifiable, I still remember about it.
label: fear

text_A: I thought him a good friend but he tried to lie to me several times. á Last time was the height of impudence. He promised he would come á home but he didn't. I felt a sense of anger and insult.
label: anger

text_A: A fear of lack of personal powers.
label: fear

text_A: At an undeserved attitude toward a man, when human personality is á not treated decently.
label: anger

text_A: At an irrevocable loss (with respect to human relations).
label: sadness

text_A: At a weakness on my part.
label: shame

text_A: When I was admitted to the University.
label: joy

text_A: Because of a conflict with my parents there was a possibility to á interrupt my studies.
label: fear

text_A: I feel a strong anger when I am treated unjustly.
label: anger

text_A: I was looking for an object when I came across a rotten corpse of á a rat.
label: disgust

text_A: I feel this feeling at one and the same degree when I am not á prepared to overcome certain obstacle in my life.
label: shame

text_A: The day when my son said for the first time \mummy\"."
label: joy

text_A: My husband and I were invited at the house of our nieghbours then á we got an invitation on the part of my parents which we had to á refuse. A a result they called me by words that provoked my á anger.
label: anger

text_A: The behaviour of a colleague of mine, which doesn't correspond to á my norms of behaviour.
label: disgust

text_A: I was to take part in a cocktail party on the occasion of our á national holiday as a servant.
label: shame

text_A: I ignored and offended my parents on the eve of the New Year.
label: guilt

text_A: The sense of joy comes to me always after a period of depression, á as an organic feeling for an upsurge. I don't exclude the á situative feeling but in this case the reason is not in me, it's á out of me.
label: joy

text_A: Alone I am coming back home in the night after the serial á \explanation\"."
label: sadness

text_A: I feel this feeling most often before me not before the others. á My outside is iron but actually I'm wasting away.
label: guilt

text_A: I was drawn up a statement for an infringement of the traffic á ordinance. In fact I was innocent.
label: anger

text_A: I lost a close friend.
label: sadness

text_A: I was nailed. I lied in connection with a book which I took from á the library, because I had to keep it for a longer time.
label: shame

text_A: Before going to the dentist.
label: fear

text_A: When I feel I must be with somebody, to talk with somebody - but á I am alone.
label: sadness

text_A: We had promised, with a friend of mine, to take our friends to a á restaurant and after having looked for a place for hours without á finding one, and not being helped by the others we had to give up á the idea.
label: guilt

text_A: When I am with friends and I do what pleases me this often á happenes.
label: joy

text_A: When I have to go in for an exam and the examinor is a person á with a whimsical character and unsteady requirements.
label: fear

text_A: It happened that I was alone - with no contacts with friends.
label: sadness

text_A: I met three drunk boys, almost children, they didn't look like á normal people.
label: disgust

text_A: I was totally unprepared for a seminar conducted by an assistant á professor whom I highly respect.
label: shame

text_A: I got back too late after a Sunday going out without having á called up home to tell where I was. my mother hadn't slept the á whole night.
label: guilt

text_A: I am afraid before an exam or colloquium.
label: fear

text_A: My mother developed hipertonia and I think I too am to blame á bacause with her it is a stress disease.
label: guilt

text_A: When I met with friends that I hadn't seen for a long time.
label: joy

text_A: I got angry with a stranger in a train who behaved impertinently á and immorally
label: anger

text_A: The event which got me angry got also an aversion in me.
label: disgust

text_A: I felt guilty when once I made my mother angry.
label: guilt

text_A: Six months ago when I got acquaintanced with a person whom I á trusted infinitely and from whom I expected help and friendly á feelings. With him I found much in common - in our views and in á our fate.
label: joy

text_A: Few days ago I really experienced fear. It was connected with á unexpected actions on the part of a group of people. This evoked á in me many negative emotions.
label: fear

text_A: I am ashamed of the way my father behaves with my mother and á sister, and with me too.
label: shame

text_A: For the girl who halped me go on living and made me happy - when á I don't see her even for two or three days.
label: sadness

text_A: For a drunk man (about 20 years old) that I met one evening, and á who behaved impudently with the girls standing by.
label: disgust

text_A: Recently when I made a slip and blurted out indecent words in my á mother's presence.
label: guilt

text_A: Fear overwhelmed me when right against the car I was in I saw á another one, as if out of control of the driver.
label: fear

text_A: I felt it when a girl who was dear to me lied to my face. I got á angry with the fact that she knew I didn't believe her but she á kept on telling lies.
label: anger

text_A: I got disgusted with a man who was beating a woman in the street. á I just happened to be there but I was abhorred by the rudness.
label: disgust

text_A: I was ashamed of the way I deceived that I could not help a á friend, although it was absolutely possible for me. Nothing was á revealed but I haven't called up this person since then.
label: shame

text_A: When I knew that my husband and I were going to have a child.
label: joy

text_A: The loss of a person I loved very much.
label: sadness

text_A: Deception from a person I loved very much.
label: disgust

text_A: I didn't tell my parents that I was going to Sofia. I told them á that I was going to a seminar. My mother knew that I was lying but á she didn't stop me.
label: shame

text_A: The assistant professor saw me cheat at the preliminary á examination.
label: guilt

text_A: I felt something close to that when I saw that there was a man on á the terrace of the flat.
label: fear

text_A: I got angry when I learned how short a time we had to prepare for á the term examinations.
label: anger

text_A: I felt it today when the bus driver shouted rather indecent words á at a man without any reason whatsoever.
label: disgust

text_A: My grandmother has been in a hospital for a week and I still á haven't had time to see her.
label: guilt

text_A: When I learned that my parents were going abroad and leaving me á alone for a few years.
label: joy

text_A: I was at the seaside and my brother disappeared for a couple of á hours.
label: fear

text_A: We were at a football match and when we were leaving the stadium á (the stadium was packed with people) and I lost my shoe in the á crowd. Our attempts to find it didn't give any result and I had á to go home without one shoe. In other words to cross the whole á town !
label: shame

text_A: When I was admitted to the Institute. I had problems with many á people about my applying for this institute and I decided to á prove that one can pass excellently without visiting any á preparatory couse. That is - I proved what I could do on my own.
label: joy

text_A: Once as a child I dreamed of a fire. Since that time I hadn't á wanted to sleep in that bed and had feared the night darkness á (and so it is now).
label: fear

text_A: A chief was unjustly punished on an autumn brigade and the one á who was really guilty kept silent. I stepped in front and told á the truth. The guilty chief called me in after the roll-call and á threatened me.
label: anger

text_A: It was at a comsomol(??) meeting, the last one because we were to á graduate. The way one of my fellow-students behaved made me feel á disgusted.
label: disgust

text_A: I was at a children's camp abroad. The people (the leaders, my á coevals) were very king to us. One night we smeared our foreign á friends with tooth-paste while they were sleeping and then we á roused the whole camp by our shouts. Later I was so sorry. I á didn't utter a word for two days, then I went to apologize.
label: shame

text_A: When I learned I was admitted to study what I wanted most - á floriculture (this is a narrow specialization from the general á one).
label: joy

text_A: I was walking on the pavement when a white car rolled on it and á directed towards me. I was quite near the house wall when it á rolled by and hit me.
label: fear

text_A: My grandmother's brother had taken active part in the resistance á movement. He had been in prison many times and there he lost his á health. He became an invalid. When we phoned to First Aid the á nurse on duty behaved quite unkindly when she understood how old á he was (79).
label: anger

text_A: My boyfriend is a soldier. He was on a leave. I felt sad when we á had to get separated again.
label: sadness

text_A: I felt disgusted about a teacher who had rejected all that was á human in her. She refused to accept the flowers we gave her for á the eighth of March and asked for a foreign parfume instead.
label: disgust

text_A: I was examined by a teacher I greatly respected. I was well á prepared on the subjects but he put some side-issues to me and I á couldn't answer.
label: shame

text_A: I was very glad when I learned I was a student already. I heard á about it over the phone, I didn't believe it at first.
label: joy

text_A: I had worries about a certain illness.
label: fear

text_A: I suffered from a gynaecological illness. I was quite displeased á to hear that my roommates had talked about it and they had á misrepresented the truth. I felt deeply hurt when I learned that á it was done by a \good\" acquaintance of mine."
label: anger

text_A: When my first boyfriend left me. I tried not to let him á understand I felt miserable.
label: sadness

text_A: I felt it when I came home after the examination session and I á said I had not passed my last exam.
label: guilt

text_A: I felt glad when I took the rather difficult organic chemistry á examination.
label: joy

text_A: I confronted with this feeling at the Institute quite recently, á the pedology lecturer was the cause.
label: anger

text_A: This feeling was quite deep when my friend (girl) died in a car á accident.
label: sadness

text_A: I am disgusted with the behavior of a car driver whose car would á run over me and my friends during our autumn brigade.
label: disgust

text_A: I felt shame when I discontinued my education for eight months.
label: shame

text_A: The sense of guilt came over me too, when I interrupted my á studies. Why ? Because I felt guilty before my parents ! They á believed in me though this event did not make them disbelieve me.
label: guilt

text_A: Fear when fulfilling my obligations on my first night fatigue á duty as a soldier.
label: fear

text_A: I am disgusted with a nieghbour who is looking for all sorts of á quarrel with my parents and me. He feels we are hampering his á living close to us. This has been going on for quite a long time.
label: disgust

text_A: After a difficult exam. When I had not hoped to take it and had á got a high mark. When you present someone with something and he á feels glad.
label: joy

text_A: I feel angry at people's indifference at our ability to be á present at an event and to stay partial to what happens.
label: anger

text_A: When you are far away from relatives and friends. I feel sad for á my early years, for the freedom and the carefree years of á childhood.
label: sadness

text_A: I feel ashamed when I act dishonestly toward somebody.
label: shame

text_A: I was sitting for an exam in biochemistry, I was very excited á because it was a supplementary examination. I passed the exam á very well and was glad because I recovered my selfconfidence.
label: joy

text_A: It was necessary to organise a competition in connection with a á celebration. Everyone was to be present at that event. It turned á out that there was no audience at all because everyone had á pretended to be very intelligent and no one had come. I got á furious.
label: anger

text_A: When I part with my friends I feel always sad for some time. I á can't remember a concrete example now. For example I have just á parted with a friend of mine and I am feeling sad.
label: sadness

text_A: In autumn I had to move to another lodging. My landlords, quite á intelligent people, warned me I had to move in the nearest á future. But I had difficulties in moving my luggage because I á couldn't wait for a car to come. How amazed I was to hear them á threatening me they would throw our my things. And at that my á luggage was well packed and did not stand in their way. I was á quite  disappointed and disgusted.
label: disgust

text_A: During our last exarcise in agricultural machines we went out in á the yard to examine a row of machines. But we seemed not to have á fulfilled our task well, because when our teacher came and asked á me a question I was unable to answer. I felt awkward because he á didn't deserve it.
label: shame

text_A: I remember about an unpleasant event in relation to my mother. I á felt guilty before her.
label: guilt

text_A: I fear before each exam.
label: fear

text_A: When my bosom friend tried to lie to me.
label: anger

text_A: When I wasn't well prepared for a terminal exam and the teacher á tried to give me a three by asking me some very easy questions. I á burned with shame then.
label: shame

text_A: When once my mother asked me to do some work for her at home á because she was busy and moreover this work was to be done by a á man. But it remained undone.
label: guilt

text_A: I feel joy usually after each taken exam, the last one was in á February.
label: joy

text_A: It was not long ago when I and two of friends of mine got quite drunk á and one of them began to rave under the influence of the alcohol. á I felt fear of what could have happened.
label: fear

text_A: I felt anger at my last exam, I felt angry with our teacher, á because he did not rate me objectively and I failed.
label: anger

text_A: I met a girl some time ago and I cared very much about her but it á happened so that we left each other. I felt some sort of sadness, I think á I can call it so.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was admitted to the Higher Institute.
label: joy

text_A: I felt fear when I fell down and broke my leg into pieces and I á could not feel it at all.
label: fear

text_A: I felt disgust with alcohol in general when a close friend of á mine got so drunk that he didn't realize what he was doing and it á was quite shameful.
label: disgust

text_A: I felt guilty when I had taken the car keys and I had an accident á but as my parents did not know who was to blame, they punished my á brother because I had no driving licence and they thought it á impossible that had driven the car.
label: guilt

text_A: I felt joy when I was admitted to the Higher Agricultural á Institute.
label: joy

text_A: That was what I felt with a teacher who put down quite unreal á marks.
label: anger

text_A: I felt sad when a friend of mine died and I felt that something á had irrevocably gone away from me.
label: sadness

text_A: I felt disgust with a lady teacher who used to nag, to mock, to á interrupt everyone of my fellow students each time we had a class á with her in our first year.
label: disgust

text_A: That was what I felt when I told my first lie and then was á cought.
label: shame

text_A: It was some years ago when one evening some people came home and á told us my father was badly injured in an accident.
label: fear

text_A: I faced this feeling when I realized I wasn't admitted to the á institute in the first classifying, in spite of the high mark I á had got at the entrance examination.á
label: anger

text_A: Always when I get separated from my friends and relatives from my á home town.
label: sadness

text_A: I have always felt ashamed for some people's behavior to their á too old parents. I have felt hurt and shy when they have left á them to the mercy of fate.
label: shame

text_A: I feel always guilty before my parents when I come home and have á to tell them I have failed an exam.
label: guilt

text_A: Naturally when I got myself discharged this was my second á birthday.
label: joy

text_A: After my father's death.
label: sadness

text_A: With an alcoholic.
label: disgust

text_A: Once I had dinner at an elegant restaurant and I did not have á enough money to pay the bill. There were a lot of people there á and I felt quite awkward.
label: shame

text_A: Something very unpleasant happened when I was a soldier and I was á directly involved in it.
label: guilt

text_A: I was terrified during an axcursion in Italy. I was lost and left á alone in this unfamiliar country.
label: fear

text_A: I took part in a football match. The referee was extremely á partial to the opposite team. This stirred up my discontent and á anger.
label: anger

text_A: During a summer holiday at a bar I happened to see a dead to the á world woman.
label: disgust

text_A: When I first had a sexual intercourse.
label: shame

text_A: When I first sat for an entrance examination.
label: fear

text_A: When a teacher though pretending to be a highly cultivated á teacher and a man, slapped a classmate of mine in the face quite á undeservedly.
label: anger

text_A: When I got separated from my first love.
label: sadness

text_A: Many times, when my father used to come home drunk and maltreated á physically me and my mother.
label: disgust

text_A: Being invited out by a person I wished to get closer to. He á telephoned and invited me to go out with him the next night.
label: joy

text_A: Watching a horror movie with friends.
label: fear

text_A: The breakup of a relationship. After the event I was upset/sad á then angry maybe 2/3 weeks later.
label: anger

text_A: The funeral of a friend who was killed in a car accident. She was á of my own age, there were many of my own friends present, as well á as her family etc.
label: sadness

text_A: Disgust for a person who treated me badly, and has treated other á people similarly - including lying, hiding facts, being á deceitful, unfair, etc.
label: disgust

text_A: Losing my temper and allowing myself to act childishly by yelling á and screaming at a person who I felt had done me wrong - in á effect lowering myself to their level.
label: shame

text_A: Guilt at often being unable to visit a close relative in hospital á after her death I felt very guilty and wished I had done more.
label: guilt

text_A: Achievement of a task by a friend who had begun a new job. She á wasn't confident of handling the situation so was thinking  of á leaving the job only after 2 days employment.
label: joy

text_A: Walking home at night after university - part of the way, there á are ano lights and I am walking down a thoroughfare with the á thouth of no one hearing me if I have to scream.
label: fear

text_A: When my son omits to carry out certain duties at home that he á knows needs doing.
label: anger

text_A: When I saw my niece (5 yrs) crying in the hallway for her mother á who had passed away about a month ago.
label: sadness

text_A: When I had lied to a friend/son about some things we had á discussed and I had to be one better.
label: guilt

text_A: Felt joy a few years ago when I was away on holiday. And sat very á close to my best friend looking straight into the eyes.
label: joy

text_A: Felt sad about some street kids in QUEII square, Aotea square. á Because they had been sniffing glue and some were very young. I á went into the role of a performing clown.
label: sadness

text_A: I felt guilty at being part of the successful people. Felt guilty á at being a student when other people were not. Guilt about being á a potential success in various areas of society. (So stupid this á emotion)
label: guilt

text_A: A friend visited and made comments that my house/garden were not á as neat/tidy as in the past. I'd not seen her a year - She á implied I'd gone to the pack (I'd only been working full time, á and taking 3 University exams part time).
label: anger

text_A: My 3 children - each top his class in the final exams 1984.
label: joy

text_A: A sour looking man was beating his thin dog in Remuera.
label: disgust

text_A: When my mother entered surgery for a quadruple heart bypass. I á felt intense fear at the time she was actually wheeled away.
label: fear

text_A: When my husband got picked up in our new car for drunken driving. á We had made a pact the other would not drink and so therefore á would be the driver for the evening etc. I was not present at the á time.
label: anger

text_A: When my grandmother died very suddenly without warning.
label: sadness

text_A: When the N.Z. rugby union announced that they would proceed with á a rugby tour of South Africa.
label: disgust

text_A: My partner without discussing with me the situation decided it á was time for us to have a break and went ahead and arranged his á own life for the next 6-12 months, then told me the day before it á was about to happen having been tolerant and friendly for the á preceding week.
label: anger

text_A: I had been living in an overseas city and made the decision to á leave the city and come home about 12 months before I met a whole á new set of friends, leaving them at the airport was sad and á traumatic as they had helped me in many ways and I knew I á wouldn't see many of them again.
label: sadness

text_A: When my grandmother, who has been living with us for 14 years, á had a stroke and was left paralysed on one side. She has been á quite close to our family and to see her suffer in this way makes á me feel really sad.
label: sadness

text_A: A gathering of a social sports club at which they proceeded to á show pornographic videos and then afterwards (when most people á had had quite a bit to drink) carried on in a very degrading, á unmoral manner - especially females exposing and flaunting á themselves with no shame or embarassment.
label: disgust

text_A: This feeling of guilt really applies to moral/religious views. I á (being Catholic) went against what I was brought up to believe in á and had a sexual relationship with my boyfriend. Many months á later, when I was doing some deeper self analysis I began to feel á guilty and realized that I had gone against what I wanted for á myself and my future.
label: guilt

text_A: A friend came to tell me that her father invited me to go on á holiday with them in Benidorm otherwise I could not afford to go á on holiday.
label: joy

text_A: At the age of 12 years I always had to take care of my little á brother and sister I never could sleep then. I always imagined á creepy men sneaking into our house.
label: fear

text_A: The landlord had selected a new lodger on her own, while we used á to do that it was not what she had done, but how she did it that á made me angry.
label: anger

text_A: It was a complex situation concerning a relationship with a á boyfriend, I had broken the relationship for some reasons. á Meanwhile, as I felt it, I had most sorrow.
label: sadness

text_A: I saw a terrible accident happen and I laughed a lot of the á fright and because I was nervous.
label: shame

text_A: My mother wants to talk very often about her life. I dislike this á because she always talks negatively about the same people á whatever I do it doesn't help.
label: guilt

text_A: I have a fobic anxiety for elevators. This anxiety is worst at á the moment when the doors have to open. I have it often in the á elevator at our university.
label: fear

text_A: My boyfriend decided to make an end to our relationship.
label: sadness

text_A: When I am in an auditorium with people and I ask a silly question á so that everyone starts to laugh.
label: shame

text_A: I moved to Nijmegen for my study. Soon after this my mother had á to be admitted in hospital because of cardiac compliants. I knew á that my moving was an important reason for this.
label: guilt

text_A: I can't give one description here. I often feel joyful when I á have done things good in relation to other people especially when á my friend says he loves me and I also tell him that I love him.
label: joy

text_A: I was afraid when my first boyfriend threatened to make an end to á our relationship because he didn't love me enough while I loved á him very much.
label: fear

text_A: I was very sad when my first boyfriend finished our relationship.
label: sadness

text_A: I was once raped (one year ago) by a man who was a lot older than á me and whom I just met. Maybe it wasn't rape but the man wanted á more than I wanted to give him since there were other people in á vicinity.
label: disgust

text_A: I felt shame when I didn't study enough for my exams and as a á result I failed. I then invented idle stories to talk it good for á myself and the others.
label: shame

text_A: I felt guilty when I once went out with another boy and made love á with him while I had a close boyfriend.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was sitting in a car next to a man who was masturbating.
label: fear

text_A: Tonight in bed when I realised how bad my relationship with my á friend was.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was in Eindhoven on an Exhibition of Hernan Nitsche, who á made paintings with real blood. There were also photographs about á the killing of cows.
label: disgust

text_A: When I made an end on a relationship after three years.
label: shame

text_A: That I didn't want my friend to leave on holiday for 10 days á because I thought I would miss him. I was constantly trying to á persuade him.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was making music together with my friend. It sounded very á good and we were very satisfied.
label: joy

text_A: When my cat ran under a car and came home wounded. He could á hardly walk. I didn't dare to go to a veterinarian because I was á afraid he would kill him.
label: fear

text_A: Losing my girlfriend who made an end to our relationship. By this á I lost an important source of support, certainty and joyful á moments. I cried very intensly when that happened.
label: sadness

text_A: During carnaval I danced for a few minutes normally I don't dance á because I am rigid in my moving around during a dance, I stopped á very soon.
label: shame

text_A: I had a girlfriend which I used to call regularly. Then I didn't á phone her for a while. At a certain moment I felt a little á tension which became worse.
label: guilt

text_A: At an important moment in a volleyball game we made a point and á by this we won a set from a much stronger competitor.
label: joy

text_A: When I went out with my dog in a forest late at night when we á were on a camping.
label: fear

text_A: When I entered the operation theatre and underwent a difficult á operation.
label: fear

text_A: When they gave away my dog to other people without my knowledge.
label: sadness

text_A: When I had to eat scraps from a dust-bin, because of a bet.
label: disgust

text_A: At the airport, eighty beer cans that I was carrying in a á bag spread all around while I was going through the metal á detector.
label: shame

text_A: When I took a car which was not mine, and suddenly it stopped á working.
label: guilt

text_A: On the scenic railway at the fairground.
label: fear

text_A: [ The same as in guilt.]
label: sadness

text_A: When I was a child, one day, I was going home late at night and I á did not notice an uncovered man hole and fell in it.  I was in there for á several minutes.
label: fear

text_A: One day, when I was a child, my grandmother shut me up in a room.
label: anger

text_A: The day I left my first girlfriend.
label: sadness

text_A: I ran over my dog with a bicycle when I was carrying him tied to á the handle bar.
label: guilt

text_A: When I won the first prize in a cross country race.

text_A: An argument among friends in which my opinions on the way to á spend spare time were disapproved.

text_A: I saw the gare of a prison.  This gare and the building were in á deplorable condition and were full of rubbish.
label: disgust

text_A: A mishap suffered on misinterpreting a girl's proposition.
label: shame

text_A: I thought that I could have avoided the above situation (the one á in fear) if I had concentrated more on my work, which I hate.
label: guilt

text_A: Before I had a tooth pulled out.  I was very upset and ill.
label: fear

label: anger

text_A: When I finished a test type of exam and did not dare to answer á any question, I doubted whether I would pass the exam  or not.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was back home after a long time, meeting beloved people á and close friends.
label: joy

text_A: When I heard about the treatment of a friend in jail. Really á inhuman. I never realised that such things also happen in the á Netherlands.
label: disgust

text_A: I cannot remember a situation in which I felt ashamed. I was á eating with some people and a little boy I took care of. I warned á him often not to knock down his glass of mild. When I took á out his chair I knocked down my own glass.
label: shame

text_A: When on holiday in Greece I called my best friend, she told me á she passed the examinations and that she had been admitted to the á study for speech therapy.
label: joy

text_A: I was shopping in Utrecht with friends, we also ate some chips á and snacks in a snackbar, then we saw a shabby fellow. He took a á cold half eaten croquette (a snack) from a rubbish bin and eat á it.
label: disgust

text_A: I had subscribed for this test. We were informed by our á secretary where the test took place. We went over there and thought á there was a course. So we went back again I felt ashamed that the á secretary again should see me.
label: shame

text_A: I was out with a friend in a place where it was very, very busy. á When we wanted to go I bumped a person, who dropped his glass á beer I offered a new one but he didn't accept it.
label: guilt

text_A: My sister borrowed some LP records for a party. She had left them á in the car on curatao. Due to the heat they were crooked, so I á couldn't play them again.
label: anger

text_A: When my grandmother died, her life was heavy and her last hours á were terrible.
label: sadness

text_A: I am thinking about death, the eternal of it, the unknown, the á sense of being here. Often, laying in bed in the dark and quiet, á the fear makes me feel dizzy.
label: fear

text_A: If they force me to eat something I don't like. For example, my á parents always twaddle and whine, when I don't eat all the food.
label: anger

text_A: I had to leave Den Helder and all friends and acquaintences, á after having spend two weeks there with my friends.
label: sadness

text_A: Being on view in a meat-factory. Pigs being cut open, pigs being á suspended from nods, blood everywhere, decompsition.
label: disgust

text_A: When my father (physically handicapped) asks me to do something á and I raise several objections. Often I can fix it in few á moments.
label: guilt

text_A: When the parents of my girlfriend gave permission to spend our á holiday together.
label: joy

text_A: When the relationship with my first girlfriend broke up and I á realized it too late.
label: fear

text_A: When working in a chemical laundry, I saw rats and maggots in the á washing.
label: disgust

text_A: I am a teacher in arts and crafts (boys from 15-16 years). for á them it is obligatory and they dislike it. They tease me. When one of á them cut up some material I flared up.
label: anger

text_A: My sister was in coma for 3 months (due to a train accident). Now á her brainfunctions are disturbed. She will never be able to walk á and she can hardly talk.
label: sadness

text_A: I lived together with my boyfriend. One night he stayed away and á next day he told me that he had chat up with another girl.
label: disgust

text_A: I talk too much, cannot keep things secret. I promised a friend á not to tell something to anybody. Neverthless, I did, and she got á informed about it. I felt very ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: My mother was stuck by an apoplectic fit, was hemi-paralyzed and á suffered an aphasia.
label: sadness

text_A: I chatted up with a girl who I didn't love. She however was á fallen in love with me. I felt responsible for her sorrow.
label: guilt

text_A: I felt very happy when I heard I had passed the examination to á move up to the second year course.
label: joy

text_A: I invited two friends. We should go out together. Those two girls á kept talking about boys, chatting up etc. I bacame sick of it.
label: anger

text_A: When I was 10 years old I stained our bench with a fountain-pen, á I tried to twin the cushions, but then there were colour nuances. á Then my mother catched me, she saw it and became very angry.
label: shame

text_A: I spend the night with my boyfriend, while there was also a á friend of his. We all lay on the floor to sleep. When my á boyfriend was fallen asleep the other boy and I started petting. á After 15 minutes I felt miserable and awoke my boyfriend to tell á him that.
label: guilt

text_A: I liked to see off my aunt (from Zaire) to the airport. That á appeared to be impossible because I had to go to school. For long á time I wasn't sure if I could accompany her. Two days before the á departure they told me I was allowed to miss school.
label: joy

text_A: I went to the ballet lessons with a little friend in the dark. On á a very quiet place a boy approached us from behind and asked at á what time the lesson would be finished. I gave him an avoiding á answer, he took me up and wanted to run away with me.
label: fear

text_A: I was sleeping nicely until in the middle of the night when I became á awake because a friend called me for some (in my opinion) á nonsens reason.
label: anger

text_A: My boyfriend with whom I had a longlasting relationship, fell in á love with another girl, then he asked me something which implied á that he loved that girl more than he loved me.
label: sadness

text_A: On school, during a fancy fair, there was a stand of amnesty á international. There I read (for the first time) a description of á the tortures of a woman, what they did to her.
label: disgust

text_A: A friend catched me while masturbating. I am not fully sure á whether she saw it or not.
label: shame

text_A: When I was 4-5 years old my mother gave me some parts of a á chocolate bar and ordered me to bring it to my father working á outside. On my way I could not resist the temptation and ate it á myself.
