text_A: The comrade staying next doors insulted me for what he called  á the misuse of his iron.  He called me stupid, self centered etc.  á I wanted to punch him but instead went for a walk to the mining á school to cool off.
label: anger

text_A: A close relative was at odds with a very powerful firm.  All his á things had been taken, His dad had died a little before this á event.  He gathhered his children and vowed to give them a good á life with a new start - the words were hollow, he bit back his á tears .....I asked to be excused and then went and cried in the á loo.
label: sadness

text_A: My girlfriend had started going around with another boy.  Her á cousin, also a friend of mine, asked her as to who she preferred. á  Both of us were present and she chose the other guy.
label: shame

text_A: I bumped my dad's car in a lamp post.  He was not at home then, á neither was he home when I left for the campus.  I did not tell á him about the accident and I will never tell him.
label: guilt

text_A: I was at school whhen I received a letter from the dean of my á school congratulating me for my performance at the previous á year's exam.
label: joy

text_A: This was at secondary school, a prefect framed up some case and á took it to the deputy head-master.  I was called by the á head-master and he threatened to suspend me.
label: fear

text_A: When I travelled all the way to my former school to collect my á certificate, only to be told that I owed them some money, I knew á nothing about this.
label: anger

text_A: When at school I thought that I was going to get the best results á in mathematics, but it was someone else who got the prize.
label: disgust

text_A: When I received a letter from my girlfriend telling me that she á was engaged to an another man.
label: shame

text_A: I felt guilty when I heard the results of my friend, who had á failed.  I wished that I had helped him.
label: guilt

text_A: My being admitted to UNZA.
label: joy

text_A: I entrusted a friend with the delivery of some money to my á father, however he misused the money.
label: anger

text_A: Over an argument.
label: disgust

text_A: When I had sufficient amount of money, I brought more clothes for á myself than for the children - I  felt bad about it.
label: guilt

text_A: My trouser's zipper was open when I was at a public wedding.
label: anger

text_A: When I failed an exam.
label: disgust

text_A: Insulted my girlfriend during a peptalk.
label: shame

text_A: I caught a close relative with the servant of the house.
label: guilt

text_A: When I passed my form three exams.
label: joy

text_A: The time I was threatened with expulsion from secondary school (form á four).
label: fear

text_A: When I heard about the death of my aunt.
label: sadness

text_A: I was running in front of a crowd when I slipped and fell on a á wet lawn.
label: shame

text_A: When I took drugs.
label: guilt

text_A: I watched a very terrfying film in LT2.  This film really pushed á my heart out of my body and I was forced to go out before the á second reel ended.
label: fear

text_A: One Saturday morning I had got ready to go out swimming with my á friends.  Unfortunately the weather did not permit it, so we á stayed indoors.
label: sadness

text_A: One day I went to town to get my grocery.  On my way back, I took á a mini bus which was full of drunk students.  I felt very á disgusted.
label: disgust

text_A: I had gone to aa bookshop to buy some books.  Somehow, I got very á cross with the security guard checking through what I had bought. á  I lost my temper and screamed at him.  Later I felt very ashamed á at myself as a lot of people I know were there.
label: shame

text_A: When someone chased me from his house.
label: anger

text_A: When I realized that I did not have the basic things needed by a á student like me.
label: sadness

text_A: When some people, including me, are treated in a way which á equates them to an animal or a thing.
label: disgust

text_A: When someone I know was caught in an \adultery\" situation."
label: shame

text_A: When I did something wrong in the past and denied having done it á when asked about it later.
label: guilt

text_A: When I walked out of my room with only my pants on and found my á girlfriend and her female friend looking for me outside.
label: shame

text_A: My father caught me having sexual intercourse with my closest á cousin.  There was nothing wrong with it but the female was too á old for me.
label: guilt

text_A: One evening, when I had gone fishing with my friends, we heard á the roar of a lion near by and had to run for our lives.
label: fear

text_A: When somebody stole my brother's disco machine.
label: anger

text_A: When my uncle died.
label: sadness

text_A: A class-mate answered (accidentally) the call of nature in the á class during a tough mathematics examination.
label: disgust

text_A: I took some money from my parent's house without asking them for á it, and I was caught red handed.
label: guilt

text_A: I was very happy when I discovered that I had passed my first á year examination and was among the thirty students who would á major in economics.
label: joy

text_A: I was approaching my exam time and my books got stolen.  I was in á a panic as I thought that I would not do well enough to be á considered for the economics quota.  I cried a lot but that did á not help and as the exam day came near a strange fear gripped me.
label: fear

text_A: I was annoyed this particular day as it seemad that the odds were á not in my favour.  My grandfather added fuel to the fire, when I  á had an important appointment so I unleashed my anger on him.
label: anger

text_A: When I was accepted at UNZA.
label: joy

text_A: I was disgusted at the university wanting some of us to travel á from our homes to the lectures here every day.  The way the whole á thing was handled disgusted me.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was leaving home I decided to leave without saying á good-bye to my young brother.  My brother saw me and said,        á \ Will you not say good-bye to me?\"  He is only 31/2 years old. "
label: shame

text_A: When I cheated my father about the book allowance at university.  á He discovered that we were given K150 per year for books.
label: guilt

text_A: I experienced this when my maternal grandmother passed away.  She á was the last of my grand parents to pass away.
label: sadness

text_A: I insulted the girl to whom I had proposed when she turned me á down.
label: shame

text_A: When my first child was born.
label: joy

text_A: I was walking through a thick forest and there was a big snake at á a distance of about four metres.
label: fear

text_A: When my best friend started getting involved in my private á affairs.
label: disgust

text_A: We were driving at night and I realized that a car was following á us.
label: fear

text_A: I reachad home to find that my baby had not been bathed and fed.
label: anger

text_A: I saw a dead child which was not covered, it had been knocked á down by a car.
label: sadness

text_A: I saw a friend's husband with another woman.
label: disgust

text_A: I scolded my sister without waiting for her explanation.
label: shame

text_A: When I was appointed by the Ministry of health to join the á teaching staff of one of the medical colleges.
label: joy

text_A: When I took blood from a patient for alcohol estimation and á urine for some other examination, he told me that something bad á would happen to me as he would play magic on me.
label: fear

text_A: When the dean of UNZA asked me to vacate a big flat I was á occupying and take up a smaller one as I was becoming a full time á student at UNZA.
label: anger

text_A: When my close friend was involved in an accident and passed away á instantly.  He had gone to buy a new car and had asked me to á wait at his home so that I could see his new car.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was told that the brother who was staying with me would á not go to the training school that year but only the year after.
label: disgust

text_A: A patient, to whom I had given a powerful medicine, shouted at me á in front of many people.  I realized that he did so because he á was very ill.
label: shame

text_A: When I received my promotion letter.
label: joy

text_A: I was sleeping when I heard the neighbours screaming, I peeped á through the window and saw a thief  trying to enter my á neighbour's house.
label: fear

text_A: I was annoyed when a person higher up asked me why a particular á job was not done, it was not my job to do it.
label: anger

text_A: My brother came to tell me about some problems we had in the  á family.  I felt sad because I thought that if my mother had not á gone away when this brother was younger, things would have been á different.
label: sadness

text_A: I was in a train when a woman started talking loudly and á attracting everybody's attention.  The worst thing was that she á was discussing something, about which she knew nothing, with another person.
label: disgust

text_A: A certain woman had asked me to make something for her and I kept á putting it off.  When I finally made it, I did not see her for á days only to be told one day that she had collapsed and died.  I á felt quite guilty as she had jokingly said that I might not do á what she had requested me to do.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was accepted for my third year (G-10) at my former á secondary school.
label: joy

text_A: I had gone for a medical check-up at the U.T.H and failed to make á it back on time for the C119 practical sessions at 1400 hours á last academic year.
label: fear

text_A: When I was mistreated by my step-mother.
label: anger

text_A: When my aunt passed away in early 1982.
label: sadness

text_A: When I failed my grade 7 exam at the first attempt in 1975.  My á father and the entire family thought that I was finished in life. á  I really felt like hiding.
label: shame

text_A: When a drunkard barged into a room where my friend and I had run á in order to get away from him.  We were all alone and all I could á see was this hand coming towards me.
label: fear

text_A: When a friend and me played a joke on our boyfriends.  Her á boyfriend came up and accused me of having planned the whole á thing and said that I did not deserve my boyfriend.  He á embarassed me in front of a crowd.
label: anger

text_A: When my family and I heard of the death of my grandfather.  We had á  seen him a few weeks earlier and it seemed that he had just been á waiting to see us.
label: sadness

text_A: When my boyfriend asked me to go out with him and I refused á because I wanted to go out with another guy.  I did go out and my á boyfriend found out.
label: guilt

text_A: Birds had made nests in our thatched roof and they were flying á and flapping their wings in the bedroom at night.  It was very á dark and I could not even see my nose.  I did not know that it á was the birds till my mother told me so.
label: fear

text_A: The juniors in our dormitory at school started to complain and á make a lot of noise about the duties assigned to them by the á prefect who was my class-mate and was very cool and dull.
label: anger

text_A: When I wet my bed at boarding school.
label: shame

text_A: My baby sister was 2-3 months old and when I was trying to get á her on my back, she slipped and fell.
label: guilt

text_A: My room-mate locked up our room without specifying where I would á find the keys.  I had to spend several hours in my other friend's á room.
label: anger

text_A: The teacher of one course gave me 10 questions with sub-questions á going from a to e for each question.  She asked me to do all this á in one and a half hours.  It involved a lot of describing and á explaining and even though I knew all the answers, I could not á finish the work.
label: disgust

text_A: I forgot that the course instructor had directed us to go for á special classes after the usual class hours.  I missed this the á first day and when he asked me about it the next day I said that á I had forgotten.
label: shame

text_A: I was to inform the neighbour on my left that a robber had been á spotted the same evening near the house of the neighbour in front.  á I did not do it and the same day the thieves broke into this á neighbour's house.
label: guilt

text_A: When my father bought me a suit.
label: joy

text_A: I was badly beaten up by one of my friends during a wedding á party.
label: anger

text_A: I was disappointed by a girlfriend when I visited her at her home á in Woodlands.
label: disgust

text_A: I was ashamed at being the only one to have got a C+ in ED120 á assignment.
label: shame

text_A: I was caught stealing a box of matches in the supermarket and had á to plead guilty.
label: guilt

text_A: I had gone home for a week-end and when I came back I found that á my clothes and my bedding had been stolen.
label: anger

text_A: When my father passed away.
label: sadness

text_A: Someone stole a K10 note and the teacher thought that it was me á when I was not responsible for the theft.
label: disgust

text_A: When I failed the grade seven exams.
label: shame

text_A: When I saw my family after a separation of one year.
label: joy

text_A: When one of my best friends commited siucide during these á holidays.
label: sadness

text_A: I am disgusted at the number of second year students who are á pregnant illegitimately.
label: disgust

text_A: When I got very low marks in one of the assignments.
label: shame

text_A: When a thunder belt hit the roof top of the building I was in.
label: fear

text_A: When my room-mate locked me out deliberately, before an exam due á at 1400 hours.
label: anger

text_A: When my friends died one after the other.  The first died in a á car accident and the second one recently, due to an illness.
label: sadness

text_A: When my cousin put feaces in my washing.  A silly idea which was á meant to be a joke.
label: disgust

text_A: When I took a small boy's share of choclale.  He was our guest á and so had been given a larger share of the sweets.
label: guilt

text_A: The day I got a telegram telling me that I had been selected for á a B.A at UNZA.  I felt happy because I had not expected to be á selected.
label: joy

text_A: The day I encountered a queer mamba face to face in a chunk of á leaves behind our house.
label: fear

text_A: The day my teacher of Latin and French died.
label: sadness

text_A: The day I went to eat dinner in the dinning hall and found a á dead fly in my gravy.
label: disgust

text_A: I felt ashamed of myself the first time I drank as nobody in the á family drinks.  I felt that I had let down my parents and my á friends.
label: shame

text_A: The day I came home drunk after having attended a disco party.
label: guilt

text_A: I remember that when my mother died the day was sad and every á time I think of it I am saddened by the loss of my mother.
label: sadness

text_A: When thieves broke into our house, I was disgusted by their á behaviour.  They did not find anything so they broke things like á the windows, glasses etc.
label: disgust

text_A: When I received a positive answer from my appeal to withdraw my á registration at UNZA.
label: joy

text_A: When I learnt that my offer to study at the university had been á withdrawn  and so I would not get hostel accomodation at UNZA, á even though I registered as a student later.
label: disgust

text_A: My love proposal was turned down by a lady I really loved.
label: shame

text_A: I came across a blind man sitting in one of the corridors and á asking for money, though I had some money I did not give him á anything.
label: guilt

text_A: When I first came to the campus.
label: joy

text_A: When an argument with a friend of mine over our behaviour towards á another friend turned into a quarrel.   I lost my temper and nearly á knocked him out.
label: anger

text_A: When I lost my father in a car accident.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was denied my favourite dish at the dinning hall (shima á with roast chicken), I felt disgusted.
label: disgust

text_A: I felt ashamed when a friend, I had always respected, insulted me á in public.  He was drunk.
label: shame

text_A: When my library books were overdue and I did not have the money á to pay for them.
label: guilt

text_A: When my father did not get back from Chipata on time, he was thus á holding back progress as everything depended on him.  I felt á angry over his actions.
label: anger

text_A: When I saw a woman who had been run over by a train, just off á Kafue.  The woman had been cut to bits, there was blood and        á splinters of bone every where.
label: disgust

text_A: When my friend had a child out of wedlock.
label: shame

text_A: When we forced a friend to chew a poisonous herb in primary á school.  His tongue was swollen and he told his mother about it.  á The mother reported it to the headmaster who threatened to expel á us.
label: fear

text_A: At boarding school someone put a lot of tiny thorns on my bed.  á When I complained everybody began teasing me and laughing at my á inability to find out my enemies.  I lost my temper.
label: anger

text_A: When my grandfather died.
label: sadness

text_A: My room-mate was drunk, he vomited on the floor and fell face á down on the vomit nearly choking himself to death.  Then he á fainted and so I called the first aid.
label: disgust

text_A: As a kid my mother caught me stealing sugar and giving it to a á neighbour.
label: shame

text_A: When my sister died, she was only sixteen when she was put to á rest.
label: sadness

text_A: When my father found me in bed with a girl, we were deep in actioon á when he entered the room.
label: shame

text_A: I took my grandmother's money without telling her and when asked á if it was me who had taken the money, I denied it.
label: guilt

text_A: My little niece, who is very talkative, suddenly became very á naughty and began wetting her pants.  She did it one afternoon.
label: anger

text_A: This morning during my sleep I had a feeling that someboby was á attacking me.  I started crying in my sleep and then my room-mate á woke me up.
label: sadness

text_A: My cousin and I were at the farm and at night we drunk like fools á and made a lot of noise.  We had drunk two much of wine.
label: shame

text_A: The fridge we had at home had a lock.  One day when I wanted á something, I unscrewed the door but unfortunately I was caught in á the act.
label: guilt

text_A: When I saw an accident, a woman was run over and she died on the á spot.
label: fear

text_A: While watching a movie, someone who was drunk started vomiting á helplessly.
label: disgust

text_A: When I ate my sister's food and then she found out that it was á me.  I felt very ashamed but still refused to admit that it was á me.
label: shame

text_A: When I told a person something that had happened to my friend, á and this person went and told my friend.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was told that the form five results were out.
label: fear

text_A: When I saw my younger sister being bothered by a boy she did not á know.
label: anger

text_A: When I was taking my girlfriend out, she seemed to have taken á her time.
label: disgust

text_A: When my dad caught me with a honey (girlfriend) in my bedroom.
label: shame

text_A: When I was selected for higher education, i.e grade 7 to formI.
label: joy

text_A: When I impregnated a certain girl, I thought that I would be á forced to marry her or go to court.
label: fear

text_A: When the university withdrew the accomodation that it had given á me.
label: anger

text_A: When I proposed love to a girl and she turned me down.
label: shame

text_A: When I could not reason my friend, it angered me.
label: anger

text_A: I felt very ashamed at having got a book by force from a girl.
label: shame

text_A: Our only elder sister got married and started having pains in her á abdomen and she was told that she could not have children. To our á suprise she had a baby 2 months back.
label: joy

text_A: I dreamt of my father's death while I was at secondary school.  I á was screaming at the top of my voice and was woken up by my á friend.  That day I was really sad.
label: sadness

text_A: I had prepared a special meal for my boyfriend but when my á brother came home he ate it all.  I was really disgusted about it.
label: disgust

text_A: We were at a party, this guy I liked and me.  I really loved him á and gathered enough courage to ask him to kiss me.  He did not do á it but instead asked me what I would like for my birthday.  I á told him that I would like a kiss more than anything else but he á excused himself and said that it was impossible.  I really felt á embarassed.
label: shame

text_A: I was very happy when my scholarship to continue studying at UNZA á was approved after it had been cancelled.
label: joy

text_A: When I met an elephant in the bush.
label: fear

text_A: When someone took my pen away.
label: anger

text_A: An officer at the Dean of students office had promised me to give á me a room the next day, but he failed to keep his promise.
label: disgust

text_A: I broke a glass of glycerine at the Z.C.B.C store in Ndola.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was walking around all alone at night.
label: fear

text_A: Being made to look like a fool by a girl.
label: anger

text_A: When I was told that I had no right to control my lover.
label: disgust

text_A: Getting very low marks in mathematics.
label: shame

text_A: When one of my lovers told me that I was a flirt.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was locked out of my room by my room-mate's friend.
label: anger

text_A: When I failed one of my courses at school - the university of á Zambia.
label: sadness

text_A: When the lady who is now my wife accepted my proposal to be my á lover and future wife.
label: joy

text_A: When my neighbour's house was broken into and shots could be á heard.
label: fear

text_A: When a thief broke into my house and stole some valuable goods.
label: anger

text_A: The death of my guardian with whom I had stayed when I did my á grade six.
label: sadness

text_A: When a woman who I respected very much was made pregnant, á unexpectedly by a man of a caliber I never expected.
label: shame

text_A: My father had been involved in a car accident two years ago.  I á was then very scared thinking that he would die as he lay á unconscious in hospital for two weeks.
label: fear

text_A: I felt very angry when a mishanga seller robbed me of the á transport money I had to go to school.
label: anger

text_A: I felt very sad when a friend of mine failed the final exam and á she could not be accepted at the institution of learning.
label: sadness

text_A: I was ashamed when my friend and I were cross with each other á till we apologized to each other.
label: shame

text_A: I felt guilty when I said bad things to my sister, I had not á intended to do so.  She cried a lot and later she fell ill and I á felt responsible for her illness.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was selected to study here at UNZA.
label: joy

text_A: In 1960,  I was going to a school which was near my village and I á met a lion on the way, which disappeared suddenly.
label: fear

text_A: When my wife told me that the refrigerator had stopped working.
label: anger

text_A: When my relatives troubled me so that I would help them á financially.
label: disgust

text_A: When I failed one of the first year's courses.
label: shame

text_A: When I was late for work and told my boss that it was due to á transport problem, whereas the truth was that I had woken up á late.  I thus cheated my boss.
label: guilt

text_A: In 1977 when my friend was caught by a crocodile.  We were á swimming in a river on whose banks our primary school was á situated.  When my friend was caught, he was on the banks of the á river and some of us were still in the middle of the river.  I á was very frightened.
label: fear

text_A: In 1982, I was annoyed at an uncle who was drunk and was beating á up his old father.  He claimed that the father was responsible á for his guardian's failure.
label: anger

text_A: Last academic year I received bad news - my grand-uncle had á passed away.  I felt lonely and bad because apart from the         á biological ties, he was a good old friend of mine at home.
label: sadness

text_A: Last week a former school (secondary) mate of mine, who is now in á a differentt school came to my room here at UNZA in my absence.  á He was drunk and he vomited in my room.  I was unhappy.
label: disgust

text_A: A few years back I had proposed love to a girl who later turned out á to be related to me.  Though we were in love with each other, we á both felt ashamed and withdrew from each other.
label: shame

text_A: When I qualified for form I.  I was one of the three pupils who á qualified for form I that year.
label: joy

text_A: When I learnt that the girl I had impregnated was in hospital and á was on the verge of dying as she had refused to accept the á responsibility of her pregnancy and had wanted to commit suicide.
label: fear

text_A: When I got home I found that the electrical supply had been á disconnected despite my having paid ZESCO the full bill a few  á days earlier.
label: anger

text_A: When I lost my grandmother.  She had been my guardian after the á death of my father.
label: sadness

text_A: When I told a girl that I could not take her out that night as I á was entertaining my mother who had come from home.  However, I á later met this girl with another girlfriend at a hostel where I á had taken out another girlfriend of mine.
label: shame

text_A: When I told the driver at my workplace to lie and tell the boss á that it was not me who was responsible for the delay.  The boss á was very annoyed and the driver was punished and a day's salary á was taken away from him.
label: guilt

text_A: When burglars with guns forced themselves into my house and á ordered me to give them money or face death.
label: fear

text_A: When my colleague spat on my face after a quarrel.
label: anger

text_A: When my elder brother died.
label: sadness

text_A: When my friend, after a beer spree vomitted in my sitting room.
label: disgust

text_A: When it was discovered that I had done the assignment at my work á place, this caused a lot of embarrassment for me.
label: guilt

text_A: When my brother gave me a watch.
label: joy

text_A: When I found my girl in bed with another man.
label: disgust

text_A: When I failed grade 7.
label: shame

text_A: When I was caught going out with another girl by my girlfriend.
label: guilt

text_A: I was working at a certain place and everyday after work dad á would come to pick me up.  One day he did not come, it started á getting very dark and I had no money on me and my home was very, á very far away.
label: fear

text_A: When my grandmother passed away.  We had been waiting for it as á she had been sick for years, but when it happened I found it hard á to accept.
label: sadness

text_A: When my grandmother came to stay with us permanently as she is a á very difficult person to stay with and when she started telling á false stories about us to other people.
label: disgust

text_A: One day when I was working, I went out for dinner with friends á without my parents knowledge and I only came home at 2300 hours.
label: guilt

text_A: I was very happy when I found out that I had passed with flying á colours and that I had made it to the university.
label: joy

text_A: Last night, I dreamt that things that looked like monsters were á trying to kiss me.
label: fear

text_A: One of my colleagues accused me of having stolen his iron and I á was sure that I had done no such thing.
label: anger

text_A: The passing away of my mum.
label: sadness

text_A: One of these people who sell meat in town used a knife to stab á his friend and later carried on using the same knife to cut meat.
label: disgust

text_A: About a dozen girls laughed at me and I was sure that there was á nothing wrong with me.
label: shame

text_A: This is a kind of confession - my mum found me stealing meat from á the pot.
label: guilt

text_A: The first time I really fell in love with a girl.
label: joy

text_A: The time I drove my uncle's car, without having asked for his á permission.  It was the first time that I was driving a car.
label: fear

text_A: When my mum's brother passed away after having been involved in a á car accident.   He was bringing me a present as I had passed my á form five exams with flying colours.
label: sadness

text_A: When I nearly got my fiancee pregnant.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was at a boarding school at Lusaka, the Rhodesian á soldiers came to bomb a house near our school and we saw the á whole scene.
label: fear

text_A: A very close friend of mine was refused entrance to the medical á school.  Her grades were very good and she should not have been á left out.  Biased judgment !
label: anger

text_A: My sister lost one of her twin sons (my first nephews) and then á the older one died a week later.
label: sadness

text_A: When I went to report a stolen good at the police station, the á woman-officer-in-charge was very rude and did not seem to have á respect for anyone.
label: disgust

text_A: I failed to keep a promise and this had a serious effet on someone's á problem.
label: guilt

text_A: When a boy who was drunk came into my room and misbehaved in the á presence of my boyfriend.
label: anger

text_A: My father resigned from work, and soon after this his elder brother á died.  The next day my granny died (my mother's mother).  My dad á remains the only living member of his family.
label: sadness

text_A: When the committee, to which I belong, was accused of having á squandered the money of the association.
label: disgust

text_A: When I went to the library three weeks after it had opened and á found that everyone was busy.
label: shame

text_A: When my friend was punished for something that I had done.
label: guilt

text_A: Some people were sitting outside and saying things which were not á really true.
label: anger

text_A: I came across a woman in town who was very drunk.  She was á swearing at everyone and carried on drinking even though she á could hardly stand.
label: disgust

text_A: I was wearing a slit tight dress at a disco and it burst open.
label: shame

text_A: I had stopped talking to a very close friend of mine.  A week á later he came over to try and make friends with me  again and á from the way he talked I felt that he was a very mean preson.
label: guilt

text_A: When I witnessed a bus accident in which a bus, full of passengers, á  nearly overturned on the Lusaka-Kabwe road.á
label: fear

text_A: When my sister came home late one day and thus disobeyed my á parents.
label: anger

text_A: When I hurt my sisters for no reason at all.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was subjected to a very nasty joke by a group of friends.
label: anger

text_A: When I received my results and found out that I could not go to a á school of my choice.
label: sadness

text_A: I took a girl out once and discovered that she was going around á with one of my close friends.
label: shame

text_A: When I thought that I had failed the examination.
label: fear

text_A: When I discovered that my girlfriend was going around with á another boy.
label: anger

text_A: When my grandfather died.
label: sadness

text_A: When I heard that my sister had shouted at my friend's cousin at á their place.
label: disgust

text_A: When I had lied, saying that I never take bread from the dinning á hall and a friend of mine caught me doing it.  He thus proved to á me that I did in fact take the bread.
label: guilt

text_A: When my girl told me that she loved me more than any male á creature on earth and that I would be the only one in her heart á for all her life.
label: joy

text_A: When a kid dropped my father's radio cassette player, which he á had just repaired.
label: anger

text_A: When someone I love told me that she did not love me anymore and á that she wanted all the snaps that she had given me in exchange á for the ones I had given her.
label: sadness

text_A: When a girl said in my back that we were in love, and she had á actually refused me.  When I confronted her she started insulting á me.
label: disgust

text_A: When I told a lie to a friend of my sister on April fool's day.  á She later came to see me and told me that it was a very foolish á thing to do.
label: shame

text_A: When I learnt that I had been accepted at UNZA.
label: joy

text_A: When thieves broke into my house at night and held my wife and me á on gun-point for at least ten minutes and took away a lot of á property.
label: fear

text_A: When I was beaten up by thieves on behalf of some friends of mine á as they thought that I had a lot of money and would not part á with a few coins for their drinks.
label: anger

text_A: When my younger sister visited me during the school holidays and á told me that she would not go back to school because she was á pregnant.
label: disgust

text_A: When I cheated my father and told him that the school á administration wanted K80 for the purchase of a mini-bus.  Two á months later the school authorities wrote back to my father for á the money.  I could not go back and ask him for the money again á as he had already given it to me once.
label: guilt

text_A: I was at home and we were sleeping when we heard some robbers á breaking into our house.
label: fear

text_A: My elder sister whom I love very much was leaving for the          á West Indies for two years and I was staying behind.
label: sadness

text_A: I took an exam which I failed terribly as I had not studied.
label: shame

text_A: I told my elder brother that he was irresponsible and that I did á not care for what he did because he was teasing me.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was selected to this university despite my having á studyied in difficulty throughout my secondary school days.
label: joy

text_A: The day I learnt that my girlfriend had been going around with  a á close friend of mine.
label: shame

text_A: I was drunk one night and I insulted three ladies.  The following á morning they approached me and asked me the reason behind my á bahaviour, I apologized for my unruly behaviour.
label: guilt

text_A: When I learnt that my brother-in-law had been poisoned by his á friends and that he was dead.
label: sadness

text_A: When I found out that the seat in the coach that I had booked had á been sold to somebody else.
label: disgust

text_A: When money was stolen from my pocket.
label: shame

text_A: When I discovered that the girl I was courting was a relative of á mine.
label: guilt

text_A: My son passed grade 7 and was accepted for form I.
label: joy

text_A: When the robbers broke in, at night.
label: fear

text_A: I wrote an assignment and was given less marks than a friend with á whom I had previously discussed the assignment.
label: anger

text_A: When I got a message that my child was not feeling well.
label: sadness

text_A: I bought something and the shopkeeper gave me more change, I á realized this after I had left the shop and was on the bus-stop - á and I then needed the money.
label: guilt

text_A: When I received the acceptance form for the second year at á university.
label: joy

text_A: The day my parents were involved in a car accident and had to be á operated  and before the operation the doctor said that it was á mater of life or death.
label: fear

text_A: I was disgusted at the way the bus conductor threw out an old á woman oiut of the mini-bus simply because she could not pay the á fare for her luggage.
label: disgust

text_A: This last August when my parents dropped me off and moved me into á college I didn't know anybody here; I was 17 and Berkeley really á scared me.
label: fear

text_A: The same as for SHAME and DISGUST. I was asked to resign my á sorority which I did because I was ashamed.
label: sadness

text_A: When I got fired from a job because I gave a discount to a á friend.
label: guilt

text_A: Whenever I think of enrolling in Organic Chemistry.
label: fear

text_A: I saw in a movie a block on which affluence and poverty existed. á I saw that the rich made no attempts to help the poor.
label: anger

text_A: I felt disgusted at my teams poor perfomance prior to league á play.
label: disgust

text_A: I received a grade above average on a midterm (chemistry) and I á expected onevery below average.
label: joy

text_A: Someone signed up for a workshift at the co-op where I live and á she did not want to work the switchboard. I became very angry. á She had mentioned earlier that she wanted and needed the á workshift to me so I did not sign up.
label: anger

text_A: I saw someone that I thought I knew repeatedly drunk. I do not á like to be around alcoholics.
label: disgust

text_A: I blew up at someone for being confused and because of his á irresponsibility and afterwards I felt guilty and that I had no á right.
label: guilt

text_A: I was river rafting in Nev. and our boat tipped over and I was á sucked under in to some rocks and got stuck and all I could think á was that I was going to die. And it was so quiet under the water á it seemed like no one would care or remember.
label: fear

text_A: I was watching a sunset after my latest boyfriend left me and I á realized that we would never watch sunsets again, probaly never á see eachother again and none of it mattered.
label: sadness

text_A: My third grade teacher caught me cheating on a spelling test. I á couldn't spell Australia and she said in a loud voice something á like \We don't have cheaters in my class\"."
label: shame

text_A: When I was 5, a few of my friends and I would light matches for á fun. One of my friends confessed to her parents and my parents, I á guess, knew or suspected I was involved but I said I knew á nothing about it.
label: guilt

text_A: I felt extreme joy the day I was baptized. I was one with God.
label: joy

text_A: I felt fear when my friend and I broke into an abandoned military á base in Los Angeles this summer. I feared because I didn't want á to be caught.
label: fear

text_A: I experienced anger most recently when I had committed a sin á which I had gone a week and a half without doing. I had made a á vow to God and had blown it. Now I had to start all over.
label: anger

text_A: I last really felt sad when I left home for I was leaving all my á long time, pre-kindergarten relationships behind.
label: sadness

text_A: When I just took a shower with a girl down the hall. I felt that á I had let my devotion to God go out the window. Although nothig á happened I felt ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: When I committed the sin of immorality mentioned before.
label: guilt

text_A: A few weeks back, as I was in a hurry to leave the house, I left á some of my things lying around.  This is something I never do. My á uncle,who lives with us, as we live in a joint family, remarked that á we were always doing things like  this.  This really got me mad.
label: anger

text_A: A friend of mine had said something about not liking to come to á my place just before coming to my place.   In the meanwhile I got á to learn about this from another friend of mine and when she á arrived at my place I really treated her badly.  I was later á ashamed of the way I had treated someone when the person was at á my place.
label: shame

text_A: A few days back my mother was not feeling too well and still did á all the house work.  I felt guilty as I had not offered to help.
label: guilt

text_A: When I passed the B.A exams and my parents allowed me to carry on á my studies and do a M.A. , I was very happy.
label: joy

text_A: When my aunt died.
label: sadness

text_A: When I got 1 mark in an Abnormal Psychology exam.
label: shame

text_A: When I passed the B.A exams with 1st class.  I was the first in á the family to have got a 1st class, so all the family members á were very happy and they gave me the opportunity to study á further.
label: joy

text_A: When I dreamt that my family was in trouble and was facing many á difficulties.
label: fear

text_A: When my brother got very low marks in the exams, I was very angry. á I put my studies aside to help him, as every time my brother does  á badly at school, my family members blame me as well.á á
label: anger

text_A: During a class I was asked a question which I did not hear very á clearly, so I gave an answer which was not related to the á question and everyone started laughing at me.
label: shame

text_A: Once I woke up in the middle of the night and felt frightened as á everyone else was sleeping and I could not even go to their á room.
label: fear

text_A: [ It irritates me when people talk about me behind my back.  I    á prefer people to tell me what they have to, on my face instead á of talking behind my back.]
label: anger

text_A: [ When friends and colleagues talk bad about me.]
label: sadness

text_A: At work when I did not get the full co-operation of my colleagues á to complete an assignment.
label: disgust

text_A: [ When I acted against my mind or conscious.]
label: shame

text_A: In 1980 when I was in the 12th standard, we had arranged a small á picnic in Kandala.  One of my closest friends wrote a small and á cute poem for me, which expressed the feeling of closeness we had á for each other.  I was very thrilled and I can still remember it.
label: joy

text_A: Once I was caught by thugs aged between 20-35, they asked me to á surrender all the property I had and I remember feeling very scared.
label: fear

text_A: One night we, all the family members, were sitting in the front á corridor of the house when a gentleman looking person came in.  á He was my father's client and he had come to bribe my father in á connection with the proceeding case.  At my father's refusal he á abused my father, my brother and I could not control our temper á and we rushed at him.
label: anger

text_A: [ Never felt the emotion.]
label: shame

text_A: [ Never felt the emotion.]
label: guilt

text_A: I met my friend and he gave me a wonderful present as it was my á birthday.  I enjoyed having that present.
label: joy

text_A: When I lost a wallet while travelling, since it belonged to the á group I was very afraid.
label: fear

text_A: My notes were not returned to me, it kept on being á procrastinated.
label: disgust

text_A: I was misbehaving in the agency.
label: shame

text_A: A friend of mine got encouragement and I did not, as the á supervisor did not like me.
label: guilt

text_A: When I got the scholarship letter from Australia.
label: joy

text_A: When going to the exam.
label: fear

text_A: [ When I do not get any co-operation from my friends/partners.]
label: anger

text_A: I had known the girl for a few months when I proposed to her and this á put an end to our friendship, as from then on we started á withdrawing from each other.  I liked her very much.
label: guilt

text_A: When my elder sister had a baby girl.  She was the first girl in á the family after 19 years of baby boys.
label: joy

text_A: When our school was raided by the pupils of the boys secondary á school who beat us up.
label: fear

text_A: One evening when a boy who was drunk made a pass at me by trying á to kiss me.
label: disgust

text_A: I was very happy when I passed and went to form I.  It was a á great relief for me as I had been very worried considering the á large number of pupils who fail.
label: joy

text_A: When a close friend of mine who was with me in first year could á not make it to the second year.
label: sadness

text_A: When I failed one of the tests because I had not worked hard á enough.
label: shame

text_A: The first day that I was close to a dead body, in my third year á at UNZA, school of medicine.
label: fear

text_A: When I got to know that my father had passed away.
label: sadness

text_A: When I received the first year results as the first year had á involved a lot of work and I was very pleased when I got the á results.
label: joy

text_A: When mother was very ill, I feared that she would die.
label: fear

text_A: When a boy, who was drunk, insulted me in front of a crowd.  I á was stopped from punching him for it.
label: anger

text_A: When a student accused me of having stolen his textbook  as he á had found a form bearing my name in his other books and all my á explanations fell on deaf ears.
label: disgust

text_A: The computer at school had left out my name along with four á others and I had no rights for one year.  So I was happy to find á my name on the medical schhol list.
label: joy

text_A: We were driving on a very dusty road at night and the driver á tried to overtake a very big truck only to find another big truck á parked right in front.
label: fear

text_A: I had gone on a vacation and my mother left home without leaving á me any thing - money to come back to school.
label: anger

text_A: I was eating in the dinning hall and some women joined me.  I á could not eat with them so I left the dinning hall.
label: disgust

text_A: When my friends and I were caught with our girlfriends outside á the school grounds when I was at the secondary school.  We were á caught by the headmaster.
label: guilt

text_A: I had been very weary all week - no letters, no phonecalls, no á visitors and then my younger sister came with some cheese, a card á and some pocket money for me; and she told me that she was á working now.
label: joy

text_A: I went to the shopping centre to buy something and saw packets of á Kapenta  with maggots in them. Oh !
label: disgust

text_A: When my girlfriend left me to go out with another guy, even á though she knew that she was wrong.
label: anger

text_A: When I bought new clothes and put them on.
label: shame

text_A: When I went to my first dental appointment.
label: fear

text_A: When my girlfriend was afraid and anxious the day before taking á her exam.
label: sadness

text_A: When my room-mate made a mess of the room after having drunk the á whole night at a graduation party ceremony.
label: disgust

text_A: After I reluctantly refused to dine with a certain man on the á same table.
label: guilt

text_A: When I entered the dissecting room for the anatomy class and saw á several dead bodies lying on the benches.
label: fear

text_A: I was in love with a very beautiful girl and when I went back for á my holidays I found her wth another guy who she said was just a á friend.  Later I found them together and was convinced that there á was something fishy.
label: anger

text_A: When I heard that I had got the best result in school and would á be definately selected to the university of Zambia.
label: joy

text_A: When I entered the dissection room for the first time and was á exposed to preserved dead human bodies.
label: fear

text_A: When I realized that I was in hospital after a car accident and á that I had a scleral tear in my left eye.
label: sadness

text_A: When I did not do well in the PG310 test I, I got only 4 marks á above the pass marks despite my effort.  I felt bad because quite á a number of friends did better.
label: shame

text_A: When I realized that not all my friends like the comments that I á pass in their presence.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was accepted into the medical school.  Medicine is a á profession that I have desired ever since my childhood.
label: joy

text_A: When the time came for me to see dead bodies and to operate on á them.
label: fear

text_A: When I was accused of having planned my friend's outing at á secondary school (boarding) as we were not allowed to go out.
label: anger

text_A: When I realized the burden it was for my mother to look after all á of us, all by herself.
label: sadness

text_A: When I heard that a woman of my community had aborted and got rid á of the foetus by throwing it in the drain.
label: disgust

text_A: When I blamed my failure to the bias and favouritism in the        á marking system, in fact I had not worked hard enough.
label: shame

text_A: When my friend ended up pregnant by a gentleman whom I considered á to be good and faithful but he ended up neglecting her and not á bothering about her.
label: guilt

text_A: When I heard that I had been selected fot the first year at the á university of Zambia.  This was after my form five at Chikola á secondary school.
label: joy

text_A: When I took the first year university exams and made a lot of á mistakes in the P110 exam.  I was afraid of failing and thus á being unable to go to the school of medicine.
label: fear

text_A: When my brother-in-law's brother stole my clothes when my á brother-in-law and I had gone to cut wood for the fire.
label: anger

text_A: When my darling found me walking hand in hand with another girl á whom I loved also.
label: shame

text_A: When I was chased by a big dog near my house.
label: fear

text_A: Being hooted at when I was learning to drive.
label: anger

text_A: When my grandmother died - having to see my mother weep.
label: sadness

text_A: When I saw a drunk man urinate upon himsellf and he seemed to be á thoroughly content with it.
label: disgust

text_A: When I had to walk home from the bus-stop in a skirt that I had á soiled.  It drew a lot of attention and they all seemed to want á to see the blood stains.
label: shame

text_A: When I heard the examination results and when I recovered after á having been sick for a week.
label: joy

text_A: When my mother was seriously ill and had to be admitted to the á hospital.
label: fear

text_A: When someone took my things without having asked for my á permission.
label: anger

text_A: When my father passed away.
label: sadness

text_A: When I did something naughty and it lead to the embarrassment of á my parents.
label: shame

text_A: When I lied to the physiology teacher.
label: guilt

text_A: When I learnt that I had been accepted at the medical school.
label: joy

text_A: I witnessed a scene in which two women were abusing each other.
label: disgust

text_A: One morning after breakfast I was still not satisfied.  My nephew á (a small boy of 2) had not eaten his breakfast and just when I á was taking a bit of his share someone walked in.
label: shame

text_A: I was to take a test and I had not made the necessary preparations á until it was too late.  There were two days to go and I still had á not done much.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was selected to the university of Zambia.
label: joy

text_A: When a few girls were talking rubbish about me.
label: anger

The anger came when the senile doctors found out á 4 weeks later that I had 2 stress fractures in one foot and á should have had crutches. I was in distinct pain and barely could á walk to classes. They said it would be better in 2 weeks.
label: anger

text_A: Losing my job that I had for 4 summers. I took it personally and á cried for 6 hours off and on. I wanted to hide away and did for a á few days.
label: sadness

text_A: I borrowed a gold bracelet without the girl's knowledge. I had it á for so long I had to keep it. To this day I feel ashamed at á myself for having it. I never wear the thing anymore.
label: shame

label: guilt

text_A: It was the weekend of my homecoming. I saw my sister for the á first time in 3 months. She's my best friend and extremely close.

label: disgust

text_A: When I did poorly on a test and I knew that there wasn't an á excuse for not doing better. Made mistakes I could not believe I á made.

label: anger

label: shame

text_A: When I drove partially across the country with my father. We á stopped in a few towns and stayed overnight in motels. The joy I á got was from the feedom I felt and the real beauty of the á country.

label: sadness

text_A: Once when I was babysitting for some neighbors children I found á roaches in ther bathroom. I had never seen a roach before but I á called my mother to make sure that's what they were. And she came á over and checked.
label: disgust

label: joy

text_A: Physically fighting with my girlfriend because she just walked á out of a room of my friends and had pushed and cursed at me when á I went to find her.

label: disgust

text_A: I had just masterbated with another boy.

label: joy

label: fear

label: disgust

text_A: Fooling around with this guy I did not know.
label: shame

text_A: Not noticing my roommates quietness or a sign of discomfort.
label: guilt

label: joy

text_A: While I was away for the weekend some friends went into my room á and played my very expensive stereo without asking me or my á roommate.
label: anger

text_A: I bought a possible answer to a homework problem which was á completely inapplicable to the question due to my not having read á about the subject matter.
label: shame

text_A: Lately I've felt guilty because I'm folling behind in my classes á and not studying much.
label: guilt

text_A: Returning to school and rejoining my girlfriend after 3 months of á separation from summer.
label: joy

text_A: Waiting for my girlfriend to come from her apt. to mine. She was á very late and I thought something awful had happened.
label: fear

text_A: Finding out that my grandfather had died. He lived in England and á I had not seen him for 10 years.
label: sadness

text_A: My boyfriend and I were getting dressed up and putting make-up á on to go to a Halloween Party. We were dressing up to be two á mimes. It was very enjoyable and I thought we looked really good, á it was an accomplishment. We were alone in his house.
label: joy

text_A: I needed a recommendation for something. I decided that the best á person to get one from was a professor who I had never talked to á before. I felt a lot of fear going up after class to ask him to á recommend me considering he had never heard my name before. But I á did.
label: fear

text_A: I had been searching for housing for Fall at UCB and I was á finally offered a place - then an ordeal followed, first I á accepted then refused - related to my parents judgment (they're á paying for me). Turns out that I was so upset at what my Dad said á to me that I hung up on him. He called back and threatened to cut á me off financially and emotionally.
label: anger

text_A: We got news that my (almost) 21 years old brother died while á visiting Europe of a cerebral hemorhage. It finally hit me an á hour after we saw his corpse in the coffin. It felt like a door á between himself and everything had closed and locked forever.
label: sadness

text_A: I was reading in the paper the feature on Henry Lucas who claims á to have killed 380 people. He was a recreational killer and a á necrophiliac and zoophiliac. He has raped and beaten many women á and killed men too.
label: disgust

text_A: The people on my floor last year were very close. This year 4 of á our best friends live together in an apartment. My boyfriend and á I dropped by on one of their birthdays and stayed for dinner. Two á other people had already been invited and I felt uncomfortable á and unwanted. Then I realized I was the one who always called á them and they rarely call me.
label: shame

text_A: I was talking to my mom on the phone and she told me that she had á just gotten an award that day in front of all these people and á she asked me if I wanted her to send me the article in the temple á newsletter to me. I said no very quickly and felt guilty for not á being more interested and hurting her feelings.
label: guilt

text_A: When I found our my mother didn't have cancer.
label: joy

text_A: I was alone and someone tried to break in from our back door.
label: fear

text_A: When some friends betrayed my friendship.
label: anger

text_A: Defying my parents and staying out all night when I wasn't á supposed to.
