text_A: I felt guilty after I battered to death a classmate of mine.
label: guilt

text_A: I was drinking coffee in a cafe and I found a piece of scrubber á in my cup.
label: disgust

text_A: A neighbour complained about smoke from my backyard incinerator á entering his house after a change of wind direction. I lit the á fire after originally checking that the wind would not blow the á smoke in that direction.
label: guilt

text_A: When I committed a sin mentioned in ANGER. A sin of sexual á immorality.
label: disgust

text_A: My sister in law was about to have a child, and there were some á problems.  They had to do a Caesarean.  After a while, everything  á was all right.
label: joy

text_A: When my mother threatened me with thrushing me of the stairs, when á I once more should make a comment.
label: fear

text_A: I was fearful when I realised that the relish was overcooked á simply because I was not keen enough at checking whether there á was still enough water in the relish or not, instead I was just á playing with my friends.
label: fear

text_A: I got into a tight pair of trousers and examined myself in the á mirror.  My back looked unpresentable and I felt ashamed at my á wanting to wear those clothes that day.  I quickly changed into á another dress.
label: shame

text_A: I have a two-month old baby.  When I came here, to the á university, to attend lectures, I had to leave the baby with his á father.  I felt guilty.
label: guilt

text_A: A terrible fight that I provoked with my friend.
label: fear

text_A: When I saw a spider.
label: disgust

text_A: When my term paper was evaluated.
label: joy

text_A: [ No response.]
label: guilt

text_A: When I beat up a stupid boy who was fond of cracking jokes on me.
label: guilt

text_A: One morning I was standing at the bus-stop and the bus passed by á without stopping, even though there were only 8-10 passengers á inside.  I felt angry at the rude behaviour of the bus driver and  á conductor.
label: anger

text_A: Insulted by classmate in public.
label: shame

text_A: Saw a father beating up his small child.
label: sadness

text_A: A large german shepherd dog ran and barked at me (he didn't bite á fortunately).
label: fear

text_A: I was severely reprimanded for a trivial offence in front of á members of my peer group while still at school.
label: shame

text_A: Being together with my best friend.
label: joy

text_A: I saw a neighbour, from the same appartment block as me, lying    á on the road.  He could have been injured or ill.  I kept 20 á metres away and did not go to help him.
label: guilt

text_A: I forgot to zip up my trousers, this was not noticed by anyone.
label: shame

text_A: When I heard that my father had passed away.
label: sadness

text_A: The same event described under FEAR - in the bus a man sat beside á me, with his trousers open and holding his penis.
label: disgust

text_A: This happens to me when I am not prepared in a given subject.
label: shame

text_A: Afraid of getting alone without friends, without anybody.
label: fear

text_A: When I heard that my girlfriend was getting married to another á person, I felt very sad.  That day I did not eat anything and á kept thinking of her all day long.
label: sadness

text_A: When I met friends I had not seen for the last 2-4 years.
label: joy

text_A: When my ex-boyfriend didn't want to sleep with me anymore and I á insisted. We made love but he felt very badly and I felt guilty.
label: guilt

text_A: When I talked with a teacher yesterday who, to say the least, was á rude and unwise and had irrelevant opinions about a friend.
label: anger

text_A: My classmate always borrowed my notes and would not return it to á me on time.  When I had a test she was selfish and irresponsible á and so delayed my studies.
label: anger

text_A: When I told my uncle a false story - that people had stolen the á books from my room and I demanded money from him.  When he found á out the truth I was in trouble.
label: guilt

text_A: Just before I started my study I had to move, I was very afraid á to be left alone and that I could not manage it.
label: fear

text_A: Borrowed someone else's towel without asking.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was walking on the street, I slipped on the dung of a dog. á I did not fall down, but I felt disgusted by the bad smell on my á sole.
label: disgust

text_A: While dining with some accquaintances I was asked something á which I should have known but I did not know.
label: shame

text_A: Normally my father never tells vulgar jokes, we do not speak á about sexual things, too. But once he told such a vulgar joke, á that I was really disgusted. He did not tell me, but some of his á friends, but I was present.
label: disgust

text_A: I was stood up for a date function by someone who I really cared á for.
label: anger

text_A: I prayed unfaithfully.
label: guilt

text_A: Going out for dinner, or during one ice-cream and four spoons.
label: shame

text_A: I had promised to say goodbye to a person who was going on a á trip, and I did not turn up.
label: guilt

text_A: It was the first time I met him (my boyfriend Mr.W).  It was á during the first term Summer vacations.  We met each other while á handing in our homework.  He invited me have a trip with him and á we were together till 8 P.M.
label: joy

text_A: When I passed the 12th standard board exams.
label: joy

text_A: Once a week I work as a volunteer in a biologic garden. this work á in the garden and the contact with other volunteers filled me á with joy. They also gave me support after I failed passing my á driver's test.
label: joy

text_A: Every time I do not write something well in English.
label: shame

text_A: I got caught shoplifting a package of gummy bears.
label: fear

text_A: Finding out some people had been talking about me at my back.
label: disgust

text_A: As for disgust.
label: anger

text_A: When a person saw that I was accused of something I had not done á and did not do anything to defend me.
label: disgust

text_A: When I see that some people remain cold and egoistic with regard á to close friends, even in situations that those friends need á them.
label: disgust

text_A: When my parents work very hard and get tired - while I go to á school and study instead of helping them. I feel that I'm letting á them down, disappointing them.
label: guilt

text_A: When I stepped on a snake at home, it was dark but there was á moonlight.
label: fear

text_A: While watching an entertainment program in which there was a clever  á and amusing sketch.
label: joy

text_A: I felt it when I saw a colleague of mine eating like a beast. At á the same time he was making gestures, speaking and making the á hell of a noise.
label: disgust

text_A: I felt disgust after watching a picture on television about á torturing political prisoners in India (this happened in the á India of Indira Ghandi).
label: disgust

text_A: At Christmas night there was a good movie on television which I á wanted to see for years. I was whining about it till someone told á me it was very childish. Then I felt shame.
label: shame

text_A: When I made acquaintance with the parents of my boyfriend for the á first time. They spoke Limburgian (a dutch dialect) and one of my á first remarks was that I disliked Limburgian dialect.
label: shame

text_A: Social situation - at the pub - a close friend of 2 years told á the group around us of advances I had made.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was with someone I love.
label: joy

text_A: A girl, who is a friend of mine was having an affair with a boy á who is also a friend of mine.  I got to know that this girl was á also seeing another guy.  Later on, she just broke off with this friend á of mine without giving any explanations.  This made him sad and á depressed, and I felt disgust for this girl.
label: disgust

text_A: I was angry at a University tutorial when an ignorant loudmouth á persisted in trying to dominate the conversation.
label: anger

text_A: I had an important amount of money with me and felt fear of being á assaulted.
label: fear

text_A: They wanted me to pay for a ticket twice because they said that á the one I had was out of date.
label: anger

text_A: When criticizing something about a person and then realizing that á the person whom one is talking to is similar.
label: shame

text_A: I had a quarrel with my father. He was depressed, because á somebody had treated him injustly. As we had an argument, it was á impossible for me to help him.
label: guilt

text_A: When I found out that the girl, with whom I was in love, loved me á too.
label: joy

text_A: The last day of school is traditionally celebrated by singing a á song about all the students who are leaving.  In the song á about me, there were things which irritated me a lot.
label: anger

text_A: One day my boyfriend put my hand on his penis and I felt well, á but after I felt a guilty conscience because I hadn't thought á about the consequences that this could have brought if I had gone á farther.
label: guilt

text_A: During a family reunion, they started talking about me wearing an á ear-ring.
label: shame

text_A: My grandmother died.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was feeding a premature baby (7 months), the baby chocked. á This was when I was working in children's ward I thought I had á killed the baby.
label: fear

text_A: I had to terminate a training because I wasn't suited for it. I á was very sad about this, because I very much wanted to finish á that training.
label: sadness

text_A: When I don't justify the confidence of people that I respect.
label: guilt

text_A: I had arranged with a friend to go with him to Carinthia by car. á We had arranged a place where to meet. I was a bit late and my á friend had left already. I had no money to go by train. I nearly á started to cry because I was so angry - it was very important for á me to go to Carinthia.
label: anger

text_A: I quarrelled with my younger sister because I had said something á against her boyfriend.  Consequently she looked through me when á she saw me as she thought that I was trying to separate them.  á She had misunderstood me.
label: sadness

text_A: Being sexually assulted on a bus.
label: anger

text_A: Car accident, hurt three of my closest family.
label: guilt

text_A: It was winter/spring and the ice was melting.  I was far out on a á jetty and I poked the ice with a long branch to try and break it. á  The branch went through the ice and I fell in, the water closed á in over my head.
label: fear

text_A: When my elder brother, who had gone abroad to study  for six á years, came back home safe and in good health.
label: joy

text_A: At a party I met a girl who drew me to her, told me some nonsense á and always wanted to kiss me.
label: disgust

text_A: I saw a report on T.V news on apartheid in South Africa.
label: anger

text_A: When my mother was angry with me over my friends and boyfriend.
label: fear

text_A: My friend misunderstood me.
label: anger

text_A: I took french leave to do my homework.
label: guilt

text_A: Iqam chosen for your lecture and my best friend is not. Now he is á angry with me and I cannot help him.
label: sadness

text_A: Finding out that we cannot have good references because China is á poor.
label: sadness

text_A: Sitting alone in a quiet room concentrating on things happening á around me which pleases me.
label: joy

text_A: I am filled with gloom and sadness at the death of a person.  á More specifically, I felt sad after hearing the news of a á death of a person who was hale and hearty and full of life, withá vigour and plans for the next day but had no next day to cherish it.
label: sadness

text_A: When I meet old past pupils of mine - and find they are all doing á well - I feel joy. Yesterday I met a young woman (20 yrs) I'd á taught her at 6 yrs, then at 12 yrs and hadn't seen her for last á 3-4 yrs; she was no longer a waitress but a meter maid for á Council.
label: joy

text_A: When I was faced with writing an essay and I didn't want to do it á I was angry that I had to write an essay and angry at myself for á not having the time to write a good essay.
label: anger

text_A: When I insulted my young sister for a very little misconduct of á putting on my shoes. She wrote me an apology letter and the á message she included made me feel guilty.
label: guilt

text_A: The mother of a friend of mine passed by me and saw me sitting á on a boy's lap.  I tried to greet her but could not help á blushing.
label: shame

text_A: When the person I am going out with let me down in a situation á that I was depending on them, and didn't show respect or care.
label: anger

text_A: I experienced joy when I got the results - I had made it to the á second year.
label: joy

text_A: Sometime back, my boyfriend and I were having a walk nearby my á parent's house. Suddenly we met my grandfather and I was á afraid that he would report to my parents.
label: fear

text_A: When I have suffered a terrible fit of eating, that frequently á occurs. Then I eat everything, I act like a glutton I eat big á amounts of food, sometimes even half a loaf.
label: shame

text_A: I had stolen a bottle of rum from a person who knows me well. He á threatened to call the police if I did not pay 500 Shillings.
label: anger

text_A: When a member of the family complains about the food that is á served, it disgusts me.
label: disgust

text_A: [ No response.]
label: shame

text_A: My grandfather died, I went to the mortuary and saw the corpse.
label: sadness

text_A: My old boyfriend - yes the same one - asked me out. We had a good á time. Then he asked me out the following week. He actually took á interest.
label: joy

text_A: When my special friend said \I love you\" for the first time."
label: joy

text_A: Once I bought my sister a pair of sports shoes as she was going á to join an athletic meet.  However the shoes were a little big á and had a few flaws.  She muttered all the way and blamed me for á having wasted her money anf I felt guilty.
label: guilt

text_A: Shame of being reprehended.
label: shame

text_A: Felt I had not appreciated my parents enough. Regretted the á problems I'd caused.
label: shame

text_A: Doing poorly on a midterm.
label: disgust

text_A: I was angry when my sister began to talk nonsense and to laugh at á the way I swept the room.  My anger grew (I tried to control á myself).  After telling her to leave me alone, I vented my anger á on her as she did not obey me.
label: anger

text_A: When my former boyfriend and I reconciled and he decided that I á was very important to him. I had always wanted us to get back á together again, but had doubted the likelihood of this, so I was á very happy when my small amount of faith was vindicated.
label: joy

text_A: When I entered the dissecting room for the first time. I think I á felt disgusted mainly because of the bad smell of formaline.
label: disgust

text_A: I did not like it when a little girl was crying for her dead á mother and was calling her by her name.  I was sad.
label: sadness

text_A: A relative died.
label: fear

text_A: When my family heard that my Mother's cousin who lives in á England wrote us to tell that he had cancer of the lymph glands.
label: sadness

text_A: A very, very close friend of mine used to come to my room to      á see me and I naver bothered to pay him a visit.  One day he asked á me the reason behind this and I gave him a shirt.
label: guilt

text_A: When I played in a chess championship, I was disturbed by other á people. I asked them to be quiet, but in vain.
label: anger

text_A: Being insulted on a bus.
label: anger

text_A: Flicking through a magazine showing pictures of homosexual men á committing various acts.
label: disgust

text_A: I was on a farm with a few friends and during the talk I á discovered that a friend of mine, was being betrayed by her á boyfriend and a 3rd friend of ours.
label: anger

text_A: When it became clear that a man had used many people sexually á and psychologically, despite the fact that many people looked up á to him.  I understood that one could not trust him and I was á forced to hide this for a while.
label: anger

text_A: I felt guilty when I failed to take an exam though I had had á enough time to read for it but I hadn't made use of it.
label: guilt

text_A: I was walking outside the union refec after rain when I tripped á and fell.
label: shame

text_A: Walking along the beach with a friend (another girl), talking, á picking up shells, laughing, chasing seagulls.
label: joy

text_A: Fear of sexual overtures from a close relative in the family.
label: fear

text_A: When an intimate friend of mine passed B.A with first class and I á got only pass class.
label: shame

text_A: When I was getting up, I found a live cockroach in my bedroom.
label: disgust

text_A: When my daughter was born.
label: joy

text_A: I was swimming in the sea and a wave took the top part of my á bikini away.
label: shame

text_A: We are repainting rooms in my house. My mother started to enact á plans to paint my room without consulting me.
label: anger

text_A: When I was successful at my work I was full of joy.
label: joy

text_A: When I flew out to my mother and made rude remarks because I felt á so tense (studied too hard for an examination).
label: guilt

text_A: My son lives in the country. I feel sadness when I see mothers á having walks with their children.
label: sadness

text_A: When a friend told me a story and I stayed dumb because I had no á story to tell.
label: shame

text_A: When I was given detention at secondary school.
label: shame

text_A: At a party I saw two persons having a fight. The aggressions and á the hate between these persons produced an unpleasant impression á on me.
label: disgust

text_A: When in the end of a semester I got the approval in a matter that á I judged very difficult.
label: joy

text_A: I was very hungry and just wanted to start eating when a friend á called me who usually talks for a long time. I was angry because á I was prevented from eating.
label: anger

text_A: My boyfriend promised to take me to see a game of tennis and rang á saying he was going to the pub with some of his friends instead.
label: anger

text_A: Not thanking relatives for a favor done.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was a child I often quarrelled with my younger sister. á Once I became so angry that I slapped her in the face. She cried á and shouted so that my mother came in and scolded me.
label: guilt

text_A: When I heard that a close relative of mine had given birth at a á very young age, in a very remote area and had had very few problems.
label: joy

text_A: I met my present boyfriend on a boat trip to England.  We had á said that we would call each other when we got back to Sweden (we á were not going to the same town in England).  As soon as I walked á in he called from England as he could not wait till he came á home.
label: joy

text_A: Almost always when I go to fetch the results of an exam.
label: fear

text_A: My bed sheet (present of my parents) damaged by roommate.
label: anger

text_A: A friend came to visit me and I was not there.
label: guilt

text_A: I told my friend something confidential which was supposed to á remain between the two of us.  The next thing that happened was á that a girl who is not even close to us came laughing and askad á me to tell her about it.  I was very angry with my friend as I á had trusted her.
label: anger

text_A: I gave my mom a gift she wanted for years. I raflected her joy.
label: joy

text_A: When my room-mates were watching video-tapes and prevented me á from watching the news.  The first feeling I had was that I was á being treated unfairly and then came the feeling of anger.
label: anger

text_A: I talked to my boyfriend on the phone when I was in high spirits á and had a lot to tell him.  I had been looking forward to this á conversation and he did not listen to me to the extent that I á had anticipated.
label: sadness

text_A: I experience a sense of guilt as my middle son cannot express á himself like other children, neither verbally nor in writing.
label: guilt

text_A: A couple of years ago during the summer holiday, I was fishing at á a lake with my husband.  Suddenly it started raining while the á sun was still shining. I experienced a feeling of joy, happiness á and fulfillment.  the whole nature was full of music.
label: joy

text_A: When my best friend died, at the age of 16.
label: sadness

text_A: I didn't attend lectures.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was dismissed unjustly from the firm where I worked, á because there where persons that didn't have problems, and á wouldn't miss in the jobs they occupied if they were dismissed.
label: anger

text_A: When I was going downhill on skis, and fell down twice the first á time.
label: shame

text_A: In a lift a drunken, fat and untidy man tried to make advances at á me.
label: disgust

text_A: [ The same as in anger.]
label: disgust

text_A: At a friend's birthday party with some of my closest friends.  It á was all very pleasant and one could say that I was happy to have á such good friends.
label: joy

text_A: I was complaining about calling people whom I didn't know. I á forgot that the purpose is to invite people for dinner and get to á know them.
label: shame

text_A: My fear appeared in the form of jealousy. I was afraid that my á girl-friend had fallen in love with another man, I was afraid to á lose her.
label: fear

text_A: I felt guilty after stealing a cookery book from my colleagues.
label: guilt

text_A: [ No response.]
label: joy

text_A: I felt guilty one day when I stole a slice of bread in a á cafeteria.
label: guilt

text_A: Some boys deliberately played tricks on me in the experiments.
label: anger

text_A: Falling in love although she is my friend (angry with myself).
label: anger

text_A: One evening I was watching the news on TV. Again they were á talking about the danger of war. Suddenly I imagined what it á might mean for me, for my friends, for the people close to me. I á felt it a very near and possible event.
label: fear

text_A: It was my birthday and all the members of the group made me a á surprise in a public place at 10 p.m. giving me flowers and suvenirs.
label: shame

text_A: When I could not find my 2 year old daughter.  I ran and looked á for her everywhere and could not find her.  (I finally found her, á she had gone to bed to sleep)
label: fear

text_A: I can't remember ever feeling shame.
label: shame

text_A: In cinema I saw a film which showed how a person was torn out his á guts when he was still alive.
label: disgust

text_A: During a dance someone slashed my tires and dumped paint on my á car. I had four other friends with me that I drove and á furthermore it was raining.
label: anger

text_A: Waiting for my marks in a difficult subject.
label: fear

text_A: When I go out alone at night.
label: fear

text_A: When I failed an exam unfairly.
label: anger

text_A: When I betrayed my former girlfriend.
label: guilt

text_A: I remember being sad whe my aunt's child died (2 days old).
label: sadness

text_A: When I learned that a friend of mine had not been speaking to her á boyfriend for a week after an argument because of unfounded á jealousy.
label: sadness

text_A: Once as a school girl I was copying at a class work and my á teacher spotted me.
label: shame

text_A: My father stayed abroad for one year. He does not like to write á letters because he makes ortographic mistakes. I never had a good á relation to him. He wrote me a letter in which he said that he á loved me.
label: joy

text_A: When I was a school girl and I copied at a class work.
label: shame

text_A: Discussing with a certain person about a job I was getting and á that perosn was negative and pessimistic.
label: anger

text_A: I confused a girl with another.
label: shame

text_A: I felt guilt because on account of my ambitions I nearly turned á my sister out of my parents home.
label: guilt

text_A: When my dad passed away.
label: sadness

text_A: When my grandmother passed away.
label: sadness

text_A: When I entered at the University.
label: joy

text_A: The day I woke up to find that a kitten I had wanted to keep had á been eaten by the neighbour's dogs.  It had been locked out by my á wife who claimed that it had dirtied the sheets.
label: sadness

text_A: Breaking up with a girl.
label: sadness

text_A: When I saw a film in which the man suffered from an illness and    á his skin came peeling off.
label: disgust

text_A: Recent break-up with my girlfriend. We had been together for over á a year. I was overseas and discovered over the phone (while I was á at work).
label: sadness

text_A: Once I went home totally drunk and roused all our neighbours from á sleep.
label: shame

text_A: When ditched - divorced by husband.
label: shame

text_A: I sensed a strong feeling of joy when in the plant, at my working á place, I got a message that I was admitted as full time student at á the Higher Agricultural Institute.
label: joy

text_A: I felt this when I was copying homework for one of my classes.
label: shame

text_A: Forgot to turn up on prescribed day for jury service.
label: guilt

text_A: One evening I went fishing with some friends but we could not á fish as a fisherman had already put his net there.  We pulled á out the net to find only crabs in it so we threw the net away.  á The net was large and may have cost $1000.  The fisherman used á the net to earn a living and we had had thrown it.
label: guilt

text_A: Someone borrowed my textbook and deliberately did not return it.
label: anger

text_A: I had always been first in my class and in the preliminary board á exams I scored the highest marks.  Then the exams were á postponed and I neglected my studies as I was confident.  However á when the final results came out I felt ashamed as I had scored á less than 60% marks and my rank in the class was fifth or sixth.
label: shame

text_A: My sister forgot to bring presents for my birthday, I was rude to á her.
label: guilt

text_A: I did badly in the mid term examination.
label: shame

text_A: In the last day of carnaval I met a boy and began to flirt with á him. I was in love with him. When he introduced me to his friends á I died of shame because I was with them before, I met my á boyfriend in carnaval.
label: shame

text_A: I kicked the chair in the classroom to express my anger.
label: guilt

text_A: Once, when I arrived home very late, my parents had an argument á because of this; my mother wanted to stand up for me.
label: guilt

text_A: I was walking down a little village at night.  There was nobody á in the steet.  A dog began to bark, I felt that it was following á me.  Then I began to run, the other dogs started barking too.  At á last I arrived home.
label: fear

text_A: Once I lied to my parents and this made me feel very guilty.
label: guilt

text_A: When I saw the certificate results, I did not feel very happy as I á did not realize that I had got all the credits until my á classmates pointed it out to me.  My parents and my relatives á praised me and I realized that my results were good i.e 2A, 5B, á 2C.  I felt satisfied with the results and was happy.
label: joy

text_A: When my father's car got stolen from me. (A 1966 Ford Mustang - á very hard to replace).
label: guilt

text_A: When my mother and father were on an excursion in Chechoslovakia á and I was at a student camp and I heard over the radio about the á events that were taking place there.
label: sadness

text_A: Someone talking about me at my back.
label: anger

text_A: I took a math midterm and I knew I did really well and it was á Friday so I felt great joy because the week was over and I did á well on a test.
label: joy

text_A: The sudden death of one of my parents.
label: sadness

text_A: When I got a stereo walkman from my father when he had finacial á difficulties. I thought that although he promised to give me that á present, he was not obliged to do so.
label: joy

text_A: [ No response.]
label: anger

text_A: When I had to travel alone, unescorted for the first time.     It á was an over-night journey by train to a distant place.
label: fear

text_A: When I got my fingers stuck in one of the side holes of the door, á in the tube.
label: shame

text_A: After closing the front door I realized that I had left the key á inside the house. I felt even more guilty since it was not my own á house but the house of people I hardly knew.
label: guilt

text_A: I felt sad when I heard that my cousin had passed away just á suddenly.
label: sadness

text_A: Stopped at lights in Mangere late one Friday night on way home á from work. Alone in car when someone came up behind the car and á started banging and shaking it. Light was red and had nowhere to á go until light changed. When green I took off.
label: fear

text_A: When I stated sharply something I was not very sure of and a few á days later I was shown to be wrong.
label: shame

text_A: When I failed some tests my first year at CAL.
label: shame

text_A: I had the unexpected possibility to see a friend I like very á much.
label: joy

text_A: Leaving Melbourne to move interstate - leaving relatives and á friends behind.
label: sadness

text_A: Enrolling at varsity, being told I couldn't get in to certain á papers.
label: sadness

text_A: [ An unfair punishment.]
label: anger

text_A: When my father died.
label: sadness

text_A: A girl dropped some stuff from her bag and when I tried to help á her I realized that she had used me and I was made to look like a á fool.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was still a child I was told off in face of other persons á for having touched an object that didn't belong to me.
label: shame

text_A: When I was in the sauna bath.
label: joy

text_A: When I saw that my bed at the hostel was a mess I guessed that á someone else had used my daily necessities.  I felt that my  personal á sanity had been affected.
label: anger

text_A: When I got into a bus I found that my wallet had been stolen. á It was not a great loss from the monetary point of view but I á lost some documents - identity papers.  As a result I had to á spend several days in order to get a new one.  I will always á remember all the work I had to do and the bad treatment I á suffered because of the bureaucratic behaviour of the civil á servant.  I had already had bad luck and they treated me like a á criminal.   At one point of time I really wanted to quarrel with á them.
label: anger

text_A: Someone told me that he would stay at my home for one night. á Therefore I made big efforts to make everything ok (food). One day á before he cancelled the appointment because he had to go to á church with his parents.
label: anger

text_A: At the railway station, while waiting for the last train at night á I noticed that a drunk young man was appraching me in a á purposeful mannner.
label: fear

text_A: Someone told me we are not as good as the All English Class.
label: anger

text_A: When we had swimming instruction, we had to take a header from á the springboard. I usually refused to do that, but at least I was á forced to.
label: fear

text_A: Railway station good-bye.
label: sadness

text_A: Close friends talking badly of other friends.
label: disgust

text_A: A close person lied to me.
label: anger

text_A: When I got myself the kind of girlfriend I had been hunting for a á long time.
label: joy

text_A: When I felt alone and without love.
label: sadness

text_A: One of my friends and I had breakfast in a restaurant. It was á spontaneous and lots of fun.
label: joy

text_A: My grandfather died thirteen years ago.
label: sadness

text_A: One day I found an incontinent man in the ward. This patient had a á guardian who couldn't give him a bath. So I just left him like that á but felt guilty until I went back to give him a bath.
label: guilt

text_A: In Punjab, when in the name of religion people killed each other á during the agitation.
label: disgust

text_A: I was to meet one of my friends (girl) at the library at 8:00 á already dark. She would be walking alone. She was 45 minutes late á but I kept waiting, calling her room and other places she could á have been.
label: fear

text_A: I heard that a former superior of mine had died, I was later at á home home reading about it in the newspaper and I thought of our á interaction and how it was no longer possible.  The limited scope á of human life is sad.
label: sadness

text_A: Held under water by a large wave and thought I was drowning.
label: fear

text_A: A relative not acting on her promise.
label: disgust

text_A: My grandfather's funeral.
label: anger

text_A: Thinking of the unknown, what happens at the moment of death, á etc.
label: fear

text_A: Some time ago I promised to meet an acquaintance of mine and to á carry him some promised papers. I haven't done it until this day. á Now I feel quite awkward when I meet him.
label: shame

text_A: Before the examn.
label: fear

text_A: When my last year's second semester results came through - I was á ecstatic.
label: joy

text_A: When one's studies seem hopelessly difficult and uninteresting.
label: sadness

text_A: Dad had just married his second wife (my step-mother) and I did á not like her so I went to the wardrobe and set fire to her á dresses.  Eveyone suspected my brother and he had to bear the á consequences.  Nobody ever got to know that it was me who had á done it.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was going home, I saw somathing which looked like a snake   á on the road but later I found out that it was only a stick.
label: fear

text_A: Somebody went around spreading news that I like people with á money.
label: disgust

text_A: My father was away from home and he did not come back when he was á expected, he came back several hours later than expected.
label: fear

text_A: Nothing.
label: disgust

text_A: Like guilt - the most ashamed I have ever felt was when I began á to feel guilty about having sex with my boyfriend when it was á only \the thing to do\", and not really an act of love."
label: shame

text_A: I was sitting on an electric swing, suddenly the machine went á out of order while I was still in the upward position.
label: fear

text_A: My father was very angry with another man in the presence of my á friends.
label: shame

text_A: The day some friends of mine and I decided to go to Galicia on á holiday.
label: joy

text_A: Misunderstood deliberately by a close friend.
label: anger

text_A: The time I first saw my cousin who is living in Tanzania.
label: joy

label: shame

text_A: We were riding in a friend's car.  He was driving very fast and á suddenly a another car crossed the road in front of us.  My á friend had to turn the car rapidly.
label: fear

text_A: I read a book about torture. The book described exactly how the á torturing was done.
label: disgust

text_A: Telling friends about how my parents had been treating my á brothers and sisters unfairly.
label: shame

text_A: When my honest intentions were marred by another's jealousy.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was at an official meeting I asked a question to a person. á His response was not directed at me but at the chairman.
label: anger

text_A: A man whom I like, was drunk and tried to molest me.
label: disgust

text_A: Spoilt, smashed and molded potatoes in the fridge, and having to á clean up the dish later.
label: disgust

text_A: The day I learnt that I had been admitted to the university.
label: joy

label: guilt

text_A: When approached by a gang of youths in town at night.
label: fear

text_A: A sense of guilt before my parents when I had to discountinue my á studies in the first year because of unpassed exams.
label: guilt

text_A: A relative of mine had come to see my husband to talk to him á about a problem concerning his sister and me.  I was angry á because this relative of mine did not dare to speak to me and á instead spoke to my husband.  I got to know about it later the á same day.
label: anger

text_A: China winning the Asian Olympic games (TV).
label: joy

text_A: My brother lost his temper and started smashing things in the á house.  I was quite scared, that something terrible might happen, á till the situation was brought under control.
label: fear

text_A: I don't remember about a situation when I have experienced this á feeling. Maybe it was when I saw a drunkard in the street.
label: disgust

text_A: Brother provoked anger. It was when mother and father were away á and we had to look after ourselves. He accused me of being á selfish and a snob.
label: anger

text_A: When my room-mate was making noise deliberately, by playing a á flute early in the morning while I was trying to study.
label: anger

text_A: When my grandfather died, I saw my grandmother crying against my á aunt's shoulder (I had never seen my grandmother cry before).
label: sadness

text_A: Finding out about the university does not have enough foreign á currency to buy the yournals in your reference list.
label: sadness

text_A: I was at the cinema with my sister and her boyfriend.  A man á sitting beside me started to stroke my leg for a while, he left in á the middle of the film.
label: fear

text_A: When I arrived home late at night.  I know that my mother gets á worried and this made me feel angry.
label: guilt

text_A: I went to the apartment of my boyfriend and saw some people á before his door. I thought that something had happened.
label: fear

text_A: We were just about to go into the Exam room and I didn't see all á my writing materials plus the identification card from the place á where I left them.
label: anger

text_A: At the age of 16 I had gone to see a film in a nearby village, á about 8 kms  from my home.  I started walking as there was no á bus.  I had to cross hills and as it was dark I could not á identify the path.  Half way through it started raining and as á there was no shelter I ran four kms to reach home.
label: fear

text_A: Once while crossing a road I was overcome with fear.
label: fear

text_A: When I excreted on the mat instead of the potty.
label: shame

text_A: When I think now about the way my father behaved when filing a á divorce.
label: disgust

text_A: When I wanted to kiss a friend and didn't succeed, I felt shame.
label: shame

text_A: My father accused my brother of having bumped his car, and it was á wrong.

text_A: When I was teased by my friend for not scoring good marks in the á exams.
label: anger

text_A: I caught a huge eel on a fishing line which I had pulled into the á boat. I cut the line and threw the whole lot back into the water. á Later that day and about ten miles away I went swimming and á someone made the comment wondering how far eels could swim, I á abruptly ended swimming for fear at an unseen eel for a few days á until we had left the district.
label: fear

text_A: At a party in which I met an interesting female. We enjoyed á eachothers company, while slow dacing.
label: joy

text_A: I missed the last tram home and had to walk in the pouring rain.
label: sadness

text_A: Motorcycle accident with two people involved, running off the á road. Broke an arm, only.
label: fear

text_A: A teacher at my former secondary school forced my darling to á marry him.  The girl tried to refuse but her parents would not á leave her alone.
label: anger

text_A: I once drank too much alcohol and became very ill. This was in the á presence of my friends.
label: guilt

text_A: One day I was chatting with children at home. Then I took a lump á of soap and gave to one of them pretending that it was a sweet. I á thought the child would realise that it was not. Unfortunately he á did not and he put it in his mouth.
label: guilt

text_A: I felt sad when my first boyfriend and I left each other. It was neither á his fault nor mine.
label: sadness

text_A: I was awakened by a dream in the middle of the night. I dreamt á that a stranger was in my house.
label: fear

text_A: When I was told that they had got tickets for me for a film á marathon I wanted to see.

text_A: Remembering (at the time I did not feel guilt) in recent yrs. how á angry I would get when I was babysitting my new brother and he á would not stop crying. I did not do anything harmful or shocking. á But I feel guilty for treating him the way I did especially á since I adore him now. That's why I spoil him now.
label: guilt

text_A: This situation happened when I was found kissing a girl who was á my friend's girlfriend.
label: shame

text_A: When I met my girlfriend again in another town after a long á separation.
label: joy

text_A: Getting into this university.
label: joy

text_A: [ No description.]
label: guilt

text_A: When I witnessed an accident.
label: disgust

text_A: Selling my used car.
label: joy

text_A: A person died (not really a friend).
label: sadness

label: shame

text_A: When during Winter the water pipes froze and we did not have any á water for two days.
label: anger

label: anger

text_A: A good friend deceived me. Because of that little quarrel our á relationship finished, mainly because she was not honest. I was á very angry about that.
label: anger

text_A: After being depressed because of a very bad relationship, my á first love called me and told me that he would always care for me á no matter what I did.

label: anger

text_A: During a fight with my best friend.
label: anger

label: sadness

label: disgust

text_A: In an examination ,which other students found easy I could hardly á think and did not know what to answer.
label: shame

text_A: When I heard the news that my grandfather had died.
label: sadness

label: sadness

label: sadness

text_A: When I heard the news that my brother had passed away.  It was á the first time that I lost a brother.
label: sadness

label: guilt

text_A: Meddlesomeness of my mother about the way I live. She thinks I am á to free in my behavior for instance when a boyfriend stays the á night.
label: anger

text_A: After I had given the wrong answer to my students they pointed á it out to me and I had to correct myself.
label: shame

text_A: When I came for the lesson, it was cancelled and I had to fill in á a questionnaire instead.
label: anger

text_A: I had reacted angrily at a friend for no fault of his.  I had á raised my voice and had not cared for his opinion.
label: shame

text_A: We were writing Primary school leaving Examinations when I had á fallen at the steps going into the Exam room.
label: shame

text_A: When I sided with my mother in a quarrel she had with my father á before they briefly separated.
label: guilt

label: fear

label: anger

label: fear

text_A: I had climbed on a cherry tree alone and there was a thick á caterpillar beside my fingers. I feel disgusted by caterpillars á and snakes. I was terribly afraid of the caterpillar crawling on á my fingers. Out of the fear I was almost unable to climb down.
label: fear

text_A: When I made an excuse to get out of participating in an important á family occasion that I should not have missed.
label: guilt

text_A: I went shopping with my parents - my father payed everything for á me, I was very glad.

label: shame

text_A: Not doing my share of the work for the house job.

label: anger

label: anger

text_A: Participating in a theft several years ago.

text_A: Lecturers being unfair to me in reports.

label: guilt

text_A: When I almost fell down from some rocks because I had been acting á foolishly and playing dangerously.
label: fear

text_A: [ I feel disgust at people lying.  It means that they say one á thing to one person and the same thing in another way to another á person and this makes people quarrel among themselves.]
label: disgust

text_A: A truth expressed unthinkingly at a coffee party.  I realized á later that I had been inconsiderate, at a wrong moment and the á wrong place.
label: shame

text_A: When my girl went away for a holiday without saying good-bye to á me.
label: sadness

text_A: I don't use to lie to my parets about what I do, and the two á times that I felt anger were when they doubted me I said that I á was going to the club, and they didn't believe me because the day á before they had met me at FLIPERAMA. I had the wish to kill them.
label: anger

text_A: When I was walking along a road alone on my way to go shopping.
label: fear

text_A: At work a boy was injured because of my lack of supervision.
label: guilt

text_A: When a girl did not answer a question, concerning my love for á her, put forward to her.
label: sadness

text_A: My schoolmates were teasing a pupil who was not able to defend á himself very well; I should have taken his part.
label: guilt

text_A: I hate hypocrisy. My friend (girl) tried to intrude into my á affairs with my future husband. After that she behaved as if á nothing had happened.
label: disgust

text_A: Having my luggage checked at Customs.
label: fear

text_A: When I didn't bring my girlfriend home one night. Later she told á me that a cardriver solicited her.
label: guilt

text_A: When in a difficult moment I couldn't express myself correctly á and my thought came out with distortions bringing about highly á negative and distorted results.
label: anger

text_A: When my parents separated temporarily and I was left behind with á my father.  As I loved my mother I wanted to go with her.
label: sadness

text_A: Before a hospital visit prior to a D&C under anasthesia for an á expected miscarriage.

text_A: I was disgusted with the behaviour of one of my fellow students á during my Secondary School life. He was a habitual noise-maker á and caused great conflicts with the teachers.

label: guilt

text_A: After having finished my B.Sc, I was struggling hard to continue á my studies and had taken the M.SC exam.  I was not sure that I á would be selected in the written exam.  When I saw my name in the á selected candidates list I was overjoyed.
label: joy

text_A: During the Christmas holdidays I wanted to invite my brother, his á girlfriend and their child for dinner. When I said to my á brother's girlfriend that I would like them to come at my place á for dinner, she refused and never mentioned it again as if I á had never asked her.
label: anger

text_A: Once I was alone at home. I suddenly felt unwell and there was no á one to help me and call First Aid.

label: disgust

text_A: When I saw a horrible movie - Alien.
label: fear

text_A: My boyfriend had drunk too much and beaten me. When I had to show á the letter the door, which was almost crashed, I felt ashamed.
label: shame

label: sadness

text_A: When I caused needless anxiety to a person close to me because of á my lack of self-insight.
label: guilt

label: sadness

text_A: When the man I loved decided to leave me forever.
label: sadness

label: shame

text_A: When I forgot my mother's birthday.
label: shame

label: disgust

text_A: When I think about the short time that we live and relate it to á the periods of my life when I think that I did not use this á short time.
label: sadness

text_A: [ No response.]
label: fear

text_A: I felt guilt when my friends were punished to slash grass at the á gound because of making noise in class. I was in the group of á noise-makers but I denied having done any noise.

label: joy

text_A: When I learnt that I had been admitted to the university.
label: joy

text_A: When I think about my family (parents, brothers, sisters) guilt á is a part of my feelings.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was small, I would always fight with my younger sister and á one time I hit her and knocked the wind out of her. I felt real á bad about it.

text_A: When I shot a bird in the head with a shotgun.
label: guilt

text_A: Telling my parents that I did not get into a good university.
label: guilt

label: joy

text_A: When my father banned me from going to his sister's home due to á some misunderstanding between the two.
label: anger

text_A: I was walking down a road and suddenly a few dogs appeared at a fence á and started barking angrily.  They were jumping and it seemed á that they would come for me any time.
label: fear

text_A: After a long time (of no communication with him, physical á illness and worry) my lover came to see me, when I least expected á to see him.
label: joy

text_A: I insulted a couple of good friends of mine and even tried to hit á them when I was drunk.  The next day, I was ashamed of course.
label: shame

text_A: When I heard on the radio that the football match in Belgium had á ended in a catastrophe, and several people had died.  I could not á  understand how normal people could behave in such a way.
