label: joy

text_A: One time I was injured when I was playing football at School in á Blantyre. I was brought to the hospital while my leg was totally á swollen. The x-rays confirmed there was no fracture but á collection of blood n the muscles. I feared when they started to á incise the swollen part with surgical blade.
label: fear

text_A: Being told that I have not got a personality.
label: anger

text_A: When I had slept with a boy for the first time I felt ashamed for á three reasons. First, because I was only 13 years old, second, á because I did not really like him, third, because he had caught á me napping.
label: shame

text_A: I was selected to come here (University, College) when I was least á expecting it.
label: joy

text_A: When my boyfriend said he did not want to see me anymore (which á turned out to be untrue).
label: sadness

text_A: I felt happy at the settlement of our marriage, even though we á are from different socio-linguistic backgrounds our parents á agreed to the wedding without any conflict or discussion.  We had  á thought that they would object to the wedding but it did not happen.
label: joy

text_A: Father lost his temper at home because he was mistreated at work.
label: sadness

text_A: Nearly caught masturbating.
label: shame

text_A: Talking to someone I disliked.
label: disgust

text_A: Disgust of drunkers and of blood.
label: disgust

text_A: I was all of the sudden sad when I heard that my cousin who á usually paid school fees had passed away after a very short á illness.
label: sadness

text_A: I had a little cat which was very sick. As I liked it very much I á went to a veterinary with it. He told me how to tend it and it á really recovered its health. Everybody said that I had saved its á life.
label: joy

text_A: I was raped once when I went through a dark alley at the back of á our house. The man pushed me in the bushes. I fought back and á succeeded to escape.
label: fear

text_A: Having been angry and unpleasant towards my parents.
label: guilt

text_A: Saw someone licking his dining bowl.
label: disgust

text_A: When I had a good result in the certificate examination.
label: joy

text_A: My teacher reminded us not to do a Summer job, however I did it á for two months.  Yesterday I was chatting with my teacher and á when we talked of the Summer job, I felt ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: When on a car journey a fellow student crossed our way with his á own car and we had to bump into a roadside trunk.
label: anger

text_A: When I pass exams, or when a close friend of mine recovered á from an illness,etc.
label: joy

text_A: When they stole my dark blue tennis.
label: anger

text_A: When I called my boyfriend he asked me if I would live with him.
label: joy

text_A: I had taken the responsibility to do something and I had á prepared for it.  However I failed because of my timidity.  After á three attempts I still could not adapt to the atmosphere and á failed as before.  I felt imcompetent and felt that the others á would think that I had not prepared for it.
label: sadness

text_A: The first time I slept at my boyfriends house and had to walk á down the hall to the shower in front of his housemates. I felt á they were judging me.
label: shame

text_A: After my car accident, when I woke up in a heap of stones.
label: fear

text_A: I was 4-5 years old when I hid the bicycle keys of a not very á good friend.  After a few hours I pretended that I had found á it.
label: guilt

text_A: One day before Christmas, I went shopping with my brother and his á friend. We had a good time. But on the way home we were almost in á an accident because the weather was bad.
label: fear

text_A: When my mother's new husband treated her and my brothers and á sisters badly.
label: disgust

text_A: I had too much homework and examinations and I did not know how á to organize my work.
label: anger

text_A: When I slept for the first time all alone in the house where I á live now. A man phoned me at 2.00 am. He wanted something from á me. I was afraid.
label: fear

text_A: A terrible cloud-burst started when we were camping in a tent on á a great bald field.
label: fear

text_A: Went to a movie with a date, walked on the beach (in Alameda) á spent some time afterwards in her apt.
label: joy

text_A: My mother read a letter that a friend of mine had written to me á telling me how she had got drunk the last time.
label: anger

text_A: When I began dansing, the teacher came and told me that I was á very good and would soon get into the ballet academy.
label: joy

text_A: My roommate being nice to a party leader in order to get into the á party.
label: disgust

text_A: I do not like one of our neighbours as they are very selfish.  á Whenever they want something or need help they come to see us,  á otherwise they do not even bother about people who live next to á them.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was accused of having impregnated someone's daughter, it á was the girl's cousin who had done it.
label: disgust

text_A: At a lack of love of my father for my mum, sadness for him more á than anyone else because he does not realise how much love and á happiness there could be between them, and is, and how much he is á damaging himself apart from mum.
label: sadness

text_A: A colleague asked me to study with her. I could not explain á things as perfectly as she had expected. So she reacted in an á aggressive manner.
label: anger

text_A: Negative statement concerning me of a friend before strangers.
label: disgust

text_A: I was most disgusted when I had to make a nagging three day á journey recently from Calcutta to Bombay.  It was very boring and á tiring.
label: disgust

text_A: When I didn't pass the examinations for FUVEST I felt myself á guilty for I should have studied. I had the opportunities, and á I drew them out.
label: guilt

text_A: When I had not prepared my contribution to the group as á thoroughly as the other members, with the result that the á overall result was poor.
label: shame

text_A: When I was taking an exam in grade 5.  The examinator found me á with a note-book and accused me of copying, All the students á laughed at me.
label: shame

text_A: Car accident in the middle of the night.
label: fear

text_A: I went shopping with my mother and sister (17 years old). Mother á always told my sister what she should buy. Instead of assisting á my sister in defending herself against mother's interference, I á just behaved aggressively towards my sister.
label: guilt

text_A: With the girl whom I may be loved truly. When she refused to come á with me to an occasion (she was from another town).
label: anger

text_A: Failed to recagnize a friend on the street.
label: shame

text_A: I was living at home during the Summer vacations and towards the á end decided to take some of my clothes and other belongings to á the appartment in Guttenburg.  When I had finished I went to my á ex-boyfriend's (relationship uncertain) home and stayed there á till 5 A.M.  I had to leave then as my parents needed the car for á work in the morning.  My parents do not like my boyfriend.
label: guilt

text_A: An item which belonged to a friend of mine was missing.  I had á taken it earlier and I thought that I had returnrd it so when he á asked me for it I stubbornly refused having it.  Later when I á looked for it, I found it in my room.
label: guilt

text_A: I passed successfully the preliminary exam for a participation in á the children Assembly.
label: joy

text_A: A friend of mine goes out with this guy. She sleeps with him but á is quite happy for him to play around - as well as herself.
label: disgust

text_A: Disgust at a girl I know for continually feeling sorry for herself á and never acting positively to do something about her problems.
label: disgust

text_A: When I saw a good friend again after not having seen her for a á long time.
label: joy

text_A: My parents are divorced, father pays alimony for me. Two years á ago my sister who lives with father, suddenly asked mother for á money. As she considered the amount of money my mother offered á her too small, she brought an action against mother. I was á terribly angry with my sister.
label: anger

text_A: I feel guilty when I should have done something at any rate but I á haven't done it.
label: guilt

text_A: Before getting back the results of a test in school, when I had á worked very hard and was worried about not succeeding.
label: fear

text_A: Sadness, no, I felt something much stronger when my father died.
label: sadness

text_A: I feel disgusted with toadies, hypocrites, chameleons.
label: disgust

text_A: My friend had many female friends and I thought that they were á his lovers.  I would scold him but he did not accept my advice.  á Later I learnt from his girlfriends that this was not true.  I á felt ashamed at having misunderstood him.
label: shame

text_A: In the traffic I insulted a man who crossed my way. Afterwards I á paired with him, and felt shame because of mine lack of pacience á and ridiculous attitude.
label: shame

text_A: Mad at my dad.
label: anger

text_A: I had an appointment with a colleague of mine to give her my á lecture notes. I couldn't go and I didn't send them, and so the á girl missed a day for the preparation of her term exams.
label: guilt

text_A: [ I have not felt this emotion yet.]
label: fear

text_A: When I had an anticipatory honey-moon with my fiancTe.
label: joy

text_A: After an oral examination I shook the professor's hand, but he á had only stretched it out for my ball-point-pen.
label: shame

text_A: I was disgusted at myself when I dropped a vital catch, while á playing a cricket match, and we lost the match; though the catch á was difficult.
label: disgust

text_A: When my boyfriend came back after being away for 10 days.
label: joy

text_A: A nightmare.  I was dreaming about bloodsuckers, which I tried to á shake off from my body, they are everywhere, they get glued, they á suck.  And there are a lot of them.  I panic.
label: disgust

text_A: That was what I felt when I was finally accepted in the Bulgarian á Conservatorie after I had applied a couple of years.
label: joy

text_A: When a boy I hated most in our classroom took my T Jersey from my á desk and put it on.
label: disgust

text_A: When a boy put a handful of cooked potatoes down my dress and á there was no water to clean up.
label: disgust

text_A: When in grade 3, late home from school every day for weeks á because of harassment from a grade 7 boy I lied to mother about á why I was home late.
label: guilt

text_A: I was subject to false accusations, and got very angry.
label: anger

text_A: Fights that I see in the middle of the street, robberies, fear of á darkness when going home.
label: fear

text_A: At a cash desk where I had gone to buy 16 rolls of kitchen paper á at a reduced price.  After queuing with screaming children; it á turned out that I had taken two 8 roll packets instead of the one á 16 roll packet to which the rebate applied.  The assistant said á \You will have to get it another time.\""
label: anger

text_A: When I read the diary of the girl with whom I was living, it was á about another boy with whom she had been going around some time back.
label: sadness

text_A: When two female classmates and I were having lunch, we chatted and  á cracked jokes, I was very happy.  However, I felt that I may have  á said something inappropriate which might cause them to have a bad  á impression of me.
label: joy

text_A: I was filled with joy when I heard that I had passed my Secondary á school leaving certificate exam.
label: joy

text_A: Before going to school I usually take something to eat right at á school and this time I took Father's money without him knowing á it. I felt guilty and I returned the money.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was robbed in a bus.
label: anger

text_A: The day that there was a black-out in the city, and I was in an á exposition, I felt fear that something more serious was á happening, like a revolution for example.
label: fear

text_A: A friend started to insult another person without reason and I á felt ashamed of her behavior.
label: shame

text_A: When I hit my young sister without a valid reason.
label: guilt

text_A: When passing the final examinations for social worker.
label: joy

text_A: The death of my father, even though we had not been very close to á each other.
label: sadness

text_A: While drinking a soft drink, I had the impression of swallowing   á a piece of glass so I went to the district hospital and got á admitted there.
label: fear

text_A: I remember when I was a child of a storm that made me terribly á afraid. I thought that the house was coming down and that in the á next day I would be dead. Everybody was awake and I stayed all á night in bed without falling asleep.
label: fear

text_A: Was confronted with a person having negative thoughts of other á people because of their social status, beliefs, color and á outlook on life (perspective).
label: disgust

text_A: [ I can not remember anything in particular.  What I can remember á is feelings of having done or said something which then had á negative consequences.]
label: guilt

text_A: When I was a child, I thought that I had to be ashamed when á asking and doing certain forbidden things.
label: shame

text_A: When I lost the notes of the lecturer I had borrowed from my á friend.
label: disgust

text_A: In the dark an unreal figure formed by a shadow.
label: fear

text_A: When I decided to leave my steady, secure employment to come to á university. Because I didn't know if I could cope with all the á requirements of study and also being older I didn't know if I á would enjoy mixing with younger people, also financial á insecurity.
label: fear

text_A: When my older sister told us that she was thinking of joining the á rest of the family for the winter sports holiday.
label: joy

text_A: When I splashed a child by not slowing down while driving á through a puddle of water.
label: guilt

text_A: Managed to run 30 Km on skis fairly simply.
label: joy

text_A: When my mother rejected my boyfriend and made unfair judgements á on him.
label: anger

text_A: I was living in a flat where things did not go very well for me.  á Finally, they threw me out and this prejudiced people I esteem a á lot.
label: anger

text_A: When I received the higher level exam results, I mistook the á grade E in mathematics for a grade F and I was shocked.
label: fear

text_A: When my aunt went out of her way to help me out with my financial á problems.
label: guilt

text_A: I wanted my boyfriend to stay when he didn't. He stayed but when á he left I felt ashamed because I should have let him leave when á he wanted. I was too selfish.
label: shame

text_A: When I got my drivers licence.
label: joy

text_A: This I experienced when going around with more than one girl.
label: guilt

text_A: It was last September when I felt very sad. It was when I heard á that I was not selected to study in the University of Malawi.
label: sadness

text_A: I was watching TV with a friend. After the first film I wanted to á watch another film on the same channel. My friend switched over á to the other cannel without asking me what I wanted.
label: anger

text_A: Cheating in a minor geography exam at school.
label: shame

text_A: Meeting best friend at the airport (boyfriend) who I had missed á terribly.
label: joy

text_A: When I was a child, I was always afraid of my father. Just when á he looked at me, I felt frightened.
label: fear

text_A: When I knew about my sister's in law finacial situation and what á she was facing.
label: sadness

text_A: When I thought that it was going to be impossible for me to start á studying (due to wrong information from the student advisor).
label: sadness

text_A: I saw a man falling on the walkway. He seemed half dead, and was á immobile. I felt disgust for the people who passed by without á doing anything to help.
label: disgust

text_A: My peers didn't want me to meet someone during rush for fear that á I would give her a bad outlook on our Sororoty house. I shouldn't á have seen this, but they blew and I did.
label: anger

text_A: I felt guilty when I was given a prize which belonged to someone á else.
label: guilt

text_A: When I arrived late at the job and met the most troublesome boss.
label: shame

text_A: I and my friends got acquainted with a guy from Sofia who turned á out to be gay, but we found that out only after 2 or 3 days.
label: disgust

text_A: I had not eaten anything for 2 days to be able to pay the fine á for my fiancT. But he stayed in another town and spent one á thousand shillings in the restaurant during the same time.
label: anger

text_A: Reading a nice book and talking about it to my friend.
label: joy

text_A: When a car is overtaking another and I am forced to drive off the á road.
label: anger

text_A: As we were going to Area 10 a dog chased me. I was afraid it á might bite me.
label: fear

text_A: When I passed my final examination at school.
label: joy

text_A: When I heard the news of my grandfather's sudden death.
label: sadness

text_A: On a holiday in France I made a walk in the woods all alone and á very relaxed. Then a motorbike took me over and I saw the man á watching all the time. Suddenly the man stood behing me and I ran á away fast.
label: fear

text_A: One evening my father told me to go into the cellar and get him a á beer. I was terribly frightened at the idea of a man sitting in á the cellar and assaulting me. For my defence I took an empty á bottle with me.
label: fear

text_A: I let my pet budgie loose to fly around my room one afternoon. A á few hours afterwards I found he was still free, went in and out á of my room leaving the door open. My cat got in and killed my á budgie - this happened to 3 budgies.
label: guilt

text_A: Talking to my close friend.
label: joy

text_A: When I was responsible for getting my friend run-out in a vital á cricket match.
label: guilt

text_A: I was disgusted to find out that the water isn't filtered or á purified before it leaves Latimer Hall from the drains.
label: disgust

text_A: I'm afraid of not being able to go to the school I want because á of suffering grades.
label: fear

text_A: Finding out that I am not ill (not seriously).
label: joy

text_A: When I stole a packet of cigarettes from a neighbour  and the á next day I owned up and returned it.
label: shame

text_A: Having told a certain lie.
label: guilt

text_A: I was very angry when I heard that my brother was beaten by his á friends.á
label: anger

text_A: A and I were walking along the new Asia stairway to the Chung Chi á college for our lecture and I saw him with her.  He put one arm á around her shoulder and laugher brightly and joyfully.  I did not á dare and did not want to look, just walked by them quickly.  The á interest of talking to A disappeared and I just wanted to remain á silent.  But I did not want A to know and so I left him and went á to F.  I should have expected this to happen.
label: sadness

text_A: I was studying in the library and a class-mate told me that she á had obtained a grant to work in the library.
label: joy

text_A: I got a very good grade on one of my midterms a few weeks ago.
label: joy

text_A: I was furious when the teacher pointed out in class that I á was the quietest girl in class.
label: anger

text_A: Left alone in dark when young.
label: fear

text_A: I was sitting at a rock concert, listening to an extremely loud á band. A tiny baby in a crawler had been left by his young mother, á right out in the sun next to a speaker, and was screaming - á probably in pain.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was involved in a car crash.
label: guilt

text_A: I get angry with people who attain certain status without á deserving it, only with the support, authority and influence of á other people.
label: anger

text_A: My brother in law was dying of cancer. To see him wasting away á was very sad.
label: sadness

text_A: Losing my temper with my spouse.
label: guilt

text_A: To force someone to do something that suits me.
label: guilt

text_A: Anger towards my lover for being late.
label: anger

text_A: I felt sadness when I had to get separated from the woman I loved á who had to leave for her motherland.
label: sadness

text_A: When a good friend of mine behaved in a very cool manner to me á for a very long time.
label: fear

text_A: Together with a little brother I biked on a lonely road in the á Polder. Then we were annoyed by a boy on a motorbike: he á took over, stopped, took over, etc. Then we saw he had something á in his hand, we turned until we came across a man, who á accompanied us.
label: fear

text_A: When I study my butt off for a midterm and still get an average á grade.
label: disgust

text_A: When I got really drunk on Norvegian Indipendence Day, and was á not allowed to participate in football (soccer) games for two á weeks. That was very unpleasant.
label: shame

text_A: Death of a parent.
label: sadness

text_A: When I found out that my good friend and roommate did not pay the á phone bill and electric bill like he promised and let me down.
label: anger

text_A: Always when I meet the person I love.
label: joy

text_A: I received a letter from some friends, who do not live in Madrid, á telling me that they would not come on holiday.  I had arranged á everythiing for them.
label: sadness

text_A: Finding out that the university will give first priority to á qualified practioners and clinical years to go to your English á lectures.
label: sadness

text_A: I was ashamed when I was being introduced to the church á congregation.
label: shame

text_A: Criticizing my mother when she refused to drive with the radio on. á I told her that I thought she wasn't intelligent enough to cope á with the radio.
label: guilt

text_A: A few days ago I saw two dandy girls of my age. I disliked their á clothes and their way of doing.
label: disgust

text_A: Found money on the road and returned it to the owner through á police.
label: joy

text_A: My current lover and I had been very busy with work and study and á had not had time alone together for almost a month until one á afternoon recently when we made love for hours and then showered á and ate together.
label: joy

text_A: When the morning newspaper has not arrived.
label: anger

text_A: [ When I act thinking that I know everything and I then realize á that there were things I had not thought about, thus hurting á others.]
label: guilt

text_A: I was sad at the expulsion of some of my comrades during the UNZA á demonstrations.
label: sadness

text_A: This was when I was being followed home every day from the campus, á by a stranger.  He would follow me to the campus and then sit á outside my class.  If I was not there he would ask my friends as á to where I was.  He was a dark, ominous looking person and I was á terrified of him as I did not know his intentions.  I reported á him to the security officer, who turned him over to the police.  á I was even more petrified then.
label: fear

text_A: When my boyfriend did not turn up in time as he promised he would á be coming.
label: sadness

text_A: When my husband talked about the restrictions he will have to á accept in his life to make our marriage work.  I felt that it was á directed at me as it was me who had demanded the changes.  We á were with a marriage counsellor then.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was teasing a girl, who turned out to be my brother's á dame.
label: shame

text_A: [ No response.]
label: fear

text_A: Someone who was speeding was forced to slow down when I pulled á out onto the road and proceeded to abuse me at the next set of á traffic lights.
label: anger

text_A: Death of a pet rabbit. We had to give it away because my brother á became allergic to it. We gave it to a man who kept animals and á lots of other animals for children to watch. We went to visit our á rabbit. It was badly beaten by the other rabbits and eventually á died.
label: sadness

text_A: In the evening, while I was watching TV, my little brother came á in and started eating food he had brought from the kitchen while á I was trying to concentrate on the program.
label: disgust

text_A: I said something especially stupid which I did not mean at all.
label: shame

text_A: Foreign students playing loud music in the night before the á biology examn.
label: disgust

text_A: When I failed to secure employment after my form 5 in Lusaka despite á my excellent certificate.
label: disgust

text_A: When I did not defend my close friend when my father degraded á him. I felt guilty for allowing my father to get away with his á actions and for the hurt my friend felt. I cleared the matter up á with my father a few weeks later.
label: guilt

text_A: When my dog was stolen.
label: sadness

text_A: When I almost drowned myself in the municipal swimming pool that á I use to go almost not excaping.
label: fear

text_A: When people would tell me that my ex-girlfriend was playing á around on me.
label: anger

text_A: I was a bit frightened when it was found that there was something á wrong with my liver. However it turned out that it was not á serious and I need not worry.
label: fear

text_A: I was afraid before I went to the doctor's.
label: fear

text_A: When I discovered that I and my friend would be licensed at the á first call. This emotion was accompanied by a great relief. It á was the coronation of a year of sacrifice and extrene discipline.
label: joy

text_A: At one point in a relationship, my boyfriend was seeing an old á flame more than me. At our confrontation tears were shed.
label: sadness

text_A: When I deliberately engineered a situation to cause tension á between friends so as to bolster the impression one of them had á of me !
label: guilt

text_A: Broken a friend's cup.
label: guilt

text_A: When I found my baby whipped by my Auntie. I was really sad and á up to this moment my sadness is still on.
label: sadness

text_A: I feel shame when I have made a promise, I can't keep it and this á has negative effects which are caused by my behavior.
label: shame

text_A: I broke my friend's badminton racket and she kept quiet about it.
label: guilt

text_A: Heated discussion with spouse concerning new house.
label: anger

text_A: I felt happy when I saw my brother at the bus depot after 3 á months without seing each other.
label: joy

text_A: I was very joyful when I heard that I had passed the standard 8 á exams. The day I heard the news was the day I celebrated my á birthday.
label: joy

text_A: My mother told me that I could not go to the mountains.  Despite á my age, as long as I am in her house I must do what she says.
label: anger

text_A: Finding out that old and useless practitioners of retirement age á will go to your English lectures and they do not understand á English.
label: disgust

text_A: In the student kitchen that we share, somebody drank from my á juice pot (one litre) so that I only got one glass out of the á whole pot.
label: anger

text_A: I felt happy when my mother gave birth to a son who is the last á born in the family.
label: joy

text_A: In a conversation my boyfriend expressed definite and quite á pretentious opinions and he took up an attitude towards a theory á which he himself had never known. His information was from á fortuitous sources.
label: anger

text_A: I got angry at a friend of mine whom I caught reading my notebook á (almanach).
label: anger

text_A: When I was bringing in the shopping and nearly stood on a snake.
label: fear

text_A: When someone whom I considered my friend, without telling me he á was annoyed, proceeded to ignore me for several meets with no á apparent reason.
label: disgust

text_A: I received a letter from my grandmother. She has obviusly á suffered a lot from my grandfather's suffering health. She á mentioned things she had gotten him and he would never use.
label: sadness

text_A: No ideal result in the University entrance examn, guilty to á family and friend.
label: guilt

text_A: My friend and I worked for the community centre by holding a booth. á  One day my friend went off to another booth to play.  This á meant that I was very busy and could not maintain order.  His á behaviour disgusted me.
label: disgust

text_A: A children's film in which I played a clown, with spotlights, á cameras and the director who demanded jumps and guffaws.
label: shame

text_A: My roommate liked to listen to some meaningless songs which had á melody but had no content.  We lived together so when he played á the recorder I was forced to listen to them.  I could not tell á him that I did not like to listen to the songs, as I had no right á to disturb the freedom of others.  So I would find a pretext to á leave the room and go somewhere else.
label: disgust

text_A: Disgust - no. Maybe it is more precise to say revultion at a worm á or a snake. But I mean it in a social aspect when somebody had á behaved like a scoundrel to you, when by his actions he has made á you change your attitude towards him but I thing this feeling the á way I meant it, is not typical for the people interrelations.
label: disgust

text_A: When I met my boyfriend with another girl.
label: disgust

text_A: When I saw my name in the newspaper and I knew that I entered at á the University.
label: joy

text_A: My father called me (behind my mother's back) and told me that my á mother disapproved my behavior in the weekend. However, he didn't á tell me the details and left me with unanswered questions.
label: anger

text_A: The time I went to see one of my girlfriends at Area 18 I found á that she was not there but in the room she was sleeping, in the same á room there were some women visitors with children so the room was á smelling very badly with some faeces and urine in it so I didn't stay á any longer.
label: disgust

text_A: It was in a group situation: suddenly it was my turn to say something,  but I felt that I was not able to express myself very well - I felt á ashamed and blushed.
label: shame

text_A: When I forgot a promise made to a friend of mine.
label: shame

text_A: I have chosen to put my son in a private school were the á examination marks are low.  Every time that he gives me his term á results I am left with a sense of guilt.
label: guilt

text_A: When I take a look into a slaughter-house and when listening to á stories about torturing people or animals.
label: disgust

text_A: A close friend took part in a racist violent action.
label: disgust

text_A: China cannot give your lectures bigger place and sound system.
label: shame

text_A: I feel sadness from the fact that I was not born with a better á appearance.
label: sadness

text_A: When my brother bought me a nice pair of shoes from South Africa.
label: joy

text_A: When I made love with someone who I didn't really love. Sometimes á I even considered him unlikable.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was informed that I had been accepted as a student of á Psychology.
label: joy

text_A: I remember that once, a friend did not co-operate with me due to á some unavoidable reasons.  Unaware of this I treated her unjustly á till I realized everything, and then I felt ashamad of my deeds.
label: shame

text_A: [ No response.]
label: disgust

text_A: In an exam I answered the questions rather carelessly and á afterwards I thought that the exam would have been better had I á answered more carefully.
label: guilt

text_A: After I said something that my boyfriend disagreed with, he á walked away from me without discussing what bothered him. I á became very angry with him for treating me this way. Yesterday, á November 14.
label: anger

text_A: When I got in jungle where there was a great number of snakes.
label: fear

text_A: At my wedding - standing with the man I love and acknowledging á that fact to members of family and friends.
label: joy

text_A: For example, to feel bad because of one's attire, to be among á people who do not belong to the same social class, to give a á wrong answer in class, to be surprised in particular situations.
label: shame

text_A: When armed robbers broke into our house at night.
label: fear

text_A: I am left-handed. When I attended the first form, we learned to á write with pens. I smeared everything I had written. All my á friends had written well and wanted to know why the teacher was á looking at my note-book. I was ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: [ Do not know.]
label: shame

text_A: I overreacted towards my mother and felt ashamed afterwards.
label: shame

text_A: Looking up end-of-semester results, and finding I'd failed three á out of seven (subjects).
label: sadness

text_A: When I tried to breake it up with my boyfriend, and he refused to á let me go.
label: anger

text_A: When an alcoholic stood dribbling over a food counter.
label: disgust

text_A: I was talking badly about a person to some friends, and á discovered that his daughter was listening.
label: shame

text_A: I passed an exam which I thought I had failed.
label: joy

text_A: When I was hungry, I tried to take the money that my mother á had saved up for something else.
label: shame

text_A: I was angry about several drivers who showed an aggressive and á dangerous driving habit.
label: anger

text_A: When I tried to steal a book from the bookshop and was caught.
label: shame

text_A: After hearing about the death of my grandfather.  First I could á not believe it, but later I wept and felt the situation was á hopeless.  I felt lonely and wanted to be consolated.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was doing my last year at Secondary School I was robbed of á my clothes, wristwatch and my pair of shoes. After investigations á it was found that all the things were stolen by one of the boys á in our hostel.
label: anger

text_A: When I quarrelled with a very close friend of mine.
label: sadness

text_A: My father gave money to my brother but not to me.
label: sadness

text_A: When I came to know that my feelings for someone were not á reciprocated.
label: sadness

text_A: I had a car accident.
label: fear

text_A: My parents were out and I was the eldest at home.  At midnight a á male stranger phoned us and spoke to me in a rough language.  I á hung up and heard someone walking outside our door.
label: fear

text_A: I felt guilty at not having practised the piano.  I waste my á teacher's time and guidance.
label: guilt

text_A: When I made love with a girl, which I don't really love. However á I know that she loves me.
label: guilt

text_A: I was playing with friends then I decided to splash some sand á into a car which was moving nearby. The driver got angry and came á to report to my parents.
label: fear

text_A: One night,when I was in primary 5 or 6, I felt thirsty so I á fetched the thermos to pour a cup of water for myself.  Then I á saw my brother lowering his head and I, jokingly, poured the       á water on his head.
label: guilt

text_A: During the lesson the teacher called me and asked me if I had á reported that I was late.  I pretended that I had but looking at á her eyes I knew that she knew that I was lying.  I thought that á it was really bad luck that she had examined the list of the á students who were late.
label: shame

text_A: Time had struck 8 o'clock when I heard from the radio that I had á been selected to Robert Blake Secondary School for Form I. I was á very happy for the selection. My parents and I were very happy á and full of joy.
label: joy

text_A: I had planned to go to town with my friend at 1500 hours but she á went for the registration and I waited for a good 1 and a 1/2 hours.  It á was vital for me to go to town but I could not as it was she who á had the money.  Finally I borrowed some money from friends and we á went to town.  I was really angry with my friend.
label: anger

text_A: Not handing in homework in time.
label: guilt

text_A: We were at a hamburger bar and a man at a table nearby started á coughing and spitting into his plate.
label: disgust

text_A: A friend of mine was hurt as he thought that our relationship was á not the same as before and something had gone wrong.
label: sadness

text_A: When I deeply felt that I could lose the person I love best á because of my foolishness.
label: sadness

text_A: When I felt being treated unjustly by a teacher.
label: anger

text_A: When my brother came back home after staying in hospital. He had á undergone an operation which had been a matter of life or death. á When he came home I could see him smile for the first time after á may weeks.
label: joy

text_A: I once caught a letter in my girlfriend's handbag from a certain á man. I felt anger.
label: anger

text_A: When opened a box of biscuits and found worms inside.
label: disgust

text_A: When I robbed a loop in supermarket.
label: guilt

text_A: I was appreciated by others, especially my family members and my á friends.
label: joy

text_A: Doing poorly on an exam that I thought I should do well.
label: shame

text_A: I felt happy when I received the letter telling me that I had á been admitted to the university.
label: joy

text_A: My parents did not approve my choice of a boyfriend (now an á ex-boyfriend).  He happened to be 13 years older than me and he á was considered completely unsuitable for me.  IDIOT.
label: anger

text_A: Wrongly accused a classmate.
label: guilt

text_A: I had a dream about my fiancTe leaving me and making an end to á our relation.
label: fear

text_A: When I saw the pictures of the draught in Etiopia.
label: sadness

text_A: The lift of Stockholm central station stank of vomit and urine.
label: disgust

text_A: In school I had difficulties mith mathematics. When I had to work á for an examination, I really felt disgusted.
label: disgust

text_A: One day, when I was twelve years old, my brother took some slimy á substance swimming on the surface of a pot of vinegar made of á cider and threatened to throw it at me.
label: disgust

text_A: I found out that someone that I knew had someone else taking á tests for her.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was 4, we spent our holidays at the seaside. My sister and á her friend wanted to go to a bay on an undangerous way. I wanted á to arrive before them and went on a shorter, but more dangerous á way. When I arrived, I found nobody there. I waited for a long á time, but nobody came. On my way back I met my mother who had á been searching for me desperatly. She did not scold me, but I saw á how much she had worried (herself).
label: guilt

text_A: After a terrible quarrel with my family, I withdrew in my room. I á felt guilty because I had caused this scene by my aggressive á behavior.
label: guilt

text_A: When my grandmother after staying with us for awhile went back á home.
label: sadness

text_A: I got to know that I had been accepted at university.
label: joy

text_A: An inter-college basket-ball match.
label: fear

text_A: When I was on holiday someone vomited in front of me.
label: disgust

text_A: I was wearing slippery shoes and I tumbled down in a place where á there were many people walking by.
label: shame

text_A: It was my mother's birthday. My father and I used to buy a á present together. However, now I had bought something together á with my girlfriend and I forgot to ask my father.
label: guilt

text_A: After my +2, when I did not get admission in B.E I felt disgusted.
label: disgust

text_A: I felt it on the same occasion when I felt sadness which finally á grew into anger.
label: anger

text_A: Made a wonderful driend who understands me.
label: joy

text_A: My younger brother destroyed and gave away some of the books that á I had intended to keep for as long as possible.
label: anger

text_A: [ Meeting some new (unpleasant) people or some new, demanding á situation.]
label: fear

text_A: When my brothers were being cruel to my boyfriend, because his á flat-mate bent back one of my brother's fingers. It wasn't his á fault.
label: anger

text_A: On a mountain tour, my girlfriend and I passed by an inn. Near á the house there was a big dog which began to follow us. As my á girlfriend is afraid of dogs, I had to draw his attention to me. á He jumped towards my shoulders and wanted to play with me but I á really did not like that.
label: fear

text_A: I happened to see two boys fighting, one of them fell down and á hurt his head.  The other one used this to spank the head of the  boy on the ground.
label: disgust

text_A: A colleague of mine asked a lecturer to put him a higher mark in á order to keep his good mards and thus to continue getting a á scholarship for an excellent grade.
label: disgust

text_A: When I entered a bar looking for a friend.
label: shame

text_A: When my dog died.
label: sadness

text_A: A teacher was very blunt in his relation to a child so that the á child was very upset when arriving at home.
label: disgust

text_A: Teacher suspected me stealing money.
label: shame

text_A: When my sister (really my niece) died of cancer at the age of 2 á yrs after I took her to the doctor at the age of 1 and he á diagnosed it.
label: sadness

text_A: Came back from surfing to find car broken into and gear and money á stolen.
label: anger

text_A: I felt angry when I failed in an exam about which I knew quite a á few things and I did not deserve to be plucked.
label: anger

text_A: A friend called me and told me that she wanted to come and see á me. She lived in a village at 50 km distance fom my home town. á Next morning I expected her but she didn't arrive. As I got á impatient I called her but her parents told me that she had gone á skiing. I was very angry because I had cancelled an appointment á to be able to see her.
label: anger

text_A: I did not do well in one of the subjects last term.   I was á afraid that I would fail.  My result was a grade D, though it was á not good I still passed.  I felt more comfortable then.
label: fear

text_A: As a result of breaking the indicator light as mentioned á for guilt.
label: fear

text_A: When my little brother asked me to play with him, I told him that á I had no time and that I would play with him the next day. á However, the next day I said the same thing.
label: guilt

text_A: Car accident. I let a 16-year old, incompetent parson take the á wheel and I feel very guilty about what happened even though I á suffered the worst injuries.
label: guilt

text_A: I had applied for a job and they had assured me that the exams á would take place a few months later.  A week later I went to á obtain some more information and they told me that the exams had á already taken place.
label: anger

text_A: When a friend of mine was trying to make a fool out of me.
label: anger

text_A: I remember when I was in Standard 6, I failed one of the terminal á tests and I told my parents that I had passed but after they á found out from the class teacher that I had failed, I was proved á a liar.
label: shame

text_A: When someone I trusted very much, disappointed me.
label: anger

text_A: A certain friend evokes positive feelings, when I am with him but á negative feelings when he is not present. I feel the need to á express those negative feelings. However, when I speak about him, á I always think: Why do I like this, he does not deserve this, but á still I do so.
label: guilt

text_A: Got a package from my parents, without even a small note á enclosed.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was a child I had a grass-parakeet I liked very much. His á legs were crippled so that he could not move very fast. Once I á came into the room, did not notice him and stepped on him. A few á days later he died.
label: sadness

text_A: When I had to walk along a dark road alone.
label: fear

text_A: During the week-end at home, my mother fries greasy and unhealthy á meat dishes which make me feel sick.
label: disgust

text_A: I was jogging in the forest, in the central park area, when I saw á a man hiding behind a tree.  I got frigthened, turned around and á ran out of the forest.
label: fear

text_A: [ No response.]
label: shame

text_A: I work at a day care centre, and one day when the children were á outdoors a four-year old boy disappeared from the yard.  I was á not looking after them then, but as the manager it was me who was á responsible.
label: fear

text_A: When I won an unexpected sum of money.
label: joy

text_A: When I crashed my car.
label: fear

text_A: I am the secretary of an association, and during the last meeting á I forgot to take the minutes.
label: guilt

text_A: A father of 4 children killed in an accident.
label: sadness

text_A: I came across a friend with whom I had lost touch for a long á time.
label: joy

text_A: When someone stole my bike.
label: anger

text_A: Seeing a film in which there were several bloody crimes.
label: disgust

text_A: [ I can positively say that I have never done anything that made á me feel guilty.]
label: guilt

text_A: I lost my grandfather whom I loved very much.  I had not known á that he had been ill for a very time, when I received this á message he was already dead.
label: sadness

text_A: One day my mother went to visit her friends.  When she came back á she scolded me for not having kept the house in order, so I á decided not to talk to her.
label: guilt

text_A: I have been thinking of changing my major for a few months.  My á original major was Chinese language and it blocks my way.  I have á to face many problems at the sametime and I do not know what is á real and virtuous.  I do not know if I am not interested in á Chinese or if there are other factors which make me sad.  I am á not very clear on what I can do for the study of Communication á and Journalism.  I am not clear about what I can do.  What are á the limitations ?   I hesitate but I feel more adjusted now.
label: sadness

text_A: We had arranged a beach party with 20 people. There my father got á drunk I felt very ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: My dog died of a cerebral tumor.
label: sadness

text_A: When I could not complete my assignment on time.
label: guilt

text_A: I broke a cup and put it back without telling anyone about it and á someone almost got blamed for it, then it was discovered that it á was me who had broken it.
label: guilt

text_A: When my parents drove me to a nearby place and went home á immediately instead of waiting a few hours.  They could have á easily waited.
label: anger

text_A: A film on zombies.
label: fear

text_A: A man in a car was following me when I went running early one á morning in a fairly secluded area.
label: fear

text_A: There was a time when my room looked terribly untidy; just at á that time my aunt came to see me; fortunately I could prevent her á from entering the room.
label: shame

text_A: When I was accepted as supervisor for a student teacher.  The á notification came by post.
label: joy

text_A: I was disgusted by my paranoid attitude towards myself, my á homework at university and disgusted about my lack of retention. á Especially in learning another language.
label: disgust

text_A: I was attacked by a man at a bus stop at night.
label: fear

text_A: When I see how people around me pass by certain unjustice because á of indifference or cowardice.
label: anger

text_A: One night, my boyfriend expressed his love for me in the canteen in á the presence of my friends by giving me a present.
label: joy

text_A: When I was selected for the university.
label: joy

text_A: When my flute-teacher was replaced by a new one.
label: sadness

text_A: I felt shame when I saw someone I knew and pretended not to see á her. Later she saw me and said hi.
label: shame

text_A: When I met a friend of mine after several months.
label: shame

text_A: Truely, I got very ashamed when my brother was sent out of á Business Machines Limited Company due to improper handling of the á office equipment in Sales Services.
label: shame

text_A: A male, Honduran acquaintance of mine despised my opinions.
label: anger

text_A: Before an exam in logics.
label: fear

text_A: I always get angry when somebody deceives me, or tries to conceal á his lie skilfully and this offends me even more.
label: anger

text_A: A night spent with a group of friends.
label: joy

text_A: Whenever my father smokes the smell makes me feel very á uncomfortable.  He never listens to my complaints and I curse him á furiously in my mind.  I cannot solve this problem by violence á because of traditional moral values.
label: anger

text_A: When I could study at university.
label: joy

text_A: A person I know who tells lies and so pretending to be better á than she is.
label: disgust

text_A: While travelling in a bus with an invalid ticket, I got caught.
label: guilt

text_A: [ Do not remember any incident.]
label: shame

text_A: When I won a trip to Greece in a competition.
label: joy

text_A: Made a wonderfull new friend.
label: joy

text_A: When I was confronted by a policeman one night around 11 o'clock. á  I was afraid when they threatened to take me and my girl to the á gallows.
label: fear

text_A: Class leader getting me to do things he did not want to do.
label: disgust

text_A: After a short stay in Marocco we missed the ferry-boat back to á Spain and we had to look for an accomodation. By chance we met a á man who offered to take us to a camping site. While I was sitting in his á car I was terribly afraid because I had heard of people being á robbed in Marocco.
label: fear

text_A: When I went to my room-mate's drawer to see if she had an iron  á which I could use, she came in.  I felt guilty as she may have á thought that I had been stealing.
label: guilt

text_A: When ,due to hunger and tiredness, I became generally irritated á with my fiancee and made cutting remarks which really hurt him.  á Later I realized that my unfounded irritation had hurt the person á I love most on earth.
label: guilt

text_A: I went to a fair where a guy who was drunk kept bothering me and á in the end I got really angry.
label: anger

text_A: I was listening to a priest in church saying how sinful man was, á and how all men should renounce their desires and pleasures to á please God. I could never understand how something that brings you á joy could be a sin.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was accepted to study at this school I was very happy.
label: joy

text_A: My son was registered to get admission in grade one of the         á primary school.  The chances of him getting a place there was 1/10.  á Two weeks later I was informed that he had been enrolled.
label: joy

text_A: When my cousin passed away.
label: sadness

text_A: One day I was with my girlfriend and other friends were behind á us, I fell down because the place was slippery and I really felt á ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: Recently, some friends and I had too much to drink while on a á foot-ball road trip to USC. We trashed our hotel room and I felt á ashamed when the maid walked in the next morning.
label: shame

text_A: I was going around with a foreigner's wife and my entire family á got to know about it, this was just when I had become a á Christian.
label: shame

text_A: Some foreign students playing loud music late at night.
label: disgust

text_A: This happened when I went to visit my friend in Chelston and á found him screwing my girlfriend.
label: disgust

text_A: My mother was ill and my father was not at home.
label: sadness

text_A: Two guys were fighting murderously and I feared that one of them á would be killed.
label: fear

text_A: I tried to talk to my parents over the phone, as I wanted to go á home for the week-end and I knew that I would not be able to bear á it.  I tried to reduce the gulf and the conflict between us by á talking in order to unite our worlds.  Result : hysterical mess, á blinding and blaming.
label: sadness

text_A: I had made an appointment with three friends. We had to go out á together. When I arrived at the place, the other persons weren't á there. I became very angry because I thought they were gone á without me. That, however, didn't appear to be the case.
label: anger

text_A: When I failed my first exam at the Higher Institute.
label: fear

text_A: The last time I was face to face with with the monstrous dog á which lives in my street.
label: fear

text_A: I joked with an unfamiliar friend in an obstinate tone.  I was á afraid of his misunderstanding me and being hurt and angry at me. á  I felt sorry over my conduct and thought that I had to find an á opportunity to apologize.
label: guilt

text_A: When I stood first in the B.A exams.  Earlier I had heard of á these boys and girls who were toppers, but when I first heard of á me having topped I could not believe it.
label: joy

text_A: When my grandmother died.
label: sadness

text_A: When I saw a ghost.
label: fear

text_A: When I received the acceptance letter from UNZA.  I had just á come home from work when my kind sister handed me an enveloppe á which I opened and was overcome with joy.
label: joy

text_A: When, for example, I was not approved to continue my studies at á the Moscow University, no matter that I had the highest marks and á in general the best records of all the candidates.
label: anger

text_A: My cassmate laughed at me when I was being scolded by the á teacher.
label: anger

text_A: The time I lost a badminton match, that I should have won at the á Zambia closed badminton championships.
label: sadness

text_A: When my brother had an epileptic attack and I was scared as to á what would happen to him.
label: fear

text_A: The shame came when I was beaten by my teacher at school in front á of boys and girls some of whom were my friends and a girlfriend á apart from being classmates.
label: shame

text_A: Once sitting in the cinema, I became very anxious (watching a á \cold\" film). I do not know the reason."
label: fear

text_A: When I was nearly attackad by a man who had been chasing me.
label: fear

text_A: When I passed the TOEFEL with very good marks.
label: joy

text_A: When I found out that I could not go to the concert (after buying á the tickets) because of a biology test which occurred the morning á after.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was younger I was very good in apparatus gymnastics. I á always won in competitions, but once I was only at the fourth á place.
label: sadness

text_A: Upon returning from a journey of about two weeks duration, I á found that a collection of pornographic literature had been á removed from my room I had previously thought that no one was á aware of the existence of this material.
label: shame

text_A: Every time I was around this one person I would stick my foot in á my mouth by being nasty. One time I accidently said something á fairly cruel that was totally inappropriate.
label: shame

text_A: My mother and my grandmother were talking about one of my á grandmother's friends whom I hardly know. I gave some deprecatory á comments on him whereupon my grandmother told me that the man had á died recently.
label: shame

text_A: On a telephone talk where I was agressive and stupid without the á least, reason or better motive.
label: guilt

text_A: When I shouted at my mother when she was nervous and depressed.
label: guilt

text_A: My mother had sent me to buy a few things.  The change I brought á back was not right as I had given away some money to a friend á thinking that she would not notice it.  However, my mother told á me that the change was not correct.
label: guilt

text_A: Once I spent a night with a friend at the secondary school. We á told each other horror stories and suddenly we heard uncanny á noises. I was terribly frightened.
label: fear

text_A: I bought a new bed for my apt. and it squeaks when you move on á it. I tried to fix it but could not.
label: anger

text_A: In the army, my result at the shooting exercises got á me a three day furlough.
label: joy

text_A: At the death of a close relative.
label: sadness

text_A: When people/press analyze a particular newsworthy item (CAL á Football team) which I am a member and can only see the situation á in a bad light and always put the team down.
label: disgust

text_A: I have once been very sad and lonely.  This was when I was trying á to organize a play as a student (15 years).  Instead of á materializing, it fizzled out.  The worst thing was that the play á fell apart completely and I found myself weeping uncontrollably.  á Now when I think of it, I laugh it off; but at that time it was á intense.
label: sadness

text_A: Years ago I fell in love for the first time. as natural for every á school-girl I was day-dreaming. Later (after 3 years) we left á each other. No one was to blame but I felt deep sadness. Even now á I remember about it quite often.
label: sadness

text_A: During my Highschool time I was chairman of the student's á comitee. In this function I once had to make a speech to a large á audience and I was very nervous. After three sentences I forgot á my text.
label: shame

text_A: When I left after the examination to enter the University, and á even though I had studied the whole year I made a bad exam.
label: anger

text_A: When I broke up my relationship with my former girlfriend as she á would ask me irrelevant quetions about my past.
label: guilt

text_A: Once my friend and I got into into a hot discussion on a very á controversial topic.  At one point of the argument I disagreed á with her totally and I took what she was saying as an insult.  So á I couter-argued and unknowingly hurt her emotionally, I felt very á sad about this.
label: sadness

text_A: When my last relation broke up.
label: sadness

text_A: There was an earthquake for several minutes and I was on the á eight floor.
label: fear

text_A: A conflict with a pupil.
label: anger

text_A: [ Cannot recall any incident when I felt shame.]
label: shame

text_A: I could have been killed by a falling object.
label: fear

text_A: Did not finish homework.
label: shame

text_A: Finding a hair in the soup.
label: disgust

text_A: A day I was with my boyfriend and a couple of friends in a bar, á and he said something that I didn't like (I don't remember what). á Without thinking I slept him in his back, getting ashamed and á sorry just after.
label: shame

text_A: When during a social evening with my father, brother, sister, á close friend and my father's 2nd wife - I had an argument with my á father, who abused my friend who was sticking up for me.
label: anger

text_A: When I was watching a movie in which there was a pit full of á dangers and there was only a small safe place on which a man was á standing; he had to catch the lady who was thrown in or else ! á The pit was 20 feet deep.
label: fear

text_A: My boyfriend finished our relationship when I started studying á psychology in Nijegen, because then we would not be able to meet á frequently anymore.
label: sadness

text_A: Was nearly knocked down by a car.
label: fear

text_A: I was afraid when I learnt that my father was seriously ill in á hospital.
label: fear

text_A: Several years ago my mother died. She had been ill for a long á time, but nevertheless her death came unexpectedly. I did not and á I still do not want to believe that it is true.
label: sadness

text_A: Failed an examn.
label: sadness

text_A: When my brother went to shoot wild ducks, I feared that the á boat would overturn and he would drown or that the gun would á accidentally go off.
label: fear

text_A: When I came back from work one day, the friends of my son told me á that he had not come back from school and that he was lost.
label: fear

text_A: My life-partner, who was drinking more and more, spoke about á kicking the cat.  He had never done anything of the kind, but I á knew that he would do so one day, without thinking about it.
label: anger

text_A: When my sister became pregnant at UNZA last year.
label: shame

text_A: When I found out my roommate had been talking behind my back á about very personal things.
label: shame

text_A: Death of my grnadfather after having been in hospital for so long á with cancer of the Oesophagus.
label: sadness

text_A: When I received the news that my in-laws had passed away.  I á depended heavily on them for their guidance and the running of á their daughter's buisness.
label: sadness

text_A: I had been separated from my girlfriend for about a year.  On her á birthday I put a present in her mailbox.  I had spent two days á choosing a suitable present for her.  I waited for a few days and á there was no reply from her; at last I received a thank-you card á in my mailbox.  On the card there was only my name, the words thank-you  á and her signature.  I was very sad then.
label: sadness

text_A: The loss of my father as he died of a massive and sudden heart á attack.
label: sadness

text_A: When I forgot the birthday of my best friend and I innocently á came to visit her one week later.
label: shame

text_A: Told by some people the class leader only choose his friends (not á true).
label: anger

text_A: One day my mother forced me to eat more and I refused, the next á day she served me more rice and mutton pieces than usual.  When I á saw this I got very angry and scolded her, and refused to eat.  á Later I felt guilty and asked her to excuse me.
label: guilt

text_A: After my marriage I received the B.Sc results by post, I was very á happy to learn that I had got very good marks - first class.
label: joy

text_A: It was the first time that I gave a birthday present to my friend. á   She wrote me a letter as she is my girlfriend.  The content of á the letter was so sweet that it made me feel very happy.á
label: joy

text_A: I was a passenger in a vehicle when suddenly another vehicle came á from behind to overtake us.  However another one was coming right á in front so the other vehicle changed course and blocked our way á and so we crashed against the side of the road.
label: fear

text_A: When I met my new girlfriend with another man in the street.
label: anger

I usually ignore this but this á time I flared up for a split second and threatened to bash him á up.  This is the latest incident when I lost my temper, though I á felt very bad about it later.

A year later one of them was á travelling in mainland China and he got T.B.  He died a few weeks á after coming back to H.K.  We all got together for the funeral á and when I looked at the body for the last time I felt extremely á sad.

label: shame

text_A: A few years ago my mother suffered from canccer and died within á two years.  We had not finished our studies then and could not á bear our responsibilities as her children.  My mother had tried á her best to take care of us but she lived in pain these two á years.  Neither the doctor nor we could do anything for her as á cancer is incurable.  I was very eager to replace her in á suffernig , even die instead of her.
label: sadness

text_A: A girl with whom I was staying having sex with a person for about á 3 nights running, and then with his brother the following night, á and back again.
label: disgust

text_A: I remember when I was a little boy I broke a Swiss dinner set á quite involuntarily.

label: guilt

text_A: At the hairdresser's, I got two stains of dyestuff on my new á trousers. These stains are not removable, so I cannot put on the á trousers again.

text_A: The day I was nearly stabbed to death by ruffians who wanted to á take my money.  I refused to give them any money and they started á running after me, I ran into somebody else's house to save á myself.

label: guilt

text_A: One day mother slaughtered a chicken for a brother who had come á back for holiday. In everybody's absence I opened the foodstore á and ate all internal organs of the chicken. When mother á discovered, we were all called and I was found with hands stained á with soup. I was ashamed being the eldest of all in the family.

label: joy

text_A: Saw the village I come from still pay money to buy wife.

I did not want to go  so I said that á there might be many bad people at the club.  As a resullt my á sister was scolded by my mother.
label: guilt

text_A: I have a friend that I deeply trusted but it happened that I lost á my confidence in her for which she herself was to blame.
label: anger

label: guilt

label: joy

label: joy

text_A: A boy who shot dead a squirrel.
label: guilt

text_A: In Sweden, a friend and I lived in an appartment owned by a Finn. á  One day, this man came back to the appartment heavily drunk á (hashish and alcohol).  He was quite dizzy and he broke down, and á I could not foretell his reactions.  However, nothing happened.
label: fear

text_A: My first day to work in hospital, when I was dressing wounds I á was disgusted when I came across one wound with a very bad smell.
label: disgust

label: shame

label: anger

text_A: The outrageous conduct of a relative towards me and those close á to me.(blaming us and lying)
label: anger

text_A: My roommate got married and invited me to share a flat with them. á But with a young couple there should not be a third person. I am á to blame for not following the advise of the others, but it is á not late still.
label: guilt

text_A: Did well in an examn just before my father's birthday: the best á present I can give to my father.
label: joy

text_A: I was embarassed at the exam in microbiology. I was ashamed with á myself - how little I knew and how good was the examinor. I á rarely become ashamed.

text_A: My boyfriend breaking up with me about 7 months after I had an á abortion. Just the fact that he was ignoring me and continued to á do so.
label: anger

label: sadness

text_A: A lie on the part of a person close to me.
label: disgust

text_A: When I made a mistake at work and when questioned about it á pretended I had nothing to do with the problem.

text_A: My sisters asked me to fetch them at a discotheque which is 5 km á off. There was a thick fog and snowfall. There was not enough á room in the car for all of them and they asked me to go there á once again. When I did not do that they had a way to make me feel á guilty.
label: guilt

text_A: I read a book whose plot and expressions were obscene and in very á bad taste.
label: disgust

I was talking about it to my friends when á I said something negative, in too abrupt a manner, concerning my á work partner. When I was having á lunch in the canteen, two of my male classmates asked me as to á why I was dressed so nicely (they had seldom joked with me á before).  One of them said that he had a lounge suit and we would á look very nice if we wore them together.
label: joy

text_A: Unofficially I was informed about my results of the final á examination of the secondary school. A teacher wrote them up for á me. When I went outside, I started crying with joy.

label: disgust

label: guilt

text_A: Unexpected visit by a close friend, whom I hadn't seen for half a á year.
label: joy

text_A: Getting to know that my uncle in America had a brain tumor.
label: sadness

text_A: When I gave birth to a healthy boy.

label: joy

text_A: I am sad because some relations to friends are not very good.

label: sadness

label: sadness

text_A: My car skidded on the wet street.
label: fear

label: anger

text_A: [ No response.]
label: guilt

label: sadness

label: joy
