label: fear

text_A: When I was a child, my uncle came to see us. I spit at him and á ran out - I do not know the reason for that. My father came after á me and insisted on my apologizing.
label: shame

text_A: In the 12/83 my boyfriend asked me to forget him, as it would be á easy.
label: sadness

text_A: When I heard that my father had found a letter from my boyfriend á and he was calling me to talk about it.
label: fear

text_A: When I, for the first time, failed a junior exam, i.e form 3.
label: disgust

text_A: When I received my TE Score and my acceptance from University - á it had been a goal since I left the bank a year earlier.
label: joy

text_A: I got a job right after school was over.
label: joy

text_A: The last time I had to phone the Registry, after having called á them so many times in the last few days.
label: shame

text_A: When I feel helpless after having tried to help someone without á any result.
label: sadness

text_A: I felt disgusted when a fellow student asked me to marry him.  I á had not expected this from him as he was a mere friend.
label: disgust

text_A: When my wife died in hospital, she was pregnant and had undergone á an operation.
label: sadness

text_A: My younger brother and sister were involved in an accident on á their way back from school and my brother was quite badly hurt.
label: sadness

text_A: An utterance, which I had intended to be a joke, was taken as an á offence.  In my opinion, this was stupid, and I got angry.
label: anger

text_A: When my aunt scolded me for something I was not responsible for.  á A boy had come to our gate asking for me, my aunt went out to see á him.  I had neither met nor known the boy.
label: anger

text_A: In a hurry to get to lectures and the car would not start.
label: anger

text_A: Landlord putting up rents sneakly and slimily.
label: anger

text_A: A few days back I had a tutorial class and the teacher randomly á assigned one person in each group to make a presentation.  The á discussion in our group had been confused and the presentation á was not very well prepared.  Unfortunately I was selected to á present and I could not keep calm, was confused and result was á very poor.  I really felt ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: When I was appointed to position of trust in a group set up to á change the working environment.
label: joy

text_A: I was disappointed and angry at the bad quality of a documentay á program on TV.  In my opinion, the topic was important and the á program should have been made with seriousness and consideration.
label: anger

text_A: When I have to leave the baby in the carriage and go shopping, I á fear that something will happen to the baby.
label: fear

text_A: Finally being asked by someone to a banquet.
label: joy

text_A: Losing close people and animals. So far, I've felt most when á losing our dog in a traffic accident.
label: sadness

text_A: When a certain boy went about saying that I am his girlfriend. I á wrote him an insulting letter to him and called him names.
label: anger

text_A: My friend was badly hurt.
label: sadness

text_A: When my nephew asked me to tell him a story and I simply did not á have the energy or the will.  When I saw his disappointment I was á terribly guilty and read a story to him after all.
label: guilt

text_A: Fear is an emotion that I experience very often.  Naturally this á is during exams and subsequently while waiting for the results.  á However there is one occassion when I was paralyzed with fear.  á This was when I was doing my M.A.-I, and we had a series of student á lectures.  I was one of the participants and my lecture happened á to be the opening lecture.  I had been confident all morning, about á twenty minutes before the lecture, my confidence started failing á me.  I felt my heart go cold, my lips go dry and I was really á paralyzed.  This incident of fear is still fresh.
label: fear

text_A: I was returning from the Universtity at night when I was accosted á by a boy who molested me, passing his hands on my body.
label: disgust

text_A: Finding out my best friend cannot go to the English lectures.
label: sadness

text_A: When I spoke to my daughter and wished her luck for the á examinations she was about to take.
label: joy

text_A: When my friends did not ask me to go to a New Year's party á with them.
label: sadness

text_A: I was unfaithful to my partner once when he was working abroad á for a long period.
label: guilt

text_A: [ I do not remember any event when I felt guilty.]
label: guilt

text_A: One of my first boyfriends got mad at me because a lot of my á close friends were guys and he didn't want me to see them anymore á because he was jealous.
label: anger

text_A: When I tried to put up a tent some years ago, I was teased and á hindered by my cousin.
label: anger

text_A: When I was about 17 years old and I stole some pens from a á stationery store because I didn't have enough money.
label: guilt

text_A: Forgetting a close friend's birthday.
label: guilt

text_A: I was sitting in a station-hall and watching a lavatory á attendant. She was very dirty. She started to eat something out á of a dirty cup - it must have been something like lard. Then she á took some breadcrumbs out of the pockets of her apron and ate á them. I had to leave - I felt like vomitting.
label: disgust

text_A: This summer I got into a fight with one of our patrons (at a á theatre). He hit me and I hit him and her friend, he hit my friend á and we all hit eachother.
label: anger

text_A: [ Do not know.]
label: shame

text_A: Sometime back I was coming from the wards and lice were all over á my uniform since patient's blankets have a lot of lice. It á happened that my boyfriend picked some lice from my white uniform. á I was so ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: When I was pointed out as a problem child in primary school and á my mother took the teacher's point of view.
label: anger

text_A: [ Sorry, I was never ashamed about anything in my life.]
label: shame

text_A: I was learning judo and my instructor wanted me to assist him in á teaching girls judo at a suburban college.  I was just a beginer, á and he made me a green belt so that I would be able to command á respect.  This was against my principles, and yet I allowed myself á to listen to him.  I gave it up soon after, however I felt very á ashamed at not sticking to my principles and at not having put my á foot down earlier.
label: shame

text_A: Someone played a trick on me.
label: anger

text_A: Hearing Fran Wilde introduce the Bill.
label: joy

text_A: The loss of a close relative who was ill with cancer.
label: sadness

text_A: The night before my wife had given birth to our twins. I felt á fear in the hospital yard, I feared if everything was going to be á in order.
label: fear

text_A: I felt happy at the end of a 10 day student camp.  We had shared á our hopes and aspirations and in the open situation so generated, we á had made strong frienships and experienced our own worth as well. á
label: joy

text_A: I experienced this feeling when I was accepted as a student. á Because everything turned out different from my expectations. á Although I passed the exam successfully I was accepted as a á student only when I didn't expect it at all, namely at the á beginning of September.
label: joy

text_A: When my friend, as usual, forgot the tickets at home for a á performance.  We missed it.
label: anger

text_A: Passing away of my father.
label: sadness

text_A: I was waiting to receive the participation on the profits and did á not receive it.
label: anger

text_A: When I was a child I was afraid of big dogs. One day when I came á home a big dog was laying in front of our door. I was so á frightened that I did not dare to enter the door and I waited á until somebody passed by.
label: fear

text_A: I had received bad news informing me that grandmother and á grandfather had passed away. The first one to die was my á grandmother and after two days grandfather died too.
label: sadness

text_A: A friend once reacted childishly (he is 23 yearrs old) to my not á responding in his favour to a request, that is: he asked me for á some money I refused, and his reaction was quite childish.
label: disgust

text_A: [ No response.]
label: shame

text_A: After joining my M.A in Social Sciences, I appeared for the first á semester exam.  I failed one of the exams, and when I looked at á my results I felt disgusted and then I got angry.
label: disgust

text_A: Anger with boyfriend's best friend for alienating me and blaming á me for personality changes in my boyfriend and changes in my á boyfriend's attitude to him and his obvious egoistical attitude á himself in doing so. I also lost one of my best friends - his á girlfriend.
label: anger

text_A: When I talk to silly, petty-minded and unmanageable people.
label: anger

text_A: I was in a cafe with another person when, suddenly, several close á friends of my partner appeared.  I did not know what to do and my á partner felt uncomfortable.
label: guilt

text_A: I experienced it when I was accepted at the Medical Higher á Institute.
label: joy

text_A: When I passed successive exams to enter the school of medicine.
label: joy

text_A: I felt it when I felt that I was being observed as an object of á pleasure (sexual) when I opened and took off a shirt in a á classroom at P.V.C.
label: shame

text_A: A friend of mine suggested that I become a film extra.  The idea á seemed very funny to me and my reaction seemed rather outlandish á to the others.
label: joy

text_A: A friend of mine remembered me when she needed me and did not á even think about me when she did not need me.
label: disgust

text_A: When I caused problems for somebody because he could not keep the á appointed time and this led to various consequences.
label: guilt

text_A: Receiving a postcard form my sweetheart who was abroad on á vacation, not being at all sure if he would write me or not.
label: joy

text_A: My father promoted to be a professor.
label: joy

text_A: Meeting with two of my friends I had not seen for 15 years. They á were special people to me.
label: joy

text_A: I experienced it once when we were on a drive. Our car passed by á the one comming from the opposite direction at an incredibly á small distance.
label: fear

text_A: Whenever I see an alcoholic.
label: disgust

text_A: The same as in SHAME.
label: disgust

text_A: On May 20th I got a summon to appear in court on May 28th 1985 on á the subject of impregnanting a school girl. I really feared of á standing in the court in a few days time after this notice. I was á also embarassed due to formal approach that was expected of me to á the Principal.
label: fear

text_A: I got a very nasty electrical shock when I was tampering with á some electrical applainces.á
label: fear

text_A: The birth of my daughter.
label: joy

text_A: When I come home late at night.
label: fear

text_A: I promised to fulfill an errand. Later I understood it was á impracticable. The explanation I gave was accompanied by a sense á of guilt.
label: guilt

text_A: I have experienced disgust with some people - usually double á dealers.
label: disgust

text_A: Asking someone to give me back the money I once lend him because á I needed it myself.
label: shame

text_A: I was overwhelmed with joy when I received the acceptance letter á to UNZA.  This happened again when I passed all my first year á courses.
label: joy

text_A: Someone had stolen an article from a library journal.
label: disgust

text_A: I was physically assaulted and sexually abused about a year ago. á Just the feeling that I might not get away intact, or even alive, á produced fear.
label: fear

text_A: When I accepted Jesus Christ as my personal saviour.
label: joy

text_A: [ No response.]
label: shame

text_A: A man sexually aggressed a small girl in the bus but the girl did á not dare to speak out.
label: disgust

text_A: I threw away an object, which belonged to a friend, because I did á not know what to do with it. My friend was very sad about that á and I felt guilty.
label: guilt

text_A: I was doing an experiment and was not getting the appropriate á result despite the fact that I had repeated the procedure 4-5 á times.  Then finally I got it right by a stroke of luck.
label: joy

text_A: When I went to the pub with a large group of friends, we drank á and danced.
label: joy

text_A: I was playing a sport in an advanced PE class and many of the á people were not advanced.
label: disgust

text_A: My girlfriend one day went out and promised to be back at 6.00 pm á however she first arrived at 10.00 pm, without a message (we had á to go out that evening).
label: anger

text_A: My failure to provide the appropriate emotional/spiritual level á to a sexual relationship that had a large physical content. Born á out of inconsistency with my personal beliefs and value shame at á largely using this sexual partner.
label: shame

text_A: I read a newspaper article about dogs being stolen in order to á use them for fighting purposes.
label: disgust

text_A: When a very near person got into an awkward situation but showed á only helplessness and indecision.
label: disgust

text_A: When I dreamed that I was being attacked by a friend.
label: fear

text_A: I read a story in the newspaper about butchers treating their á animals very badly. They disgusted me.
label: disgust

text_A: When my little brother passed away mysteriously, at least from á what I was told about it.
label: sadness

text_A: When I understood that my marriage was falling apart, and we á decided to be legally separated.
label: sadness

text_A: [ No response.]
label: guilt

text_A: I was very angry at my father when he didn't give me as much á money as my brother to use for studying. Once again my brother á was better off then me.
label: anger

text_A: Not finishing homework.
label: shame

text_A: One day I had an appointment with my boyfriend which I had á objected to in the begining, however he visited me and convinced á me to come.  The day of the appointment; I had to wait for him á for over an hour.
label: anger

text_A: After the funeral of an acquaintance I felt very depressed. That á feeling turned into joy when I heard that I had achieved a good á grade for an examination.
label: joy

text_A: The fact that my mother is getting married again (my mother and á father divorced about 15 years ago) means that she will probably á move to Turku, and our home, which is a one family house, will be á sold (I myself have not been living at home for the past six á years).
label: sadness

text_A: Running away from a fire.
label: shame

text_A: I had a quarrell with my boyfriend and decided to finish with him á and and my Easter holidays.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was accepted at UNZA.
label: joy

text_A: I was very drunk at a certain wedding party and I got involved in á a fight.
label: shame

text_A: When my son returned from mountaineering - healthy in body and á soul.
label: joy

text_A: That afternoon I received two messages informing me, one that my á brother was in a coma in the U.T.H suffering (kidney disease) and á two, that my uncle met with an accident on his way to the hospital á  to see my brother.
label: sadness

text_A: My grandfather's funeral.
label: sadness

text_A: NO RESPONSE
label: disgust

text_A: When I heard of the death of my mother.
label: sadness

text_A: For my parents anniversary, we hosted a party and we were very á happy.
label: joy

text_A: When I found out my cousin had been killed. I was angry at the á world, and her murderer who was her ex-boyfriend. It was the worst á and most hateful day of my life.
label: anger

text_A: When my red-cheeked, content child runs to meet me in the yard of á the kindergarten and gives me a moist kiss on my cheek.
label: joy

text_A: I was walking home late at night from lectures and someone á deliberately started following me. It was dark and I was scared.
label: fear

text_A: I felt guilty when I \stole\" the boyfriend of a friend of mine."
label: guilt

text_A: I was happy to hear that my sister had won a prize at running á competition.
label: joy

text_A: In traffic I often get relatively angry with other drivers. á Several transgressions make me mad, especially not yielding to á priority traffic (e.g. coming from the right).
label: anger

text_A: As a child I suffered of nightmares. Even since than, I have á never been so anxious and fearful.
label: fear

text_A: When a certain girl I believed to be my life partner refused an á engagement.
label: shame

text_A: When I learned that two of my friends had had a serious car accident.
label: sadness

text_A: One evening, in the tramway, I was afraid of two drunk men á molesting my girlfriend and me.
label: fear

text_A: A case of unrequited love.
label: sadness

text_A: Long illness.
label: sadness

text_A: In a dam lake, when the water was let flow to water the plants á and I and two other boys were near the water pit. We rescued á ourselves only thanks to the flippers and the tyre that was with á us.
label: fear

text_A: I slipped and fell in to a puddle and people started looking at á me.
label: shame

text_A: I had undertaken to help my sister for her class work but some á unexpected circumstances prevented me from doing that.
label: guilt

text_A: Once when I was in the cell group (religious activity) I found á that almost everyone in the group read the bible daily and I felt á guilty in my heart.
label: guilt

text_A: At the funeral of my uncle, I was one of the bearers.  I was not á familiar with the etiquette and acted tactlessly because of my á ignorance.
label: shame

text_A: When I got my results - I had passed the form III exams.  I had á not expected to do so well.
label: joy

text_A: My best friend chosen for your English lectures.
label: joy

text_A: Not to have studied enough when exams were near.
label: guilt

text_A: When I come home in the evening, the first thing I do is to sit á down and smoke a cigarette. One day I found the flat in a totally á desolate state. My girl-friend had wanted to tidy up but had not á finished.
label: anger

text_A: A reoccurring fear that something will happen to my relatives.
label: fear

text_A: I got my driving licence after they had frightened me with it's á difficulty.
label: joy

text_A: When I heard of the assassination of the Indian prime-minister, á Indira Gandhi.
label: disgust

text_A: Once I was not ready for a seminar and I was asked to leave.
label: shame

text_A: When I was told to attend an operation in theatre.
label: fear

text_A: I was at home alone when I realized that a young roe approached á our house. I hid because I did not want to frighten it. It á limped. Some time later, when I thought that it had already run á away, I saw it lying on our terrace. I came nearer and saw that á it was terribly wounded. I informed the ranger who said that the á roe must have been attacked by dogs. He had to shoot it.
label: sadness

text_A: I deliberately avoided a person who I wanted to hurt, and who á wanted to talk to me.
label: disgust

text_A: Missing lectures and avoiding university work for no reason when á it had to be done.
label: guilt

text_A: When my pet dog,who was to us a family member, died.  He had been á vomitting for the past three days and we had not found the time á to call a vet, finally when the vet came it was already too late.
label: guilt

text_A: When my child was born.
label: joy

text_A: When I noticed that my parents were not in such a prosperity as á most people in my surroundings.
label: sadness

text_A: At using other people, because of sexual experience that was á using another to the detriment of both. Anxiety that I may have á affected another for the worst.
label: shame

text_A: We had to move to a very different city because the company where á my father worked also moved to that place. It was very difficult á for me to make new friends than.
label: anger

text_A: My father was very angry with me, and I locked me up in the á shower. Then my father knocked his fist through the door, I was á scared to death.
label: fear

text_A: Facing a mad dog.
label: fear

text_A: My favourite horse died. We had tried our best to save him, but á it was hopeless, he had to be shot.
label: sadness

text_A: When my younger sister, who was then 16 years old, was pregnant.
label: shame

text_A: Could not find my way out in the college building at night.
label: fear

text_A: When thieves broke into our neighbour's house and later we heard á gunshots.
label: fear

text_A: A friend giving me an expensive Christmas gift while I gave her a á cheap one.
label: shame

text_A: I received a letter of acceptance from UNZA.
label: joy

text_A: One day I had sunned my favourite shirt and was putting it back á in the wardrobe when my younger brother snatched it from me and á wore it.  He had not had a bath and was very dirty.  I scolded him á but he answered back and locked himself up in a room.  I was very á angry so I starteed kicking on the door and abusing him loudly á and freely.
label: anger

text_A: Sincerely I'm a very timid guy and so even in very simple á situations sometimes I am ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: I received a phone call from a high school friend whose younger á sister studied with me at the University and gave me a lift every á moning. She was going to get married to a guy whom I knew too and á who had died when he fell from a building, I was afraid to lose á somebody since I had already lost a brother in an accident.
label: fear

text_A: I had just moved to the town where I study and I got a postcard á from a good friend (from my home town).
label: joy

text_A: When I went to see the dead body of my uncle.  This was a very á dramatic expreience as it was the first time that I entered a á mortuary.
label: sadness

text_A: This happened when I was selected to go to Secondary school to á start Form I in October 1980.
label: joy

text_A: When I said good-bye to my girlfriend.  I had spent two years on á developing this relationship and it was unsuccessful, I felt very á sad.
label: sadness

text_A: When I got indecent offers.
label: disgust

text_A: I separated with the one I liked most.  She refused all my dates á and told me that she had dated another one.  My heart seemed to á cease beating.  I was silent for some time and then I whispered á goodbye and left without turning back.
label: sadness

text_A: A sunny Autumn day, after a long rainy period.
label: joy

text_A: I felt guilty about talking negatively, and agreeing with a á person who was doing likewise, about a non-present third person.
label: guilt

text_A: When I realized that I could not communicate properly with my á closest friend.
label: sadness

text_A: The day I was happiest was the day when I received a phone call á from Eve's Weekly to inform me that I had won the first prize of á the All India Essay competition.  I had won this prize when I was á an under-graduate when even post graduates had participated.  I á had been judged by eminent judges and political scientists.
label: joy

text_A: I was in a dark cellar and saw a glowing red point. I thought á that it was a person with a cigarette - but it was only the red á switch.
label: fear

text_A: Got in touch with earlier friends after a long absence.
label: joy

text_A: First public speaking.
label: joy

text_A: [ No response.]
label: sadness

text_A: Relating to my closest family.
label: joy

text_A: Close relative is dying of cancer - found out last week.
label: sadness

text_A: When I go out with my friend with enough money and good sense to á our favorite dancing.
label: joy

text_A: When my husband stays late at a meeting and I have to be alone.
label: anger

text_A: On meeting an old friend of mine.
label: joy

text_A: When I was substituted in a play which was to be staged, after I á had learnt all the lines.
label: disgust

text_A: Before an accident, my aunt offered me the front seat of the car, á next to the driver. I declined, she took that seat and was killed á there when the car crashed.
label: guilt

text_A: At a Sm÷rgasbord table, a man mixed differnet kinds of picked á herrings with fruit salad.
label: disgust

text_A: After an exam which I failed.
label: sadness

text_A: I was angry at my brother over an argument we had together.  We á do have a few fights from time to time, and also at times I take á out my anger on him.
label: anger

text_A: When I applied for a false travelling claim allowance and later I á thought that I would be found out.
label: guilt

text_A: I felt happy when I learnt that I had qualified for the grade á eight.
label: joy

text_A: When I shout at a colleague in classroom.
label: guilt

text_A: A father helping his kid to fight other kids.
label: anger

label: sadness

text_A: When I heard that a good friend had committed suicide.
label: sadness

text_A: Suddenly met someone in the biology building at night.
label: fear

text_A: This situation happened when my friend me with a knife which I á stole from him.
label: guilt

label: anger

label: shame

text_A: Yelled at my parents for not buying me a car like other parents.
label: guilt

text_A: About my girlfriend's sister who is a viper as I discovered some á time ago.
label: disgust

text_A: I am troubled by hair growing in my neck. I was troubled by this á for a long time and was much ashamed when someone brought his/her á hands close to my face.
label: shame

text_A: In the begining of teenage, on the matters of sex - speaking á about sex.
label: guilt

text_A: When I discovered that the people I trusted most were talking á behind my back.
label: anger

text_A: When I think about my parents getting old.
label: sadness

text_A: Fighting with class mates in Highschool.
label: fear

text_A: When I unexpectedly received birthday greetings from a person I á like.
label: joy

text_A: With self at losing an important game that I should have won.
label: anger

text_A: When I found out that I can travel with my best friend.
label: joy

text_A: One day, I was home and there was a phone call informing me that á some of my relatives had died in an accident.
label: sadness

text_A: One day I felt dizzy during a lecture.  When the lecturer asked á us as to who had heard the fairy tale - I was the only one who á put up his hand and this surprised the whole class.
label: shame

text_A: Insulted by a woman in public.
label: shame

text_A: I tried to pass an examination particularly well, but I did it á worse than ever. I felt ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: During the summer I received grade cards from my TA's. I expected á a B no better in Computer Science. I looked at the card - I got an á A - I was ecstatic.
label: joy

text_A: Thinking about other things in a lecture.
label: guilt

text_A: When I went to the clinic for a medical check-up and saw the way á the lecturer was conducting the lecture and the kind of responses á he got from the patients.
label: disgust

text_A: A neighbour's girl had disappeared and many people were looking á for her.  Someone had gone to notify the police.  Something had á certainly happened to her.
label: fear

text_A: When my mother was robbed in a shop.
label: fear

text_A: I had promised my friend to take her to an important appontment á but I was late. So she missed the opportunity to get a wellpayed á holiday job.
label: guilt

text_A: Death of my grandmother.
label: sadness

text_A: Boyfriend doing cleaning in situation where it was my job to do á it. Later snapped at him over trivial thing. He looked downcast. á I felt guilty - \he's just done all that work for me\"."
label: guilt

text_A: Someone asked me to do something and I made up an excuse and said á no. I then went and didn't the same thing with someone else and á hoped the first person never found out.
label: guilt

text_A: I was going home by car late one night when it was cold, dark and á windy.  I became rather panicky on the way to my house.
label: fear

text_A: When the girl with whom I am in love smiles at me.
label: joy

text_A: I was looking at a one-man show on television. He told very á disgusting things so that I started to be disgusted with it. á (Later on it proved that this was his intention).
label: disgust

text_A: It was in December last year that I was chosen to come to this á Institution to study as a Medical Assistant.
label: joy

text_A: NO RESPONSE.
label: shame

text_A: I felt very frightened when a robber broke into our house and á threatened to shoot my father if he did not part with some money. á  I was looking at the man with his hand on the trigger.
label: fear

text_A: My grand father caught me eating his private jelly bean supply.
label: shame

text_A: In the past I used to think that my mother was a very nagging á person.  When I started living at the hostel we had little time á to meet each other.  Whenever I went home she would take care á of me.  I gradually realized that what she had done was for my á own good.  So very time I saw her I felt guilty.
label: guilt

text_A: When I learnt that my cousin sister was pregnant.
label: disgust

text_A: Cannot remember such a situation.
label: shame

text_A: I had not punched a ticket in the bus because I had a card. But á when the ticket-collector came it turned out that I had forgotten á it. The shame I felt was great though it was not done on purpose.
label: shame

text_A: When I was young I stole something from a shop and got caught, á then I was taken to the police station and my parents had to come á and get me.
label: guilt

text_A: We had to finish the life of our 8 year-old dog.
label: sadness

text_A: When I failed at the first entrance exam.
label: sadness

text_A: When I was an evening school teacher it was my job to make the á coffee but I was not able to get the coffee ready on time and I á thus arrived half an hour late to the class.  On top of this the á coffee was undrinkable.
label: shame

text_A: At the funeral of a friend about 20 years old, who was killed in á a hit-and-run motorcycle accident.
label: sadness

text_A: Saw some young people fighting for seats on a bus.
label: anger

text_A: During military service a superior reproached me unjustly. This á led to friction in a lot of situations.
label: anger

text_A: I have a new born child.
label: joy

text_A: Peeping.
label: guilt

text_A: Recently, my sister-in-law's horse was poisoned by a plant and á died. The horse was very obedient and exceptional with children.
label: sadness

text_A: A few monthe ago, when my brother's wife told me that I had bad á manners.  To make matters worse she did not let me use their á telephone as she only allowed people of her own tribe.
label: anger

text_A: My best friend at school told lies about me to a boy I was seeing á and went out with him herself.
label: anger

text_A: One day I was in the countryside with several friends, and we á began to eat figs, after we were all full we noticed that all the á figs were full of worms.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was in a situation which seemed hopeless for me, I moved á back to my parents. For my father it went without saying anything á (normally he ofter grumbles at me).
label: joy

text_A: I felt guilty when I learnt that some of friends found the á finished at the Cafeteria because I took food which was more than á my share.
label: guilt

text_A: The death of a close relative.
label: sadness

text_A: My mother was unwell and went for many cancer tests. She spent á time in hospital being opened and closed many times.
label: sadness

text_A: There is a girl at my work that doesn't take care much of her á hygiene she comes always with her hair oiled, a not very agreable á smell, and a bad appearance. Beside this she tries to be nice.
label: disgust

text_A: A meeting with the family and the friends I felt dear and loved, á sharing the gladness of being together at a birthday.
label: joy

text_A: Taking a chemistry midterm.
label: fear

text_A: When I was a child, I had a nightmare. At that time, I was not á yet able to tell anybody about it, so I was very frightened. I á could not explain myself all that and I had to deal with it by á myself.
label: fear

text_A: A sudden end to the relationship with my first girlfriend.
label: sadness

text_A: Recently I happened to remain alone for a long time.
label: sadness

text_A: A good friend quitted me after he had behaved in a strange á manner.
label: sadness

text_A: Joy at meeting a woman I love very much.
label: joy

text_A: I was angry this morning when I missed the train to university.
label: anger

text_A: I cannot remember exactly such a situation. But I know that á once I went to a very dirty lavatory and that disgusted me.
label: disgust

text_A: When my mother scolded me for coming home late, i.e after 7 P.M.
label: anger

text_A: At a party, I started talking to a guy I had seen in one of my á classes. My boyfriend felt awkward and left to talk to a friend á but kept on looking at me as I talked.
label: guilt

text_A: After going through a glass door, I sustained a number of serious á cuts which were gaping open.
label: fear

text_A: When an unpleasant person tried to make friends with me.  A á subtle, small, insignificant, grey being whose helplessness and á neutrality evoked the feeling of disgust in me.
label: disgust

text_A: I made an appointment with a friend to drink coffee togehter. á However, for the third time in that week she arrived an hour too á late.
label: anger

text_A: I ride my motorbike in my village and everyone stares at me as if á I was a rare specimen.
label: shame

text_A: I was neglected undeservedly.
label: anger

text_A: After a footballmatch I went home by car, a friend drove. I did á not realize that he was drunk until we were in the car. He was á madly racing. Several times we were in dangerous situations and I á told him to be cautious, but he did not care.
label: fear

text_A: After being told that an ex-boyfriend had been hurt by my wearing á something he had given me when I was with another guy. I was á unaware of my actions really, as I had not considered the fact á that he had given it to me, and might see me. I still respected á his opinions of me.
label: guilt

text_A: Fear from the unknown. I felt fear when I sat for the entrance á examinations.
label: fear

text_A: I was disgusted to see a person vomitting and I was told to clean á the place where the vomit was.
label: disgust

text_A: On New Year's Eve, when I went to the house of my girlfriend's á parents to meet them.
label: shame

text_A: A situation where I ignored my beliefs and principles for a trip á of whimsy.
label: disgust

text_A: I was walking home from a place on southside and I live on á Northside and I was followed. I headed my most direct route.
label: fear

text_A: DO NOT REMEMBER.
label: fear

text_A: Earth crake.
label: fear

text_A: [ No response.]
label: sadness

text_A: On holiday, seeing the lanscape in Gerona.
label: joy

text_A: When I heard that I had been selected for the university.
label: joy

text_A: While paddling in the river during a storm.  I feared drowning.
label: fear

text_A: When I do not succeed in making myself clear to other people. á When they do not understand what I say.
label: shame

text_A: I felt shame at the hurt I caused to my family especially my á parent father, shame of hurting people emotionally. A misconceived á self-blaming that didn't do me any good. Shame at being myself as á I am.
label: shame

text_A: This happened recently, I  was in the dining hall and one of my á friends with whom I was eating called me a fool.
label: anger

text_A: I met my best friend's husband with a prostitute.
label: disgust

text_A: I felt anger at my roommate due to his habit of leaving dirty á dishes in the sink and generally not cleaning after himself.
label: anger

text_A: The same fact about the girl (22 years, married - guilt - á disgust), the fear was the main factor in our relationship.
label: fear

text_A: One day in a clinic, the father of a child came in and assaulted á a colleague for something that she had not done deliberately.
label: anger

text_A: When I see people who have no sentiments.
label: disgust

text_A: Due to laziness, I failed the term studies completely at á University.  I also wanted, to some extent, to protest against my á parents' expectations.
label: guilt

text_A: I felt guilty when I spent a night at my boyfriend's place, á particularly because I had been harsh and spiteful when I had á left home.  The reason was that I feared a possible discussion on á the subject and I wanted to leave defiantly.
label: guilt

text_A: Last year I had a friend visiting me for several days. The only á thing he did was sleeping, drinking, taking pills and thinking á only about himself.
label: anger

text_A: When I was insulted by a fellow student.
label: anger

text_A: Inter-national sports events won by my favourite national team or á player brings me joy, e.g when India won the World cup cricket á match.
label: joy

text_A: When I went home alone early in the morning, I had to go through á a wood.
label: fear

text_A: When I was told that my daughter, who is at a boarding school, á was very ill and that they needed me there the same day.
label: fear

text_A: Listening to long speech of the party leaders wasting my time.
label: anger

text_A: I was at a friend's place for lunch and she fell ill and á vomited.
label: disgust

text_A: When my partner was attacked and lost three teeth.
label: anger

text_A: It was the time when everybody spoke about and discussed á Hainburg. I was also asked for my opinion. I was ashamed because á I had no firm view of the whole thing and therefor was not able á to join the conversation.
label: shame

text_A: When I was an exploration with my friends and almost got lost in á an unfamiliar environment.  It was getting dark and we did not á know how to get back home.
label: fear

text_A: When one learns through the mass media all the wars and killing á going on in the world.
label: disgust

text_A: I was the compere at a party and all my efforts to get the show á rolling were thwarted by the immobile, non co-operative guests.  á I felt frustation - bordering on anger.
label: anger

text_A: Betraying someone's trust.
label: guilt

text_A: I felt angry when repeated pleas to the ticket collector and the á co-passengers in order to make a queue fell on deaf ears.  I have á this feeling whenever someone is not disciplined and methodic in á doing his duty.
label: anger

text_A: When I heard that I had achieved a place in form I.
label: joy

text_A: Being chased in the dark by someone I did not know.
label: fear

text_A: Finding my glasses again after having lost them in town.
label: joy

text_A: I was not sure whether I should help an old woman going down a á flight of stairs. I just watched her and saw how difficult it was á for her to do it.
label: guilt

text_A: The day I got to know that I would get a shared dwelling with my á boyfriend.  My parents place was getting a little crowded with á my growing bother wanting a room to himself.  I first felt doubt, á then joy, but also sadness.  The feeling of joy was the á strongest.
label: joy

text_A: I felt very sad when I had to give up something that by right was á mine and although I didn't get it, a kind of suvenir that people á don't give you the right to have.
label: sadness

text_A: On a trip I passed by a cellulose factory. It was a fine day, á beautiful landscape; I observed this factory with disgust.
label: disgust

text_A: The day the Real Madrid team of basket ball qualified for the á final at Athens.
label: joy

text_A: I went to spend a night with a relative of mine and there I á found that the bed had been wet the previous night.
label: disgust

text_A: At school I was bad in mathematics. Although my teacher had á admonished me to do my homework, one day I had forgotten to do á it. When my teacher noticed it, I blushed and was ashamed to be á rebuked in front of the other pupils.á
label: shame

text_A: When I was accepted for a course on finance and accounting.
label: joy

text_A: I told my friend about how I had calculated my salary by cheating a á little.  When my friend remarked about it, I understood that it á was wrong to do so, and I felt ashamed.
label: shame

text_A: Tripped on a busy street.
label: anger

text_A: This situation keeps occurring - when my little sister disagrees á with me or vice-versa. We have very similar temperaments and I á always end up feeling angry at her and myself for fighting so á much over unimportant trivial matters.
label: anger

text_A: [ No response.]
label: joy

text_A: I had a cousin whom I loved so much. Unfortunately she passed á away suddenly and one time I had a dream in which I was talking á to her yet she is dead.
label: fear

text_A: It was when I discovered that the girl who I had proposed was a á friend's girlfriend.
label: guilt

text_A: The loss of my mother.
label: sadness

text_A: I thought that I had failed an examination, but when I was á informed about the mark, I saw that I had passed it.
label: joy

text_A: I promised my mother to come home on her birthday, but at last I á was prevented. Nevertheless it would have been possible to go but á I did not.
label: guilt

text_A: Lying to a friend about something that was trivial.
label: shame

text_A: A man was yelling outside my window at 3.00 am, yelling threats, á though not to me.
label: fear

text_A: Spontaneous picnic with sister and friend and children - great.
label: joy

text_A: When I whatched a horror film on a Friday 13th.
label: fear

text_A: Being sexually assaulted (not rape, but passionate kissing) by a á friend's father - he stopped when he was driving me home. I á hadn't wanted the lift, had refused 3 times, and then felt it'd á be rude to refuse again. Was really afraid of what he might do.
label: fear

text_A: It was my father's birthday party when I was asked to bring a á tray of tea and other drinks.
label: shame

text_A: I was with my colleagues and we met an elderly man who was very á drunk, as he approached us he started to undress.
label: shame

text_A: My parents and brother came up over the weekend. We are a very á close family. This was my first year away from home. They brought á one jacko-lantern with a new design. That is the old joke that á we have a great new design - it's always the same.
label: joy

text_A: When I saw a TV program on the North American military plan á called \The startwar\"."
label: fear

text_A: I received a message that my elder brother was involved in a car á accident and was admitted in hospital.
label: sadness

text_A: I stayed at home for a period because I felt depressive and I á neglected my study when people adked me, I told them that I had á freeterm and studied hard. I felt ashamed for my behavior and á lies.
label: shame

text_A: When my roommate forgets to flush the toilet.
label: disgust

text_A: I was happy when at difficult times I could find support in my á friend and my fiancT, I was happy because of their spiritual and á moral help which gave me new power to struggle. I was happy then, á I felt it in my soul.
label: joy

text_A: One of my best friends was found lying flat on the road because á he was drunk and was taken by the police and put in a cell. I á went to see him the following morning, the place was really a á mess and was smelling badly. I didn't like it.
label: disgust

text_A: After my little sister's Graduation from High School my á grandmother became very sick. She passed away a few months later.
label: sadness

text_A: When I passed the whole weekend with my boyfriend, coming back á home on Sunday afternoon he met my parents for the first time.
label: joy

text_A: At an unworthy behaviour of a man, pettiness, stupidity and á mostly at a philistinism.
label: disgust

text_A: I was raped by a friend.
label: fear

text_A: When I began to date, the first gestures of affection made me á feel ashamed. Note: for GUILT go to record n¦231
label: shame

text_A: When my mother left for Kenya.
label: sadness

text_A: Robbery mentioned under sadness.
label: disgust

text_A: To see damaged lettuce (with worms) in the icebox.
label: disgust

text_A: Without the employer's knowledge and even without any á communication their bank accounts were changed and their personal á accounts closed.
label: anger

text_A: Korean judges cheating.
label: anger

text_A: When I found my boyfriend, who I had been dating for a year, at á another girl's house. We had had previous conflicts concerning á the girl, but he had always claimed they were just friends.
label: anger

text_A: I was teaching someone to drive and when we were about to crash I á was scared.
label: fear

text_A: I felt guilty about going out when I should have been studying á for a presentation I had to give on Wednesday the next week.
label: guilt

text_A: At about nine p.m., I went home by bike on a dark cycle-track; á because of lack of time I had to take the short-cut.
label: fear

text_A: Saw in TV that China had the most gold medals in the Asian á Olympic.
label: joy

text_A: Had a letter from my father (usually he does not write to me).
label: joy

text_A: At my temporary job, I have to restrict  others' actions and make á them obey me, and this very often gives me  a feeling of guilt.  I á wish there could be some other way of acting.
label: guilt

text_A: When I failed the M.S.C exam.
label: shame

text_A: My brother wanted me to buy a flute with him but I didn't accept á afterwards I regretted it because he became sad.
label: sadness

text_A: When biking and I felt very bad (problems with heart and á respiration).
label: fear

text_A: I had not told my parents about my bad marks in school. One day, á my father wanted to speak to the teachers. Fortunately I could á influence my parents to take it easy.
label: fear

text_A: Saw two Canadian students boasting about how rich they are in á Canada.
label: disgust

text_A: My paternal grandmother had died. We weren't close but she was á blood. I didn't cry but I was sad, partly due to her death and á partly I think, due to the fact that I couldn't/didn't cry.
label: sadness

text_A: On own reading book. Recall came to mind of slight sexual á exploitation of a female (years ago) i.e. had her on even for á sexual motives.
label: shame

text_A: I couldn't fulfill a promise.
label: guilt

text_A: I was very angry when one day I went to see my girlfriend I á talked to her and could not answer back. She was depressed for á reasons which were not known to me.
label: anger

text_A: When I checked my examination paper and realized that I had been á careless, thoughtless, lazy and hasty so as to make unnecessary á mistakes concerning things I know and understand.
label: anger

text_A: A friend of mine lent me his apartment for holidays and besides á this he was a fine person. Months later I knew that he died á tragically in a moto accident. He was very young, and I felt sad á and couldn't believe it (until today).
label: sadness

text_A: When I heard that my girlfriend was talking behind my back and á looking down on me.
label: anger

text_A: When my friend got very low marks in field work even though he á had worked throughout the year, I had this feeling.
label: disgust

text_A: Eating the last remains of dinner that someone else (unknown to á me) had claimed.
label: guilt

text_A: When my father asked me if I was a communist, at the same time he á made it clear that I should no longer see myself as his daughter.
label: anger

text_A: Once when I was playing table tennis I was already sure that I á would win , but at last I lost the game.
label: anger

text_A: I was sitting in school, waiting for my sister to go home. Suddenly a á boy put fire in a paper and threw it were I was sitting. The á paper didn't get me, but I felt terribly disgusted at this á cowardliness and irresponsibility that caused a great á discussion. We went to the director and he, drunk as always, said á that I was ... attention in school. I felt disgust of this á situation, and of the persons implicated in it.
label: disgust

text_A: When I forgot about a meeting at work.
label: shame

text_A: When I was studying in the library - preparing for a test, two á people sitting next to me talked to each other for 20 minutes.  á There were no other seats so I could not go elsewhere and I did   á not want to interrupt them, so I could only be angry in my heart.
label: anger

text_A: I felt the greatest burst of joy when after being heavily ill for á a long period, my father came back home.
label: joy

text_A: [ Never felt guilty, as I have never done anything which could á make me feel guilty.]
label: guilt

text_A: Skiing down a very icy slope, very fast in white-out conditions. á Out of control with no idea of what I was doing or where I was á heading.
label: fear

text_A: Ever since I have been a child, the sight of any kind of wound.
label: disgust

text_A: A person (a male) told me that he liked me.  He has a problem, he á is a homosexual.
label: shame

text_A: I get angry when my smaller brother misbehaves and talks with indecent á words.
label: anger

text_A: The mother of a person with whom we had been sharing a housing á accused me of trying to rip her off over payment of bills in the á house.
label: anger

text_A: I argued with my father on matters concerning marriage. á Traditionally speaking, I was not supposed to, so I felt guilty á of violating my traditions which I must hold in esteem.
label: guilt

text_A: One day at school I had quarrelled with a school-mate, and á ultimately I had hit him hard.  He, being physically weak had to á visit his doctor and remain absent from school for two days.
label: guilt

text_A: A close friend of the family died.
label: sadness

text_A: When I behaved improperly - fought in a public place.  á Afterwards, I felt guilty about my conduct.
label: guilt

text_A: I was caught doing something I was not supposed to do.  I did á something with the person who caught me (bribe) and even though á he promised not to report me, I am still frightened.
label: fear

text_A: I took my father's car to church one Sunday (I told them that's á where I was going ) I decided instead to go for a drive to the á beach - on the way I got a puncture.
label: guilt

text_A: I felt disgusted one day when, as we were eating, a child á defecated on the table side.
label: disgust

text_A: When my mother quarrelled with my aunt over me.
label: anger

text_A: When finally I found a place to live, I felt relieved, predicting á changes in my life, and I became happy.
label: joy

text_A: One evening when my sisters, brothers and I were watching T.V my á kid brother took a big mirror and reflected light on the french á windows.  I thought that these lights that we could see were á coming from torches annd that it meant that there were thieves á outside.
label: fear

text_A: When they told me that I had been admitted to the faculty of á medicine.
label: joy

text_A: When I broke off with my boyfriend after three years.  It was á quite unexpected for him and there was no particular reason for á the break up, such as someone else.
label: guilt

text_A: I feel anger when things don't come out as I wish.
label: anger

text_A: I refused to lend my homework to a friend.
label: guilt

text_A: When I overate at lunch.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was watching some scenes from the Bertoluchi's film á \Twentieth Century\"."
label: disgust

text_A: I call my mother at least once a week. However last week I á completely forgot. This morning she called me, she thought I felt á ill.
label: guilt

text_A: When I woke up after a nightmare.
label: sadness

text_A: When my first sexual intercourse turned out to be a flop.  I was á in a panic and ended up without an erection.
label: shame

text_A: Receiving close friends form abroad, whom I hadn't seen for á years.
label: joy

text_A: A piece of work was marked as bad by the teachers I and some á fellow students didn't agree with their vague criticism. I felt á myself taken in by the teachers and felt disgust.
label: disgust

text_A: When I was little - Mum caught me telling a lie about who broke á the cup.
label: shame

text_A: I had an appointment with someone at a certain time. The other á person didn't appear.
label: anger

text_A: [ The day I have not worked (academic) hard enough.]
label: guilt

text_A: I was watching T.V with my parents and some pornographic scenes á came on, I felt uncomfortable and tried to distract my parents á attention by talking to them.
label: shame

text_A: At the dentist's, waiting for my turn to come.
label: fear

text_A: My mother was ill and asked me to prpare our lunch. I went to do it, á and while I was working, she stayed behind me telling what I á had, or not to do. I asked her to stop meddling, and to go to á bed. When I went to ask for help to my sister, my mother said that á I was proud, that I asked for help only when I wanted and that I á wasn't able to cook by myself.
label: anger

text_A: While studying chemistry with a friend we became angry with á eachother because we were both fed up.
label: anger

text_A: My girlfriend wanted to breakup for an indefinite amt. of time. á She said that she couldn't commit herself fully to the á relationship without going out with other people. I was her first á boyfriend.
label: sadness

text_A: Squeezed the puppy in the door.
label: guilt

text_A: I was accused of having done something, which I hadn't and got á very angry.
label: anger

text_A: I am ashamed when I am not ready for my seminar in internal á diseases, simply because the assistant professor is a person who á deserves high respect.
label: shame

text_A: I was angry when my boyfriend did not turn up as promised.
label: anger

text_A: It appeared that I gave correct answers to all questions during á an examination of personality while I thought I performed very á badly. Even now, I don't know how I managed it.
label: joy

text_A: I read a book about the sexual phantasies of women; I read about á a woman having sexual intercourse with a dog.
label: disgust

text_A: I went home late one evening and saw that the security lights á were off.  I got inside the gate and just then I realized that á the dogs may be outside.
label: fear

text_A: I had promised myself that I would do one good deed every day.  á One night I saw a beggar whose muscles had been atrophyed.  I á walked passed him thinking that he was feigning.  Later I á realized that he had not been pretending and I had a feeling of á guilt as I had not kept my promise.
label: guilt

text_A: It was when my Instructor awoke me late at night to get prepared á for the training at Military college when he was coming back from á his personal social activities.
label: anger

text_A: There is a mad boy in our village. This boy hit me with a raw á paw-paw in the face.
label: anger

text_A: After I was thrown out of a car in an accident, this resulted in á a fracture.
label: fear

text_A: When I failed two subjects last year.
label: sadness

text_A: The same event described under \shame\"."
label: guilt

text_A: I cut a friend's hair in anger, without any consideration.
label: guilt

text_A: During 7th grade our class mobbed a famale teacher so badly that á she had a breackdown and was hospitalized.
label: guilt

text_A: [ I feel a sense of joy whenever I complete a piece of writing á which is part of my work.  Intense reading also brings me joy.  I á also feel happy when I reminiscent about them.]
label: joy

text_A: We were camping in the mountains, and a friend and I went for a á walk.  It was getting darker and darker and we were not sure of á the right way back.
label: fear

text_A: The person whom I liked most left me for a friend of mine, after á several months of mutual help and a profound knowledge of each á other.
label: sadness

text_A: I felt very angry after one driver had run over my beloved niece.
label: anger

text_A: It happens to me quite often. I can't describe a particular case.
label: guilt

text_A: When I almost did something awful with a friend of mine and á myself.
label: shame

text_A: I was very sad when I was shouted at by Uncle and was told that I á was not to be given school fees because I didn't go to work in á the garden since I had gone to escort my sister to the bus depot.
label: sadness

text_A: An argument that grew out of an ordinary conversation with a á person very close to me, when we should have been having a good á time together.
label: shame

text_A: I was a passenger in a jumbo-jet which was accelerating down the á runway and almost at the point of take-off, when the pilot á suddenly braked and put the engines into reverse thrust, in an á obviously urgent attempt to stop the aircraft. The hostesses show á signs of concern and my first thought was that something was on á the runway in our path and that we were in danger of hitting it.
label: fear

text_A: When I am accused of something I have not done, I get unbelievably á angry.
label: anger

text_A: One evening, I was with a group of friends having a talk.  There á was a very trustful and joyful atmosphere.
label: joy

text_A: When I crashed by bike into an old lady crossing a road and á knocked her down.
label: guilt

text_A: Accidentally dropped a friends camera flash, so that it was á broken.
label: guilt

text_A: When I realized that I avoided two good friends with whom I á always shared toys and sorrows. I made up idle stories to avoid á telling them what happened to me.
label: guilt

text_A: When I was walking on the street, a group of drunk, bawling young á people approached.
label: fear

text_A: When I get home late my father scolds me and this makes me angry.
label: anger

text_A: When we were on holidays my girl-friend had to leave me after 4 á weeks and I had to stay in Turkey for some more weeks because I á had a job there.
label: sadness

text_A: At the death of my friend's father and especially as this á happened ten days before her wedding.
label: sadness

text_A: When I failed the grade 7.
label: shame

text_A: I had thrown with the ashtray a still lighted cigarette in the á plastic wastepaper basket. It had burnt out and my landlords made á me a row that I might had set their flat on fire.
label: guilt

text_A: When one of my closest friends failed to make it to the third á year of university.
label: sadness

text_A: When I first came to the UNZA I did not know the kind of people I á would find here and the kind of behaviour they would have towards á me.
label: fear

text_A: I thought that the guy I had been associating with for over a á year went out 2 or 3 times with a high school girl whom he claimed á not to like.
label: disgust

label: sadness

text_A: When I passed the last exam, which I had doudts about.

text_A: A borrowed car broke down while I was using it.  It was not my á fault, nevertheless I felt guilty.
label: guilt

text_A: I found a baby opposum on the road and took it home and cared for á it for a week. It had to be force-fed and carried in a fur pouch á under my jersey. My father had the vet put it to sleep as he said á they carried diseases.
label: sadness

text_A: When my dog died.  I had reared it for nearly three years.  It á had been ill for several days and had not eaten anything.  One á morning I found it dead.
label: sadness

text_A: I was trying to have sex with my best friend's girl but she did á not agree to it.
label: guilt

text_A: My ex-boyfriend began to date my best friend. After they had been á seeing each other, I found out that he had been sleeping with á another girl, without my friend knowing, I told my friend what he á had been doing behind her back.
label: anger

text_A: Talkiing about the past happy hours with two friends at night in á a camp a few months ago.  We shared our feelings, notions and á every hidden anxiety.  I thought that they cared for me and I á was very happy and satified.
label: joy

text_A: During the Chinese lessons a student often showed off. Moreover á he misbehaved and dressed very badly.  So disgusting !
label: disgust

This caused great fear á through lack of conviction afraid to hurt someone's feelings á despite my own being hurt in the process.
label: fear

label: fear

text_A: My friend did not do well in the examn because I did not help á him.

text_A: I felt ashamed when my parents found out that I had deceived á them.

label: disgust

Seeing them again I felt disgusted at her á attitude.

label: guilt

She sounded as if she had been waiting for the á death of my grandmother.  I had lost a person close to me.  I á felt guilty too as I had been bad to my grandmother of late.  I had not á remained calm when she no longer understood everything so well.
label: sadness

label: sadness

label: guilt

label: guilt

text_A: Having unwanted attention paid to me in my place of work - á harrassment (and sexual harrassment) by another worker - á disgusted by his implications.

text_A: Sometimes, when I'm alone I am seized by this feeling. But it á always helps me to come round and at the same time to judge if it á is worth. Very often this feeling is caused to me by people - á friends who I love and respect.

text_A: When my grandfathers died and I realized how much I would miss á them.
label: sadness

text_A: When my father failed to send me transport money after the á closure of the school.
label: anger

label: fear

label: sadness

label: anger

text_A: My parents appreciate very much me and my boyfriend coming and á have dinner with them at Christmas. However we decided to visit á his parents. My mother was rather disappointed.
label: guilt

label: guilt

I have never drunk that much, á neither before nor after that incident.  I was ashamed because my á mother and my sister had to see me in that state and my father á had to carry me to bed.
